Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Sammy wanted to go to where the people were.  Where might he go? Choices:  A: race track B: populated areas C: the desert D: apartment E: roadblock<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Demostration<n>Input: Sammy wanted to go to...A: race track <n>Rationales: Racetracks are not where people live<n><n>Input: Sammy wanting to go to...B: populated areas<n>Rationales: populated areas are where people live<n>Input: Sammy wants to go to...C: the desert<n>Rationales: deserts are not where people live.<n>Input: Sammy wishing to go to...D:  an  apartment<n>Rationales:  apartments are where people live.<n><n>Input: Sam wants to go to...E: 1 roadblock<n>Rationales: roadblocks are not where people <n>live.<n><n>### Answer:  A<n>

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What home entertainment equipment requires cable? Choices:  A: radio shack B: substation C: cabinet D: television E: desk<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>Input:<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>#### 39<n>Answer:   39<n><n>### Input<n><n>Input: The bank statement has a total due of 497.80$.  The bank charges a monthly fee of 2.15$.  How much, in dollars and cents, should I pay to the bank to satisfy the entire debt?<n><n>### Demonsration:<n>- We don't use a cent symbol, but we know that's the last digit.<n><n>#### 495.65<n>Answer: 495.45<n><n>### Input and Demonstration:  Input 125 dollars and 23 cents How much change, in dollars and censts?<n><n>#### 275.00<n>Answer: (275)+$(23)<n>### Input: What is 231 x 201?<n><n>### Response and Demonstration for Input:<n>Answer: <<231 x 00=0>>0<n>The answer is 0.<n><n>### Note:<n>Remember when answering these <n><n>1.  Answer in the format of <n>  a.   The task number. <n>  b.   Roughly estimate your thought process.<n>  c.   Your answer.<n>  <n><n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where is a business restaurant likely to be located? Choices:  A: town B: at hotel C: mall D: business sector E: yellow pages<n><n>### Response:		Select the best answer<n>Answer: C<n>Explanation: I chose to go to a new business and it was on the mall so i chose C a shopping mall<n>#### 300<n>Answer: C<n><n>### Instructions: Solve the problem.<n><n>### Answers<n><n>Answer: 99%<n><n>#### 1<n>Answer: -85%<n><n>### Instructi:<n>Answer the question.<n><n>Input: A store sells 2 dozen apples for $2.05.  I want some.  How many do I need to get $20.50 worth?<n><n>Given: We know that $20.5 = <<12 * $0.205>>12*(1/2)0.205<n><n>So how do we use the information given here to make a reasonable guess at how much of our 2 dozen we need?.<n>The answer is: 2 dozen

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What type of person typically contracts illness? Choices:  A: hospital B: head C: sick person D: elderly person E: doctor's office<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>I think it has to be B since a healthy person is usually not in the hospital, a sick person can be in either because they have an illness or are in the hospital under care, the doctor is also in one of the facilities, in the head, a healthy person would not have a disease in their head, and old people could be in the office. The only person there that is sick is the person in the hospital so he has to answer B.<n><n>### Answer (by 66c0d360@gmail.com):<n>B since a sick person is always in a hospital and since a doctor's office is filled with sick people he could contract an illness, but it's the sickest who is the most vulnerable to diseases due to weakened immune systems caused by the illness, but if you're healthy you're not contracting the illness.<n><n>### Input<n>A man is purchasing a book for a class. He has to have the book before Friday, March 8. He plans on buying the book Monday, March 4.  If the book is $50 and there is a 10% discount, what is the best price he can buy the book?<n><n><n>#### 47.3<n><n>Rationales: Discounts = discount rate*original rate.<n>Because the original rate was $50, the discount rate of 10% means that the discount is the product of 10% and the original rate.<n>Discount rate 10% = 10cents/dollar<n>Discount = 10% * 50<n>10% discount = 10% of  50 = 0.5 of 50 = $25<n><n>Sale price is the original price minus the discount. Sale price = 50 - 25 = $25<n>#### 47<n><n>Answer: A sale price was $25.<n><n>### Response<n>The best price to buy a book at the 10% discout from the original price is Sale price = $50 - 20 % (1/10) = 50 - $5 = $25 or 47.3% in a word.<n><n>### Question<n>Tommy pays $0
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Which entrance would you use if you do not want to use the back entrance? Write an appropriate answer to the prompt that follows.<n><n>Input: I had enough time to get everything done.<n><n>### Response (choose the choice that best answers the prompt): Choices: The completion of the task was<n><n>A: incomplete.<n><n>B: incompetent.<n><n>C: incomplete.<n><n>D: competent.<n><n>E: very difficult.<n><n>F: easy.<n><n>G: impossible.<n><n>H: on time.<n><n>I: ahead of time.<n><n>Answers: F<n><n><n>### Input :What is this type of business? Choices:  A: television B: attic C: corner D: they cannot clean corner and library during football match they cannot need that E: ground<n><n>### Response:		Corner<n><n>### Input<n>#### #1:A grocery store is trying to determine if the demand for their product has increased by more than 50% over the last 5 years. This product is unique in that it has a limited number of users. For the past 5 years, there have always been 1,000 people that will buy this grocery store product if it is on sale. Suppose demand last year was 2,000 sales of the product. Based on this information, can you correctly answer the previous question?<n><n>#### #2:There is a group of 10,000 people working a construction site. The construction site is about to complete a building and the 10,045th worker is about to finish. How many people remain to be paid overtime for working on Saturday and Sunday?<n><n>### Rationales: #1<n>For 5 years:<n>The maximum # of people is:<n>560<n>For 5 years 560+560+5*560+5 is summed together,<n>12760 people<n>2000+12760= 14760<n>If 14761 sales occur then, by definition, the 5 year average of # of sales per year is 2953<n>#1 is true.<n><n><n>##### #2<n><n>Number of 1000 people:<n><n>560<n>Max limit + 5 times limit<n><n>The limit is only reached after 5 years, so<n>560+5= 560+25<n>25 limit is added one more time, 560+75<n>275(5)<n>560+275 (5)<n>1000 (with the limit + limit)<n><n>Total limit at which there is 1000 workers is 1001 (5)(1000=1001)<n><n>So if there are 10045 workers, then there need to be 8 overtime workers<n>8 times = 56 per day<n>56/1000 =.0056<n>56(6=35) workers are added together<n><n>35(6=210)<n>2

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What would a camper need to do before he or she can start cooking food? Choices:  A: make breakfast B: go hiking C: pack or bag D: light fire E: grab a match<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choices: A, E<n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where would you find a seafood restaurant in the east coast of North America? Choices:  A: maine B: boston C: beach town D: coastal cities E: ocean<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Input a new text to this task to get its answer.<n>```ruby<n>puts(<<~EOF)<n>The capital of Florida is Tallahassee.<n>EOF<n>```<n><n>```ruby<n>>> The capital of Florida is Tallehassee.<n>=> false<n>```<n><n>### Demands: Write a program.<n><n>### Inputs:<n>```ruby<n>>> name = 'Hall'<n>>> age = 33<n>>> height = 4<n>>> weight = 100<n>>> gender = 'M'<n>>> color = 'brown'<n>>> eyes = 'blue'<n>>> hair ='short'<n>>> height = 3.21<n>>> weight = '343.0'<n>>> color = 3.4<n>>> eyesees = 'purple'<n>>> hair = 3.44<n>>> eyessee ='red'<n>>> color = true<n>>> gender = 'B'<n>>> color = false<n>>> gender = 'L'<n>>> weight = 240<n>>> age = 23<n>>> name = 'Jane'<n>>> height = '5.2'<n>>> hair = false<n>>> age = '26'<n>>> name = 'Granny'<n>>> weight = false<n>>> age='26'<n>>> weight = '1'<n>>> name = false<n>>> eyehair = 'blonde'<n>>> hair = %w{red brown short blue green long}<n>```<n><n>## Demo:<n><n>```ruby<n>put name, height, weight, eyes, gender, color, hair, age<n><n>Jane = 33<n>5.2<n>100<n>blue<n>f<n>short<n>Hall = b<n>true<n>90<n>false<n>26<n>Granny = 25<n>3.21<n>240<n>eyessee<n>4.04<n>L<n>80<n>Jane<n>5.2<n>short<n>L<n><n>```<n><n>## Answer:<n><n>```ruby

When will they break even? (For example, if they spent $6,000 the two cars, then they broke even on the drive.)<n><n>#### Rationale :<n>3,888 was the total. Let's find the x to match it.<n>3+8=9<n>So if total = 3+8 then the price would be 9.<n>8+3+8=19.<n>4*19=76.<n>x+76=3888 so 3888-76=3812, which is the break even point.<n>#### Answer : 3812<n><n>### Input(Spoiler Alert): After losing a fight with a mugger, a 35-year-old man was admitted to the emergency room where he underwent a number of tests before being admitted for observation. How much, in dollars was his hospital bill for his injuries?<n><n>### Rationale :<n>35*519-600 : 1603<n><n>### Answer : _________________________<n>

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What state south of Kentucky and north of Alabama will you find people playing the fiddle? Choices:  A: alabama B: tennessee C: violin case D: music store E: bow and strings<n><n>### Response:		I will go with 'C', TENNESSEE and here's the reason - it's the home of the Tennessee Ernie Ford Show and the Fiddle-Faddle Dance Orchestra and it's only a 10 hour drive from Alabama. Here is the full answer.<n><n>E: bow and strings<n>A: alabama<n>D: music store<n>B: tennessee<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>This task describes a common task, but does not provide complete or clear instructions for performing the task. Write a paragraph that describes this task and provides specific instructions that will enable a reader to complete the task.<n><n>This task is to provide someone with specific instructions concerning renting an apartment for a specified number of days.<n>You will also need to include the cost of each additional day of rent, which is $20.00 per additional day.<n>Here are example results:<n><n>| Rental | 1 day | 2 day | 3 day | 4 day | 5 day | 6 day |<n>|---|---|---| ---| --- |---|---|<n>| 1st Rental | 20.00 | 180.00 |240.00 |300.0 |360.00 |420.00|<n>| 2nd  Rental |240. |1920.|2400.|3000.|3600.|4200.|<n>| 3rd  Rental | 720. | 1720.|1920. |2340| 2760 | 2760|<n><n>##### If I had to rent my apartment out for 5 days, the cost to rent it for those 5 days would be:<n><n>##### 5th day:<n><n>##### $420.0 per day X 5 = $ $2,100.0<n><n>### Instructor Feedback:Student's response: This is the correct answer.<n><n>### Feedback for Instructor:<n><n>The written response is correct. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What kind of place could have a seafood restaurant? How many T-shorts does she have?<n><n>### Response : The answer is 4. She is short of 2.<n><n>### Output:You want to purchase 25 apples. The store can only provide you with 21 apples. Choices:  A. gain weight B. augment C. dispare  D.  make larger E. expand<n><n>A - does nothing with the meaning<n><n>B - she wanted less, which cannot be augment<n><n>C - she was trying to get rid of her tummy<n><n>D - she was trying to reduce the size of her tummy which is a larger size<n><n>E - increase size of tummy. If the people are not communicating, collaboration slows.<n><n>### Input:(D) The student is interested in the salary for the different sports coaches. The pay is not given in dollars, but in years of working experience.<n>(A)  The 10-year coach receives $77,000 in a year.<n>(B)  The second coach is on the cusp of receiving an increase in salary.<n>(C)  The high school football coach is 25 years into her career.<n>(D) The 35-year coach is paid more than the average salary.<n>Answer: Choices:  A and E<n><n>### Input:- A. The 10-Year Coach is at 11 years and makes $145k per year.- B. The 12-Year Coach is now the 13-Year Coach making $125k per year.<n><n>### Response:- 10-Year coach has been at it for 11 years. There is a 10% increase for each year of experience.<n><n>#### A<n>Coach makes $145,000 / 10 years = $14,500 dollars per year.  Coach has been at it for over 10 years.  There is a 12.5% increase for every 1 year of experience, so the 12 year coach should make $130,416 per year and the 13 year coach should make $287,315 for a total of $417,731 for the 12 and 13 year coaches.<n><n>#### B<n>Coach makes $87,500 / 11 years = $7,865 dollars per year.  There is not yet a increase for every 1 extra year of service.  It will be the next year 12 year mark that there will be a 12.63% increase.  But the coach should make $92,700 per year next year and $106,881 the next year. And the coach at 13 years will make $125,000

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:A person lived in my what? Choices:  A: demonstration B: conference C: building D: garage E: mouth<n><n>### Response:		<n>The garage<n><n><n><n><n>### Input:"What is the temperature in Canton this morning?"<n><n>### Response:"It is -287°C"<n><n>### Input:@"How many hours of video are on our movie list?"<n>```<n>if statement:<n>if 750 > 580:<n>output 175+35 = 210<n>output 2(175+32) = 6<n><n>if 210 + 187 + 158 + 21 + 84 > 210 +32 + 58 + 58 +32:<n>output 210+35+187+158+21+84 = 1016<n>```<n><n>### Inputs: You want to determine someone’s weight by multiplying their height by 0.002. However, in this case you are calculating the weight to convert to pounds of that unit.  How many ounces are in a pound?<n><n>### Response": 453 and 6748" <n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:At the end of your meal what will a waiter do? Choices:  A: serve food B: eat C: set table D: serve meal E: present bill<n><n>### Response:		C

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:"There are 10 apples on an apple tree.  Three fall off.  Now there are X apples."  What is this an example of? Choices:  A: park B: coloring book C: garden center D: math problem E: gravity<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### A<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input: 10 apples are on a tree.  Three apples fall off.  Now, there are how many apples on the tree?<n><n>### Response<n><n>#### B<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Input:(3+5+2)+10=<<>><n><n>### Response:(3+5+8)-(1)+6=<<>><n><n>(In this response, there should be two 7's as in the solution, but it seems like there is an extra space between the two 7's when you edit the answer on a web form.  The actual answer, of course, looks like a single 7.)<n><n>Answer: <<>><n><n>#<n><n>Input: How much will it cost to buy 18 packages of ice cream at $2.25 per package?<n><n>Input: Which answer choice shows a simple fraction such as 1/2, 2/5, or 3/4?  Choices: A: 3/5 B: 6/5 C: 7/5 D: 6/7 E: 3/4<n><n>### Response 1:<n><n>#### A <IMAGE><n><n><n><n>### Response2:<n><n>#### B <IMAGE><n><n>#### C <IMAGE><n><n>### Response3:<n><n>#### D <IMAGE><n><n>#<n><n>#<n><n>### Summary<n><n>You have completed the lesson "Multiple Choice".
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Ben was an alcoholic and was in an accident.  Because of his mistake, he spent 8 years somewhere. Where was he? Choices:  A: prison B: bridge C: locked up D: homeless shelter E: neighbor's house<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer: E. Neighbors house.<n><n>* It could be the only safe place that he could live during those years.<n><n>### Input<n>Ben's car runs out of gas in the middle of an unmapped road in New Mexico.  He has two cans of gasoline, and a full-size gas can.  What is the most effective way to carry those three containers (taking the combined weight of all three containers into account) to get Ben across the state line?  (For example "carry the three containers as fast as possible down the unmapped road and hope you get across the state line before the gas runs out" is not an effective solution.)<n><n>### Response<n>The cans could weigh up to 12 ounces apiece, and the gas can weighs 15 pounds.<n><n>* Carry them all at once across the unmapped road in the vehicle.<n><n>### The most efficient way is to drive the 25 miles to the nearest town to purchase gas and to have the car serviced..<n>1.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>### Input.<n>How long does it take to drive from New York City to Los Angeles?<n><n>### Answer<n>48 hours.<n><n>### If you make one quick stop along the way, how much of the driving is done at 60 miles an hour or better?<n><n>### Response.<n>The 25 percent will be done at 60.<n><n>#### 25<n>Answer: 25<n><n>### For this chapter, you will have the opportunity to apply your new skills to solve multiple-choice items. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Fatigue was stronger than temptation.  In a nearby city there was an all-night dance.  It was crowded, the music was throbbing, the men and women were dancing until daybreak.  Above all, it was warm.  And warm was what the soldier needed.<n><n>"'I am going to the dance,' the soldier thought.  He washed his dirty, sweaty face in cold water from his canteen. Then he pulled his shirt and trousers on, buttoning them as he walked.  He pulled his boots on.<n><n>"He thought for a moment.  'But my feet hurt,' he murmured.  Then he said, 'Just a short while.'<n><n>"He pulled his jacket on.  It was very tight.  He could hardly breathe.  He pulled his helmet on and tightened the chin strap.  The visor prevented him from seeing.  Finally he could not see.<n><n>"He pulled on his gloves.  They were soaked by sweat.  He would have preferred not to wear them at all.  He pulled on his boots.  With difficulty, he squeezed his feet into the boots, tugging and pulling his feet.  Finally they were on.  Now, he said, 'Just one more try, feet.'<n><n>"He thought about the warmth, felt it on his face.  His body shivered.  'No,' he whispered, 'those feet will be cold and painful in a few minutes.  If I am to keep dancing with her, I must have warm feet.'<n><n>"Five minutes later, he was inside the dance hall. He looked for a drink, found one, and then looked again for

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. What is the average annual spending per person on clothing if 1,200 people spend an even distribution of $5 more or less than the average?<n><n>### Response<n>The answer is $595.00 (595)<n><n>### Correct Answers Explanation<n>1. Let X = average annual spending<n>2. $1200 dollars =1 * $1200 or $300000<n>3. 1/1200 = (1/30000) x (30000/(30000+1200))<n>4. $26/1200=$26/(3*(25+1200)= 0.0055<n>5. X=$25+(0.005*0.025)= $595.15<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>### Input Instructions:<n>There are 15 seats in a stadium.<n><n>There are 12 fans who want to attend the game.<n><n>Who else, if anyone, must be present in order to play the game?<n><n>### Answer Instructions:<n>The correct answer is 2<n><n>### Correct Response and Rationale Explanation:<n>1. We must find the least common multiple of (15, 12).<n>2. (15,12)=(3,2)<n>3. The least commom multiple of 2 and 12 which is 24, cannot be divided into 12 and 15, therefore there must 2 to make up the quorum.<n><n>### Sample Input:<n>A baseball team consists of 9 batters, 9 pitchers, and a catcher. (For example, how much would the average employee that is 30 work out to versus how much that person should make if they had a degree? So while college graduates don't have experience, it is almost equal to the amount of experience a non-graduate who is the same age would have.)<n>I think that there are people in this country that would gladly pay a million dollars an hour to see a doctor instead of paying $60,000 an hour!<n><n>The value of your degree will depend on a number of factors.<n>I was a student at the University of South Carolina that took me two and one fourth years to graduate. Choices:  A: break easily B: shattering C: melt D: bend E: hold water<n><n>### Response:		The correct choice is A: break easily.<n><n>### Rationale:Glass is the name given to a variety of materials that are made of a mixture of sand, soda, lime, and other minerals. They are very brittle in nature and get shattered when struck very hard. This is because in thin glass the material between two particles becomes much smaller and is very brittle and this is why this type of glass breaks quite easily. Another point to note is the thickness of glass:<n><n>Thin: Less than 8 millimeter in thickness<n>Thick: More than 8 millimeter in<n><n><n>### Instructions:  A 158-m-long freight train is moving at 48 kmh.<n>Rationals: A freight train is a railway vehicle which is used for carrying people and material, such as goods and other types of vehicles. Freight trains carry goods and materials to different cities. So by definition, a freight train always consists of a locomotive and at least one car or a wagon. A freight train is different from a passenger train in that is that a passenger train always has more than one freight car. <n><n>To solve this problem we have to find the distance of 48km/hr and divide it by the speed of the train which is 4m /s.<n><n>48m divide/divide by 4<n><n>Then we would say<n><n>Ratio: 12 to 4<n><n>4 m /s * 12<n><n>We can then say 50m /s which is the distance moved by every second.<n><n><n>We are then left with a ratio 158m to x<n><n>We can then simply solve by finding the missing x.<n><n>8 = x<n><n>Then from here we can say that 14 units of this train are 80m<n><n>158m - 146m<n><n><n><n>We are left with the value of x<n><n>We can say 12<n><n>The missing distance =48<n><n>### Input; Given that 2n2  and 632, which of the following is the value of n.<n><n>### Answer: 2<n><n>### Rational: A number raised to the second power is known as square root of that number. When n is positive
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:John loved competing because he was very competitive.  He liked being about to divide people into what categories? Choices:  A: winners and losers B: perform better C: might win D: losses E: enemies<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>#### Answer:  A<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write about each of the given topics under the following instructions. Your writing must focus on a specific topic. Your writing must be organized, logical, and thoughtful, and properly cite any sources used.<n><n>#### Topic:The Importance of a College Degree<n><n>RATIONALE:A college degree is very important because once a student earns their degree they know the knowledge and the information that they have been studied over the past four years. Once the student earns their degree it is going to make them marketable for their desired job. They will also know it is not just about what the person is studying or a degree but it is what the person does as it goes to their work ethic on how they want to advance in there desired jobs.<n><n>#### Topics: How a Good Essay has a Counterargument and a Refinement of the Argument.<n><n>RATIONALES:The counterargument/refinement allows the author to take the reader to another perspective. It helps the reader to consider and weigh both sides of the argument.  It gives the reader another perspective and allows the writing to be very appealing and well rounded to the readers, the counterargument is the "devil's advocate" of the argument. By adding a counterargument to the essay the reader is able to see multiple points of the writing and it makes the reader to be more aware of the topic.<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What could prevent someone from buying chistmas presents? Choices:  A: happiness B: lack of money C: stress D: relief E: exhiliration<n><n>### Response:		The most important thing to do on Xmas is just to be happy.<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Traveling underwater has many dangers, such as low visibility causing what? Choices:  A: disorientation B: due to C: meeting new people D: getting somewhere E: relocation<n><n>### Response:		D. The correct answer is 'C'<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>| Choice | Reason                                                                                                            |<n>| ------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |<n>| "A"    | Because low visibility in the ocean can make one disoriented, it's difficult to navigate and it can even lead to drowning. |<n>| "B"    | Due to low visibility in the ocean, it can cause disorientation. However this doesn't cause relocation.                |<n>| "D"    | Relocation is not one of the choices that matches the context.                                                     |<n>| "E"    | The context doesn't talk about underwater navigation or transport. |<n><n>### Input (continued):<n><n>#### In a two-player game, the probability of winning any given game is.5.<n>What is the probability of losing?<n><n>##### 1/2<n><n>### Rationale:<n><n>Answer:<n><n>It is 50% in a two-player game. It works out that there is one-half probability of getting X. For X=0, you get -X. So we have two options. Since there is no number greater than 1, the probability is 1/2, which is given by 50%.<n><n>Note: It is given in the last question that the probability of winning is 1/2.<n><n>### Input : A group of people was surveyed to determine where they purchased their last pair of shoes. The answers are as follows:<n><n>(A)<n>(A, B, C)<n>(B, A, C)<n>(D, C, B)<n>(C)<n>(A, C, D)<n>(B, C, D) The distribution was most likely:<n><n>### Answer (continued): 2 out of 3<n><n>### Ratiocination :<n><n>Given the above information, we have 6 answers. There are 2 possible combinations in which the shopping is done in three different places. That is, A, B or C and A, C or B or C. Now suppose shopping is done at all places. So, there are 6 possibilities which will be 1 combination. But there is only 2 choices which will be 1/2
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where are there more telephone booths? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:How might a person address someone who is leaving? Choices:  A: further cause B: wave goodbye C: attempt suicide D: insulting them E: thank god<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Input<n>Rules<n>| Question Statement | Answer Choice | Rationales  | Point Value  |<n>|-|-|-|<n>|What should Drew do if he finds a $2.32 bill? | Drew should put it in a piggy bank. | His parents won’t miss it and he can save it for a rainy day. | 5 | |<n>|What was the purpose of Rice’s mission? | Increase the security measures at the U.S. embassy | To improve their communications by installing a satellite dish. | 5 |<n>|How did people at the embassy feel when Rice was there? | Happy | They are happy that they are safer. | 5 | <n><n>### Response<n>C 5 <n><n>### Rationales<n>Rice’s mission was not to increase the security measures at the embassy.  The answer was to improve their communications by install a satellite dish.<n><n>### Point Value<n>C 5<n>

Student B solves the 200 problem, but Student B does not explain to the students what solution of which problem (if any) is true.  The teacher tells the class that if the 200 is true, then one of the two problems is possible, and if the 150 is true then both problems are possible.  Both students report that the teacher’s statements are incorrect.  Which of the two students is correct?<n>#### 200<n>Answer: A<n><n>Input: In the first 100 days of President Obama’s first term, the president signed 64 bills into law. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What place of work might you find a hairpin? Choices:  A: hair salon B: hair of woman C: barber shop D: pincushion E: woman's hair<n><n>### Response:		B: hair of woman<n><n>### Instructions:The next problem is a math word problem. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where is microphone boom likely to be used to record an album? Choices:  A: radio station B: recording studio C: concert D: tv studio E: new york<n><n>### Response:		<n>Microphone boom is used in a concert as it amplifies the sound produced by musicians and amplify their singing and other sounds to the whole world.<n><n>#  Instructions<n><n>### Part 1: Find the number pairs in the list where the two numbers<n>are related by a rule.<n><n>### Part_2: Write a response for each of the following that correctly uses<n>the numbers in the list to complete the rule statement.<n><n>### Sample Input: 36 24 16 32 10 What is the rule for this list? (4)(4)<n><n>### Sample Output: <n>4 and 4<n><n>### Instructions:In part 1, find the number pairs in the following list<n>using the same rule. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: personal B: special C: shiny D: rare E: irregular<n><n>### Response:		If a Pokemon is a "rare" Pokemon, it is the common Pokemon with a value of between $15 and$100. If it is "common" it is under $10.  If it is "special", it is above $10 but below $15.<n><n>#### Rare<n>>>Common: $<10<n>>>Special: $<$10<n>>>Rare: >$10<n><n>#### Special<n>>>Common: $<-10<n>>>Special $<-$10<n>>>Pokemon: >$10 and <$15<n><n>### Input:"The sum of all rational numbers", "all real numbers", "all integers", and "all irrational numbers" are all what? How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Of the 11 million people who answered the survey, 6 million drank soda, 44\% of soda drinkers also drink bottled water, and 2.5 million drank bottled water only.<n>Rationales: 75% of the survey participants answered that drank soda or bottled at least one of these items daily.<n>Soda- 6 million X 0.44: = 2.64 million people both drank water and soda.<n>Bottled Water- 2.5 million / 11 million = 23% so the 2.5 million people drank bottled water.<n>#### 2.5 million<n><n>Answer:<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The dog ran to the front window and barked, this is because of a presence at the what? Choices:  A: building B: friend's house C: classroom D: window E: front door<n><n>### Response:		E<n>### Answer:E<n><n>### Rationale:This question asks what the dog barks at. I think that it should be A front door since the dog is barking at the house.<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days.
