His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where will a bullet projectile be found during a war? Choices:  A: battle field B: museum C: weapon D: canon E: tornado<n><n>### Response:		 --------------------------- D (canon){A-to-D - 1 letter, D-to-E - same}<n><n>### Description: When a bullet is fired it is launched on a trajectory from the barrel of the weapon. The trajectory of the projectile is determined by a variety of factors including gravity, kinetic energy, force, mass of the projectile and the mass of the object that is shot through (assuming non-zero mass). The trajectory is dependent on both the weapon and the projectile.<n><n>### Test:How did the bullet get there? {A-D}<n><n>### Instructions: <n><n>### Demystifying the Tasks from the Perspective of an Educator<n><n>#### 199<n><n>#### 400<n><n>#### 803<n><n>#### 743<n><n>### Question:Write this in your own words and answer the question.<n><n>## Test:How did the shark got there?
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:A night owl is what you'd head at sunset and you'd hear a what at sunrise? Choices:  A: morning person B: early bird C: lark D: early riser E: rooster<n><n>### Response:		A person who would go to bed at sunset is called what? A: a night owl B: wake C: bird D: nocturnal E: insomniac<n><n>### Input<n>Fly<n>Squirrel<n>Scoops<n>Stuff<n>Bird<n>Squirrels<n>Birds<n>Scoops<n><n>#### <n>Answer:<n>#### <n>Input:<n>Nina has received the results from some of her biology experiments. She needs to identify the type of experiment each sample shows evidence for evolutionary theory. She has a set of five trials in which she tests and records evidence of evolutionary theory for different items. How many trials are there?<n>The table below shows the experiments Nina carried out during her investigations.<n><n>Experiment<n>1. 3<n>2. 5<n>3. 5<n>4. 4<n>5. 2<n><n>What conclusion would be most reasonable to report?<n><n>#### <n><n># 9
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where is small knight likely to be found? Choices:  A: fairy tale B: castle C: middle ages D: chess board E: doll house<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is B (Answer: Castle)<n><n>### Input::The length of a baseball in feet is between 88 and 91 feet.  The width of the baseball diamond is approximately half the length.  If both the diamond's length and width are 90 feet, what are the dimensions of a baseball field?<n><n>### Response::The correct answer is C (Answer: The length is 300 feet and the width is 300.01 feet.)<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n>The following table was generated by a spreadsheet. Write a function that calculates the percentages of different types of fruit in a sample.<n><n>#### Input:<n><table><n><thead><n><tr><n><th>French</th><n><th>Italian</th><n><theta>Percent</theta><n></tr><n></thead><n><tbody><n><tr> <td>9%</td> <td>25%</td> <th>F</th> </tr><n><tr>  <td>10%</td> <TD>16%</TD> <TH>A</th> </tr></td><n></tbody><n></table><n><n>#### Response:<n>The correct answer is D

A:  woman  B:  feminist  C:  lady  D:  feminine  E:  man<n><n>###  answer:  <n>It is a word that is used when it does not have to be referred to as the gender.<n>Woman A: lady and lady B: woman<n><n>### Input : In the following sentence identify 5 words that are not related to "fossil-fuel dependent" that can be inserted and still make sense. Choices:  ( A:  Magma and Rocks   B:  Plates  C:  Core ,  D:  Magma and Core  E:  Core and Rocks)<n><n>### answer:<n>The lithosphere is made of magma and rocks.<n><n>### Input - What is the smallest prime number from the three choices?  A:  The first  B:  The square Root Of 2  C:  The square Root of 2 Cube B:  The square root C: The smallest<n><n>### answer  :  What is the smallest prime from the three choices?<n><n>- The answer is A<n><n>### Question :  Write 13-17 as two digits integers<n><n>- The answer should be 94<n><n>### Question  :  You put a check mark in two of the statements. <n>- The ones that say a dog and a wolf looks the same.<n>- The ones that says  dog, coyote and wolf looks the same<n>- The ones that  says Dog, Fox and Coyote look the same<n>- The one that says  Dog and Fox look the same<n><n>### Answer:<n>What is the main point of  what can you say
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where would a Martian find the Indian Ocean? Choices:  A: asia B: southern hemisphere C: planet D: east E: earth<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Justification: "The Indian Ocean is an ocean basin predominantly surrounded by the southern half of the African continent and, on the north, the Arabian peninsula." <https://oceanservice.noaa.gov/facts/atlantic.html><n><n>### Input:"The Indian Ocean is an Atlantic ocean basin predominately surrounded by the southeast corner of the African continent."<n>"The Indian Ocean is an Ocean in the western Pacific Ocean partially surrounded by the southern half the African continent and the southeast corner of Asia."<n>"The Indian ocean is a body of water that surround the Indian subcontinent."<n>"The Indian oceans surrounding the Indian subcontinent (on the northern Indian Ocean)"<n>All say it surrounds India, not another land mass.<n><n>### Answer: B<n><n>### Justifications: Choices are all accurate but A is the only one that is specific to a Martian's perspective.<n>I'll need to test that this is the case as opposed to the case for A not specifying anything<n><n>### Input A: You need to replace an incandescent bulb with a compact fluorescent light (CFL) bulb.  The switch to CFL bulbs is part of the Green Initiative onboard the ship.  Each CFL bulb has different power levels. Use the chart provided to determine which type of bulb you need for your specific replacement.<n>![Cylinder 1_03](/assets/2020-10-14-Gateway2.assets/2021-04-02-Writing.assets/Gateway3/Input-05.jpg)<n>![Cylinder1_02](/assets/2011-04-22-CCS-Writing.samplaced.assets/Gate2/Input-06.jpg)<n><n>### Answer B: 20 Watts<n><n>### Justificaiton: CFL bulbs are rated in terms of equivalent watts so if you are replacing 40 watts it would be 20 watts.<n><n>### Input B: You are on the USS _________________. You complete your 5th month in the service.<n>![Cylinders
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:If I have to keep track of how much oxygen there is, where am I? Choices:  A: air B: water C: earth D: space shuttle E: tunnel<n><n>### Response:		<n>Air is a gas.<n>

There is a $20 entrance fee, and each guest is charged $2 for every hour they stay.  How much would it cost someone who stays for 6 hours?<n><n>### Dem:<n><n>Answer: 8<n><n>### Input:\<n>\[ (5x+3)^2 + 3x^2 -5 < (4x^2+4)\]  <n>\[ => x^2 +\frac32 x-\frac52 <= 4\]$    <n>\[ \therefore  x \in [-\frac32,\frac52]\]<n><n>### Demr:<n><n>### A. Answer: 4<n><n>### Input\<n>The speed of an airplane is $75\,\text{miles per hour}$. How many hours will it take the airplane to travel $3,500\,\text{miles}$?\<n>A. 70 hours<n>B. 72 hours<n>C. 73 hours<n>D. 74 hours<n><n>### A: 74<n><n>### Response\<n><n>### Input<n>The following table provides the total distance traveled for all vehicles in the 2003 Paris Marathon, including the time that each of them spent in starting the race.\<n>\[ 465\,\text{milers}\\ 11.3\,\text{hours}\\ 1376\,\text{participants}\]<n>The table also gives the average (arithmetic mean) time that it took for each participant to complete the race.<n>\[ TA + \dfrac{TA(Ts)}{N}\]<n>\[TA = 75\,\text{minutes}\\ \overline{T} = 1.3 \,\text{hours}\]<n><n>### Response<n>[1,1444;]

She then rented the same car for another week and paid $585. How much was paid to rent the car for one week?<n><n>### Demostration: <n>Anita paid $525 to rented the car for the first week and $585 for the second week for a total of $1110 <n>$525/1=$<<525/1=525>>525 and $585/1=$<<$585/1=585>>585 then the $1110 will be divided by 2 $1110/2=$<<1110/3=555>>555<n>Thus $525+$585=$<<525+$555=1080>>1080<n>To rent for one week $1080/1=<<1080/2=540>>540 is the answer<n>#### 540<n>Answer:540

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where do farmers keep toothpicks? Choices:  A: mouth B: grocery store C: constructing models D: shed E: box<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Input A math equation? What will be the result? Choices: F: 2a + (13 - 8a)<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Input What is the opposite of "fair"? Choices: G: poor H: ugly I: great J: white<n><n>### Response I/M<n><n>### Input Choice: K: no more money L: good M: fair N: out of money O: rich<n><n>### Response K/L/M/N/O<n><n>### Input Suppose you need to buy two items. The first is a book that costs $14.00 and the second is a toy that costs $9.00. Then, the total cost is about what percent of the total income? Choice 1: P: 30%<n><n>### Response P<n><n>### Input<n>The car-rental agcy charges $30/ day for a car, or $$35 for the first week for rentals that last an entire week or longer<n>Jennie rentd a car for 10 days. How much in dollars did she paid for the rental? Choice: Q: $350<n><n>### Response Q<n>### Input<n>If a car costs $20,000 how many years can you save 5%/mo and have enough for the down payment?<n><n>### Response E/A<n>### Input<n>A pig sold for $240. The owner bought the 75-pound pig for ____. <n><n>### Response C/B/D<n>### Input<n>You want to buy shoes for your daughter. The store prices are $2800, $2000, $1500 which shoes do you buy? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Of the remaining 17%, how much faster do the next 3 people solve the problem than the first three? <n><n>### Response<n>17% of people solve problems in 1 year while 83% of them take 3 years. The remaining 3 people will take one year and half since the first 3 took 1 year to solve. 83/(2/83)=<<83/2/83=41>>41/2=<<41/2=20.5>>20.5<n>####20.5<n>Answer: 20.5<n><n>### Response <n>When you take 48% of 145, what number do you obtain?<n><n>### Response  <n>To split 145 by 48, you take 48 and create a dividend of 50/48 = <<48, 50>>32.33<n>This means 145 ÷ 32.33 = <<145/32.33=4.5>>5.593<n>#### 5.593 <n>Answer: 5.59<n><n>### Input : A certain shop sells a shirt at 5% more than it sells it elsewhere. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:If I have a vintage, decorative light source in my possession, what is it likely to be? Choices:  A: sun B: sky C: candle D: house E: lamp<n><n>### Response:		<n><ul><li>A: sky</li><li>B: candle</li><li>C: lamp</li><li>D: sky</li><ul><n><n><p>  This instruction asks the program to select an option in a multiple choice array. The output selection is A: sky. </p><n><n>### Instructions:In the table, type the data to make it fit the criteria outlined in the instruction. The first column is already entered. Choose data that fits the criteria. You may not add or delete columns.<n><n>### Output:<n><n><table><n>  <thead><n>    <tr><n>      <th>Height (cm)</th><n>      <th width="29%">Weight (kg)</th><n>    </tr><n>  </thead><n>  <tbody><n>    <tr><td><input type="number" name="height" max="301.3"/></td><td><input type="" name="" id="" </td></tr></table><p> In this task, there are multiple input fields. Each input field has two criteria in it. The program must fill in the empty inputs fields with the correct data to fit all of the criteria. </p><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:He was good at traditional science but excelled at social science, his favorite subject was what? Choices:  A: geography B: history studies C: math D: religion E: dancing<n><n>### Response:		<n>[![](https://img.shields.io/badge/Wrong-O-yellowgreen.svg)](https://stackoverflow.com/a/55992324/10896224)<n><n>My answer was A: Geography<n><n><n>### Input<n><n>```<n><n>Curt is setting up his summer savings account. He wants to make a deposit every week, for sixteen weeks, in which $30 is withdrawn every four weeks for expenses.  He will begin with a principal deposit of $300. How much will he have saved at the end of the summer?<n><n><n>```<n><n>#### Answer<n><n>```<n><n>The total deposits are $1200 while total withdraws are $300 leaving the remaining as ${1200-300} = $900 ```<n><n>### Input 2<n><n>```<n><n>Choose the answer that best describes whether the following will happen if both conditions are met<n><n>A hurricane is approaching Texas<n>A rancher plans to move 450 head of cattle 160 miles to higher<n>ground to protect them from possible flooding<n><n>The cattle must be protected from inland flooding. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:If you have trouble beginning work you're suffering from what? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What is a lover likely to want to do with their partner? Choices:  A: build family together B: fall in love C: make love D: complete E: distance themselves<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choices:  A: The right choice is option number (D).<n><n>### Input and Response<n>Input:In an apartment building, one-third of all the units has hardwood floors; one-ninth of them have tile floors; and the remaining have carpeting.  What is the probability that a randomly selected apartment has hardwood floors?  Note that you must use the words “randomly selected” or “random selection.”  If you use the words “random choice,” you will not receive full credit!<n>Rationales: You cannot know for sure what the floor is of the apartment your choosing which is the definition of random.<n>Using the numbering from above, The probability that a selected apartment has hard wood floors is 1/3.

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What does a person looking for new things in life do? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What often happens after a long day of traveling? Choices:  A: train station B: bookstore C: newsstand D: waiting room E: airport<n><n>### Response:		<n>I will read your magazine while waiting for my transportation on rails to leave? <n><n><n>### Input 1: What is the total distance, in miles, from the origin to the destination?<n>Input 2: How long, in hours, will it take your car to travel from the origin to the  destination (at 60 mph constant speed)?<n>Rationales: Distance 1: (20+6) + (20+6)+ (20+6)=<<20+6+20+6=52>>52<n><n>Distance 2:  (70+20) + (50+10)+ (20+5)=<<70+20+50+10=145>>145<n><n>Distance 3:  (52+145)=<<52+140+15>>155<n>#### 155<n>Answer: 155<n><n>### Input1: How much change you may get back when paying using $4? <n><n>### Input2: The amount change is $3.  A: <n><n>### Response :You have an even amount of change <n><n>### CORRECT:<n>Answer:You have even amount of change<n><n>### INCORRECT :<n>Answer:You have an odd amount of change<n><n><n><n><n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Input:  How much you need to spend at the store if $55 is your limit?<n><n>Rationales:<n>Since $55 is the limit, anything spent over 55 will be change.<n>If spent under 55, there will be no change.<n>$0+55=$0<n>$55+55=$<<55+55=110>>110<n>We have spent over our limit so there is no change.<n><n>#### 0<n>Answer:0<n><n>### Write a program that determines the value of each element of an array<n><n>import java.util.*;<n><n>public class MyClass{<n>    public static void main(String[] args) {   	<n>		int[] in = {8,9,10,4,7,2};<n><n>		for (int i = 0; i < in.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The policemen wanted to clear the scene of the accident, so what did they do to traffic? Choices:  A: hurry along B: direct traffic C: help D: force open door E: corner thief<n><n>### Response:		<n>(I will put it as an image, so i can't see it)<n><n>Input:The policemen wanted the traffic to move, so that what did they do? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where would you find performers on a platform in public? Choices:  A: arena B: building C: dock D: concert hall E: museum<n><n>### Response:		If you would find performers in public at an arena then choose A or C or D. If you would find at a building or concert hall A or E.<n><n>### Correct answer : D<n><n>### Input : You don’t normally think about it but your water bottles are made of plastic, and plastic doesn’t just come from one place<n><n>### Response : Plastic comes in different forms and they are made from a variety of different sources such as fossil fuels and plants<n><n>### Correct Answer : C

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:A balloon or two is a staple at a what? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  32 ounces of cat food 15 pounds of dog food 7 pounds of cat food<n><n>### Response 15.7 pounds, so answer 15<n><n>### Input, 18 x (13+x) = Answer, 4x<n>### Rationales,<n>### The first part tells me to multiply.<n>### The multiplication equation (18 X (13+x)) tells me that I have to use addition. I can’t use it in the equation, because the equation says (13+x).<n>### I do not even know what x is and so I can’t say that a+b=c for the variable x.<n>### I solve it by finding the x: 18 x13 +x= 252<n>### The answer 4 is the sum of 18 x 13 in order to make 252, or four times 13.<n><n>### Rational:<n>### 32 ounces is 2 pounds.<n>### 15 pounds is 18 ounces more than 128 ounces, or 12 ounces.<n>### 7 pounds is one-tenth of 18 ounches.<n><n>### Answer: 7 pounds<n><n>### Input answer, B: 5-6= A: 1; E: 4<n>### Rationals: 5 – 6 is negative, the only way to get negative 1 is if either 5 or 6 is negative. The only negative number is -6.<n>### Answer:<n>[A1]: $5-6$<n>[B1]: -$1$<n>[C1]: $1$<n>[D1]: $4$<n><n><n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The color yellow is associated with the opposite of the characteristic, what is it? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The man needed balls of cotton, where should he look? Then pick another number and add it to that sequence.  Repeat and continue until a number on the list is reached. Either you can sit in an expensive seat that costs 80 dollars, or you can sit in an inexpensive seat that costs 20 dollars.<n>In total if you had an expensive seat for 80/30000=<<80/30=187>>187 people and 80/$187 =<<80/$180=43>>43 cheep seats.<n><n>### 80+43 = <<80+43=123>>123<n><n>## Exercise 2<n><n>For what value of n is a value of x true for k=-5,-3,-2,-1,0,1,2,3,4,-n?<n><n>### Rationales<n><n>-3(-12)=<<-3*-12=36>>36<n><n>5*-36=-180 (-5,-3,-2), -180=<<-180=-25>>-25<n><n>-5,-3,-2=-75<n><n>195<n><n>### Answer<n><n>|       |-3     |   -2  |    -1  |  -5 |   -3 |   -2 |    -1 |   -4 |   -5 |   -6 |   -7 |   -8 |   -9 |<n>|------|----------|----------|---------|-------|-------|--------|--------|-------|-------|-------|------|<n>|x= | 75       |100      |100  |120   |150    |180   |225    |270   |330

He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:When a newborn's eyes open for the first time it will be the first time the ever? Choices:  A: tear up B: see light C: fill with tears D: be happy E: glass over<n><n>### Response:		What is the input to the task and how is it defined?<n>Ans. is:A<n><n>### Why:<n>A: Tear up-<n>When a newborn' eyes's open first time the newborn can only see thing for the first time because they do not have the idea of what they are seeing.<n><n>B: See light<n>newborn is born without light so they don't know how to see.<n>C: fill with tears<n>they can't see their own eye.<n>D: be happy<n>they are happy after birth.<n>E: glass over<n>it's a myth.<n><n>### Note:<n>The question is: "When a newborn' eye's open for the first time, it will be the first<n>time they ever(?)".<n><n>### Demand:<n>I chose D for the input.<n><n>### Output:<n>The output of the task is one choice letter.<n><n>### Valid:<n>Valid if D is the input for the task<n>#### A:<n>Tear up is not the right choice because it is not the first time a baby sees.<n>And we can not know what they see because they born to this world without any idea or knowledge.<n><n>#### B:<n>When a newborn is born it will be the first the newborn sees light.<n>When a newborn looks at something they will see it clearly and they will recognize it.<n><n>#### D:<n>When a newbor is born they will be happy and cry.<n>The most likely one is D.<n><n>#### E:<n>In many myths a baby will be born with no eyelids so it's not this one.<n><n>### Solution:<n>It's D.<n><n>### Notes:<n>Because it is A-D so A is the output.<n><n>### Example:<n><n>#### A:<n>When a new born's eye's open for first time, it will the first time they ever? Choices: A: tear up, B: see light, C: fill with tears, D: be happy, E: glass over<n>Ans. is A<n><n>#### B: see light<n>When a new bom's eye opened for first time<n>It will be the first time they see light<n><n>#### C: Fill with tears<n>When the baby's eyes opened it will be the
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where do people find bills with bread? Choices:  A: restaurant B: congress C: envelope D: mail box E: cheese store<n><n>### Response:		E.<n><n>### Input<n>  * What is a 6 7 8 4 digit code used to keep track of your purchases?<n><n>### Answer<n><n>### The answer below is correct.<n><n>I believe we should consider how the numbers are arranged for the final answer.<n><n>### Example Input:I would like to order 2 tangerines and 2 oranges. My total bill is $5.75. Also if you have two 4 digit codes you are just giving two different sets of 4 digit codes<n><n>### Example Question:<n>How many apples do you want?<n>You order your apples in the following way. You choose your type of apples (5 a.m. pears, 5 p.m. pears or 5 a.m. grapefruit), and then you choose how you want them to be sliced or left whole.<n>If you want your pears sliced, you have the choice to make your apples sliced thick or sliced thin. If you want your pears left whole, you must also make a decision about whether you want your apples to be cut on the diagonal, cut in half, or left whole with no cuts made.<n>Finally, you give your apples a name by using one of two words: ripe or unripe. The two words serve as modifiers to the name of the variety of pear:<n>ripe pear- 5 a.m pear<n>unripe pear-5 a.m pears<n>ripe pear - 5 p.m pear<n>ripe pear (1 choice)- 5am pear<n>unrippe pear (1 choice) - 5am pear (sliced)<n>The above are the three choices given<n>The question shows that I may have five choices to make and that I may choose

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. The train fare is $32 one way for the first journey. $26 for the second and third journeys, and $31 for the last three trips. How much will Demetri  pay for his train journeys?<n>### Rationales:<n><n>There are six journeys altogether, which means that the final total number of journeys will be 7, and in each journey we take there will be 2x(fare)=<<2x(fare)=24>>24$2 for the train fare, and 1x(fare)=<<1x(fare)=32>>32$1 for the train ticket. Therefore the total amount he will pay for the train journeys is 2*7+1*7=<<2*7+1=145>>145$ for the first journey, and 2*6+1*6+2*5+1*5+2*4+1*4+2*3+1=<<2*6+…+2*3+…+2=125+56+38+19+9+1>>1146for the last journey. Which means the grand total of the journeys is 145+56=<<145+55=200>>200<n><n>#### 457<n>Answer: 457<n><n>### Input Instructions:<n><n>### A farmer plants n trees, and then sells them. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The movie had many a song and dance, it was a what? Choices:  A: bollywood B: record C: musical D: jukebox E: napster<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### A<n><n>> A - The movie had many a song<n>and dance, it was a song<n>and dance movie.<n><n>#### E<n><n>> E - The movie had many songs<n>and dances, it was a song and<n>dance movie.<n><n>### Input<n>In class we discussed how the pythagorean theorem applies to nonright triangles. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: fraternity house B: bank C: big town D: big city E: building<n><n>### Response:		<n>  Select the best answer.<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n>When students work on their math facts, they need to use a manipulative, such as dime disks, to help them remember their basic addition and subtraction facts. Use a calculator or other tool as needed. To work out their multiplication facts, students should use an estimation strategy (e.g., using their fingers). Explain how to use these strategies for working with larger numbers below.<n>  <n>#### To use the calculation process:<n>Use dime disks as needed to assist your students: Start with the first column and row.<n>Say the student knows the first two digits.<n>  <n>Add the dime disk for the next column and row (e.g., the 3rd).<n>Say the student doesn’t know the next column and row.<n>  <n>Add next three more columns and row (e.<n>Say the students is still having trouble.<n>  <n>Add dime disks for the next 7 columns and rows.<n><n>#### To use estimation:<n>Estimate your answers (e.g., use fingers to represent the place value).<n>  <n>Add dimes to represent the tens place.<n>  <n>Add ones to represent the ones place. <n>  <n>Say your answer is too large.<n>  <n>Subtract dimes to represent the 10’s place.<n>  <n>Substract ones to represent the 1’s place.<n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Many containers full of goods are unloaded where after their long sea journey Choices:  A: port B: cargo ship C: refrigerator D: food E: lorry<n><n>### Response:		 Lorry is the correct answer.<n><n>### Explain: Lorry: a truck for transporting goods or passengers.<n><n>**Note:**<n><n>### A:  Port: the end and beginning of the sea journey.<n><n>### B:  Cargo Ship: the one who transports the containers from one place to another.<n><n>### C:  Refrigerator:  Transportation for goods that need to be chilled.<n><n>### D:  Food: It's not a container, it's a what transportation holds after the unloading process.<n><n>### E:  Lorry: the container is loaded on.<n><n>### Example:<n><n>####  Lorry:<n><n>#### A:<n><n>#### B:<n><n>#### C:<n><n>#### D:<n><n>#### E:  <n><n>#### Answer:<n><n>####  Answer: Lorry<n><n><n>### Instructions<n><n>#### A: the end and beginning<n><n>#### B:  unloads it from the ship<n><n>#### C:  the ship that moves through the water<n><n>#### D: the one who transfers the containers in the container ship<n><n>#### E: Transportation for goods that require to be cooled<n><n>#### Answer: B<n><n><n><n>

That is, you must not do the calculations in the background, since they must actually be done inside the program.<n>Input: 5 3 10 x (a) 13<n>Output: 55<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following.<n><n>### Input Question: There are 42 bags left in the storeroom. There are many kinds of bags, some of which are small, and others are large. We have a need to fill 37 of these bags with rice. But due to lack of resources, only half of the large bags can be used. Half a bag has half the capacity of a large bag. If one small bag is used to fill any large bag, it will fill it completely, but if both small bags are used to fill a large bag, they only fill half of it. There are no extra bags, only the 42 bags in the storeroom which we intend to fill. We have available 6 big bags, 16 small bags, and 10 medium-sized bags. In how many ways are there in which we can fill the 37 bags with rice?<n>Answer in one line: <<Answer in one line: 616>>616<n><n>### Output Question: How are you going to find and report the output of a 6-digit 3-digit code (which is a 6-bit number)?<n><n>### Response Question:<n>This time if you had a 4-digit pin, of 4 bits, you would have used 32 different bits 2^32, and when we add this to our code so that the whole thing is 12 bites long, we are saying that we want to be able to represent 2^12 different pin configurations. What we are doing is doubling the number of allowed sequences. <n>

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Input<n>The first time you use the ATM, a deposit of $20 is deducted so that the machine can know that there is a deposit on that machine. In the process of using an ATM, the bank will debit you for $40.00 and will add $20.00 to create an even 60.00 balance for your account. How much will you need to deposit?<n><n>### Rationales<n>The machine deducts $20.01, then deposits $20, then takes the deposit out to make a balance of $60.19<n><n>### Answer<n><n>$39.99<n><n>### Input.<n>Forty percent of the apples that were sold last week were sold in the store next to the mall.  Fifteen percent of the apples sold were sold by the store by the train station. How do you get these results?<n>### Rational<n> 40%-15%= <<15-0=0.5>>0.5<n><n>### Answer.<n> 25%<n><n>### Instructions.<n>Answer 60 questions for total value of $120. This is the last question for the test.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:If an actor is said to be on the “silver screen" where would you see them perform? Choices:  A: play B: movies C: theater D: screen E: television<n><n>### Response:		<n>I got an A in my math class yesterday, but a B in my history class.<n>The next day, my mother tells me I got an  A in my math class.<n>Then, she tells me I got a C in my history class. But then she tells me I got an A in history. What did I get in my history class?<span class="highlight"></span><n><n>### Instructions: Read each sentence. In the margin write the answer to the multiple choice question that follows it.<n><n>### Sentences:<n>Jake is 5 years old and he doesn’t know how much 8 7/10 ounce is.<n><n>### Question:<n>What is the units?<n><n>### Units: <n>How many pounds/ounces are in 13 pound 9 ounce<n><n>### Sentence:<n>Jake thinks that 37-ounce cup is the same as 30-ounce cup.<n><n>### Rationales:<n>What is the answer?<n><n>### Answer: 10<n><n>### Sentense:<n>Gary says that a 93-ounce bag of potatoes weighs the same as a 92-ounce bag of potatoes.<n><n>### Answer<n>The potato weight 92 oz.<n><n>### Response Sentence:<n>Amy claims that 1/3 cup of flour weighs the same amount as 1/4 cup of flour.<n><n>### How many cups of flour does 5 cups of flour weigh?<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What's the nickname of the monster the beauty loved? Choices:  A: beast B: ugly C: ugliness D: satellite E: top of mountain<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>#### A<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input<n>The following table shows some information about bats.<n><n>#### Bats: <n>| Species | Number of Members | Color |   <n>|:-------:|:------------------:|:----:|<n>| Lesser |    3     |    black   |<n>| Northern |    2     |   brown   |<n>| Greater |    14     |    black   & red |<n>|  Pallid |    3     |     white   |<n><n>Which type of bat is the most numerous?<n><n>### Response<n>Bats: <n>| Speci es | Number of Membe rs | Color |<n>|:-------: |:------------------:|:-:|<n>| Lessen r |         3        |    blac k |<n>| Norther en |         2        |   brow n |<n>| Greater er |         14        |   black and r ed|<n>|  Pall id |         3        |     wh ite |<n><n>The greatest number of bats can be found in the Greater Bat species.<n><n>#### Answer:B<n><n>## Task 3<n>Below is a sentence. Provide a rational that describes one solution that could be possible for the highlighted question.<n><n>## Instruction:Answer the question.<n><n>## Demonstration<n>How can you divide 5 hours in the same way as you can divide 1 hour?<n><n>#### 1.5<n>Answer: 1.5<n><n>## Task 4<n>Below is an instruction that describes an operation.
