How many slices of pizza did the server give Tom?<n>Rationales:: There are 16 square pieces that are cut from 16.<n>Each piece is 1, and that adds up to 12.<n>So give him 13 pieces.<n>#### 13<n>Answer: 13<n><n>Input: A soccer field is a rectangular parallelogram.  If one of its sides is 2 yards long and the other is 6 yards long,  each diagonal is 6* sqrt(3)/2 =<<6* sqrt(2)>>2 yards long.  What is the area of the entire field?<n>Rationales : First calculate the size of the area.<n>6 * sqrt(2) = 6* sqrt (2* x/2) = 3<n>There are two triangles, so you would take the size of each and multiply the two.<n>You will have 2 * 3 = 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>Input: What is 12/6 in decimal form?<n><n>Rationales: When you place decimals to the left of a number you turn it into a fraction.<n>12/6 will become 12/6 = 2/3<n><n>### Input<n>Choices: A:12% B: 1266C: 126.6% D: 12.66% E: 126% Answer: 126<n><n>### Instructions<n>The cost of a home in a certain city was $166,000 and it has increased by about 8 percent each year since 2000. Choices:  A: critical thinking B: congratulated C: equal opportunity D: compliments E: raffle tickets<n><n>### Response:		<n>Option A is correct.<n><n>### Reason:  We can tell that all of those choices apply.<n><n>### Input :  Choose an answer from the following choices. What word is a synonym of malleability? Choices:  a: unyielding b: yield c: intransitivities d: elasticity e: malleability<n><n>### Reponse:<n>Option E is correct.<n><n><n><n><n>### Input 2:  Use the following words to create a complete paragraph.  You may not borrow or spell out the words that you choose.  Your reply should comprise two sentences containing a minimum of 10 words each.  The first sentence should begin with the sentence starter:  Choices: The  <<<<<<<>>>>><n><n>### Repsonse:<n>This is a test response.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What happens to the next appointment when a grooming takes longer than expected? Choices:  A: injury B: beauty C: late D: mistakes E: annoyed<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>Rationales: Beautician is the best choice because the appointment is to the best of the groomer’s abilities.<n><n>### Input A: A dog is adopted from the pound and the fee is $150 per dog. 425 dogs have been adopted, how much money has been raised.<n>Rationales: You need to count 9 more then and 498 more than. So you can do 9+9+9+9++9+498 So now i have 600+9+498=600+1007 So 1007 +1007= 2014<n><n>### Response B: A and B<n><n>Rationales A can be true because they have adopted 425 dogs out of 498 dogs in the pound so they have $1,500 to give to the pound in the form of donations.<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where would you stand in a line and need a coat if it is cold? Choices:  A: graph B: bank at noon C: good book D: post office E: bus stop<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n><n>The answers to your questions are as follows:<n>A- graph - C, B- Bank at noon-C, D- post office - E, and B- Bus Stop- C.<n>```<n><n><n>#### A<n><n>### Input<n>Which answer comes before the answer to choice (A)?<n><n>### Answer<n>The answer to choice (A) is 6, so the answer to choice (B) cannot be 6. We look forward and find that 4 is before 6 which makes answer (B) 4.<n><n>#### B<n><n>### InputWhich answer comes before B?<n><n>### AnswerFour comes before B because 4 is before B.<n><n>#### C<n><n>###<n><n><n><n>#### E

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: under bed B: symphony C: music room D: band practice E: music store<n><n>### Response:		<n>C is the best for soring a wind instrument there is always a good symphony playing right next so it will not be a problem.<n><n>### Input:"What are the types of bonds?"<n><n>### Response:"I know the different types of bonds. It comes in four types which are municipal bonds, treasury bonds, U.S. notes and zero-coupon bonds."<n><n>### Input:{“I would like to find out what are the causes of high inflation and how to deal with high inflation?”}<n><n>### Response:{“The causes of high inflation can be divided into 5 parts, they are, changes in the money supply, increases in productive capacity, monetary disruptions, unemployment and speculation in the economy.<n><n>To deal with high inflation, I think the government should use fiscal action to curb the problem. It is to increase taxes on essential goods so people can’t afford to consume a lot of necessary items. This can also solve the unemployment problem. Government can also change the monetary policy to control inflation by lowering money supply so people don’t borrow as much. It is also important to maintain the balance between fiscal and monetary policies. Otherwise, the inflation could create a vicious circle. People will have more money, increasing inflation rates, and prices for goods will rise, causing them to have more money even more. Government also need to increase productive capacity by investing on new technology, investing on infrastructure improvement and rebuilding infrastructures that were destroyed by natural disaster and provide people with jobs.<n><n>Finally, government needs to control speculation in the economy by limiting the trading in securities and controlling of prices on commodities. It can be done by regulating of futures exchange.”}<n><n>### Input:`You have a 100 gram bag of sugar. A friend wants to borrow 6 gram of sugar. He explains that he has some sugar that has already been added to his coffee. You can either take sugar back from the coffee or take 6 gram from the 100 gram of sugar.”<n><n>### Response:`I can take 6 gram from 100 to accommodate my friend”

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where would you find a binder containing homework assignments? Choices:  A: backpack B: bookcase C: office supply store D: office E: class room<n><n>### Response:		If you can't find it in your backpack, look for it in your bookcase. If you can't you will need to check one of the other locations. <n><n>#### Bookcase<n><n>### Input:: What is one job of an apartment superintendent?<n><n>### Response:: To ensure the apartment is kept clean and tidy for the tenant.<n><n>#### Input:: If one apartment is 64 square feet and another is 66.5 square feet, which apartment is larger?<n>- **Chosen Choice**: If you were to lay those out flat, the 66.5 apartment would be bigger.<n><n>### Question 1<n><n>I think a <n><n>### Question1:<n><n>D <n><n>### Answer Choice 1 and 2<n><n>B <n><n>### Response 1<n><n>B<n><n>### Response Choice 1<n><n>A<n><n>### Question2<n><n>I think a<n><n>### Question3<n><n>I don't know, I want to know what the answer is<n><n>### Section 14.1<n><n>Grammar and Usage<n><n>### Practice Test<n><n>### Reading<n><n>### Sentence Structure<n><n>### Vocabulary<n><n>### Reading and Vocabulary
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:If you see blinking lights in the air at night, what are you usually looking at? Demonstration: The store has a sale. The price you would regularly pay for this watch is $100, which is on sale for $50. If you buy two, you get a 20% discount off the total of both watches. The normal discount would be $47.50, and since you are buying more than one, you get $47.56 off your total purchase. So the actual price is $50 – (50 × 20%) + (2 × $47.5) = << 50 - (50 X 20%) + 2 x ($47.5) >>47.5 – 37.77 – 8.33 = 19.88 The actual discount you receive from the purchase is (50 × 19.8%) = 9.97, which is about 10%.<n>#### 47.5<n>Answer: 47.50<n><n>### Data<n>Input:  Tap dance classes are $95 for the first class and $10 per additional class.  How much does the second class cost?<n><n>### Answer:<n>The answer is 10*105/110<n><n>### Instructons:Answer the following multiplechoice question.<n><n>## 201) 55.55<n><n>## 150) (44).55<n><n>### Instractaions:Answer the following multiple selection question.<n><n>## Dear Friend,<n><n>Please send me a cheque of $5.55.<n><n>Thanks a lot.<n><n>Jane<n><n>## 100% of<n><n>### Question:<n>I heard a joke from a friend the other day: 300% of a little is not a little.<n><n>### Answer<n><n>## 75%<n><n>### Questions:<n>I heard a 75% joke from a friend last weekend. Choices:  A: ignore B: write C: learn new things D: illiterate E: having fun<n><n>### Response:		B<n>### rationale:<n>I would have guessed C since the first half of B was 'write...illiterate'.<n>But I think D is a better choice because illiterate is more literal than 'not having fun'.<n>Also, he was not learning new things until after his grandpa died, so B doesn't make sense<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Here are four choices, where each has a different meaning for the word 'litterate'.<n><n>B: To write (as in printing, copying, or transcribing).<n>D: Having no letters in it.<n>A: To make literate (as in teaching, making knowledgeable, or making literate).<n>E: Being able to read (as in being able to read letters or words or be literate)<n>I think that 'not having fun' is a less literal phrase than illiterate.<n><n>### Input:\A: I wish you would teach her to drive.\B: Why? That would slow her down.\C: You're thinking of a car? I'm thinking of her learning how to manage her money. \D: That's funny, but I think you're right.\E: You must think she needs help making choices that will make her life more pleasant.\F: I just think that money is good.<n>A: Choice #1<n>B: Choice #2<n>C: Choice #3<n>D: Choice #4<n>E: Choice #5<n>F: Choice #6<n><n>### Response:\C<n><n>### rationale:\<n>I had to think about this for a while, and decided that #5 is best because it is talking about having fun.<n>#3 implies that #4 isn't fun because choices will make her life pleasant, but pleasant is never mentioned in context of learning, having fun, etc...only being successful.<n>These are the options that have the word 'fun'<n>#2 #3 #6<n>and #6 is the best because of the context surrounding the word fun, #C is the answer because it talks about the context.<n><n>### Demo:<n>Choices: the first four are synonyms.<n># 5, 10, 15, 20 are idioms.<n>#1, 6, 11, 16 are not idi

One year later it is 81,700. Estimate what will be the population will be after two more years.<n>Rationales:<n>From 78,7 to the 78, (1-10/100)= <<- (1-100/100)>>78 the population lost 1% so that means that it increased to 81,7 by about 1%<n><n>After that it will grow by 2%<n><n>And after 2 years it will be<n>2*(1.02)= <<-2*(1.0+0.02)>>2*(1.01)=2.02-81-78,<n>2.02 -79, which means two years is 2.02-79 =<<<2.02- 79=2.25>>2.25<n><n>####2.25<n>Answer: 2.25<n>

Choices:  A: medicine cabinet B: chemist's shop C: kitchen D: drug store E: bedroom<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### What I understand from this question<n>> Drug store<n><n>What I understand is that this is a real question and you answered it real quick<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n>For the following questions 4 choices will be given. Choose one of the 4 choices that is closest in meaning to the given word.<n><n>### Input1:<n>> Choice 1-The word "desert" is closest in meaning to "barren."<n><n>### Input2:<n>> Choice2-The word"narrow" is closest in meaning  to "small."<n>> Choice3-The word "wide" is closest in meaning "large."<n>> Choice4-The word "waste" is closest in meaning is "spend."<n><n>### Answer:<n>Answer1:<n>#### "Barrow" is closest in the meaning of desert<n><n><n>### Input3:<n>> Choice1- The word "protrude" is closest in meaning.  "Project."<n>> Choice2 - The word "protrusion" is closest in meaning with protrude.<n>> Choice3 - The word "project" is closest in meaning wiht protrude.<n><n>### Answer2:<n>Answer3:  (This is the hardest question in quizizz)<n>#### The word "bounce back" is closest in meaning than "to fall a large distance and then start or continue to move in an upright direction."<n><n>### Instuctions:<n>> For the following questions, write a response that appropriately combines four ideas.<n>><n>> You are given a sentence with the second half underlined. Choose from the answer choices one response that re-writes the sentence in a way that combines the ideas in the underlined part of the sentence with those on the left. For example, re-writing "I'd love to watch a movie with my mom tonight." could be written "I'd like to hang out with my mom at the movies tonight." If you cannot create a viable response, or you believe the best response is "None of the above," choose the best of those.<n>><n>> When you are done,  click on the 'Save & Exit' button. This quiz will only be available for the duration of the lesson.<n><n>### Response1
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where should you find a school in? Choices:  A: residential neighborhood B: mosque C: every city D: prague E: community<n><n>### Response:		Choices A B C D E<n>#### All choices<n>Answer:  All choices<n><n>### Instructions:In this item-only question, one question has been provided, followed by three possible responses. Choose the most appropriate response and select your answer below.<n><n>### Input<n>Your friend wants to buy a small boat so they can explore the lake near your home. They visit two stores to do an estimate for the boat.<n><n>Store A: Boat price = $4000, plus $40/sq ft<n><n>Store B: Boat price = $$3200, plus $$40/sq. ft.<n><n>Write an expression that will allow you to estimate the price of a boat at Store B from an estimate of the square footage given.<n><n>Rationales: You will need to find the total cost for Store B, so the equation is $$x + (16x/25) = (4000 3200)<n>8000<n>Answer: $x is the total cost and 16x/21 is the cost/sq ft<n>Total cost is $$x = 16x/12 = 8x<n>#### 3200<n>Answer:  8000<n><n>## Instructions: Choose your answer and click.<n><n>### Response<n>Choices A B C<n>#### Choices A B C<n>Answer:  Choices A B C

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where is a notebook often purchased? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: feeble B: bullbleep C: cow D: female E: charging prey<n><n>### Response:		<n>```python <n>b is correct<n>```<n><n>### Explanation:<n>He called bull when he called his friend bull is a insult or being bossy.<n>#### A<n><n>### Answer:<n>```python  A```<n><n>### Instructions:Choose the response that provides the information requested by the multiple choice question.<n><br>Directions: The multiple choice answer key is presented below. Select the response that most appropriately completes the response.<n><n>### Correct Answers:<n>```python  -3```<n><n>### A: The car-renta l agency charges 30 a day for a car, or 190 for the firs 2<n><n>#### B: The car-rent an agency charges 3 for a car, or for the first 7 da <n> <n>### C: and 1 e for the first three days of rental. Choose the appropriate altern <n>><n>### D:<n>><n>### E: and 30 for three days of rental<n>#### B<n> <n>### Answer:  <n>```python  B```<n><n>### Demands<n><br>Demands are the amount paid for a service or amount paid for a good.  An amount paid is the demand.<n><n>### Price<n><br>The price is what is accepted or paid.  A price is the amount required to be met in the demand.<n><n><br>Example: A hotel has a room for rent.  The price per day is $150.00.  The amount paid is the room charge and the amount required is the price.  The demand is the room charge.<n><n>### Amount of change<n><br>The amount of change in the demand is the total demand subtracted from the amount paid.<n><n>### Example:<n><br>Example of the Amount of Change in the Demo:<br><n><br>A hotel has a room for $2500.0.  The rental is demanded for a month at a time at 2500.  Thus the amount paid is per month and the amount demanded is 2500 for a month.  The demand is 250 per day.  The change, or the amount of total pay for the month is 25

How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:James drove his niece to her father.  Where did he drive? Choices:  A: great granddad's house B: family picture book C: brother's house D: family tree E: family reunion<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Rationales:In an indirect (parenthetical) phrase, James drove his niece to (his father's) family reunion, meaning he dropped her off at his father's house.<n><n><n>### Demmies:<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Rationale<n><n>James drove her to (His Father's) Family Reunion <n><n>### Answer:<n><n>### Response<n><n>James drove to his father's house at which his family had a reunion.<n><n>#### Answer<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What could you buy in a bookstore? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Explain why $100,6 is equal to $104.<n><n>### Response<n>The number is $100.<n><n>An extra dollar can be added every 4 numbers with the same format (4-2).<n>$100,0 is $104.  $100,4 is $108....<n>$100 (extra number) 4 (extra number).<n>We don't have to look into tens, so every digit must be 100 and every next digit must be 4.<n><n>## Rationales to explain your response<n>Input:<n>Answer: $100,3<n>Input:<n>Rationales:<n>Answer: $380<n>Input:A carpenter needs $50,00 every week.  Choose the two-digit number that gives the weekly payment.<n>Rationales:I am assuming that he gets a pay each week.<n>Since that is so, he will get paid every 7 days and will have payed every 7 days.<n>So the weekly payment must be $50,5270 dollars for every month.<n>But he needs to pay $50,0 for the weekly payment in total.<n>Thus, $5000 = $50,50<n><n>## Input/Demonstrations<n><n>Rationales:The 5 is for the month and the 0 is for all of the months.<n>The month is 42 days from 10/10 to 12/1

Choices:  A: free time B: pleasure C: get divorced D: legal fees E: being lonely<n><n>### Response:		Choices C (getting a divorce) and E (being lonely)<n><n>### Instructions:A man who weighs 355 lbs. plans to drive his van (with a 12,000 pound capacity) 20 miles to the grocery store to pick up his lunch.  What is the total weight of the trip including all passengers and food (in pounds)?<n><n>### Rationale:All passengers are 195 lbs. (including the man weighing 355 lbsts) and 12,017.55 pounds of groceries<n><n>### Total weight = 2,850<n><n>### Instructed Response:<n>During a school semester, a student paid for several textbook and supplies.  These items comprise the student's budget for the semester. There are 9 weeks in the semester.  Each textbook, averaging $50, costs $450.  School supplies cost on average 25 percent of a textbook (textbooks range in price, so some may be more expensive than this average).  Compute, to the nearest cent, the student's budget per week, in dollars, for the books and supplies.<n><n>### Rationales:<n>There are 9 weeks in a semester<n>Each book costs $450 and each book = 9*$450 and each textbook = 25%*(9 * 450) =  202.5*9 = 1817.5<n><n>Textbooks + supplies is = 450 + 202.5 = 652.5<n>Students budget per week is (652.5/9 = $71.7) ≈ 71.7

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What will happen if you are successful when committing suicide? Choices:  A: scars B: being born C: sorrow D: misery E: kill yourself<n><n>### Response:		<n>I'm pretty sure if you do commit suicide then you'll be dead!<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: How much will it cost to complete these four missions.<n><n>#### Mission 1<n>Rationales:<n><n>Insurance is 80% of 4000 = 60% of 6100 = $<<60% of 10000 = 3000>>3030.<n>Airfare is 194.5 * 75 miles = 14125.<n>Transportation is $10.  50% of 1412.5 = 120.75.<n>Bridge crossing is 75 * 120 = $<<120.8 = $9000>>9000.<n><n>Adding up all the costs is<n>$$3000 + 1412 + 120.88 + 9000 = 17029.8$$<n><n>#### 17020<n>Answer: 17022<n><n>####  Mission 2<n>Rationales: This is the same as mission 1. Except the flight will cost $165, the other costs are the same<n><n>\$$165 + 1413 + 122.8 + 9045 = 26941$$<n><n>#### 26949<n>Answer: 26945<n><n>####  Mission3<n>Rationales: There will be an increase of a small amount. The plane will cost $175, there will be a slight increase in the other costs<n>The total will be<n>$175 + 14462 + 140 + 9050 = 36977<n><n>#### 36982<n>Answer: 36984<n><n>####  Mission4<n>Rationales: A small increase in costs. The plane costs $178, and there is a small increase in other costs. The totals are<n><n>$178 + 14446 + 150 + 9250 - $
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:A school is most likely to be located in what sort of zone? Choices:  A: residential neighborhood B: community C: building D: prague E: every city<n><n>### Response:		A<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input :What is the purpose of a warehouse? Choices: 1. store inventory 2. create a barrier between residential homes and industries 3. a place to put inventory off-season 4. a place to store merchandise 5. a place to buy supplies<n><n>### Response : 3<n><n>Answer: A place to store merch<n><n><n><n><n><n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What happens to people when they do not have enough food? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What does someone chatting with friends do when they hear a joke? Choices:  A: giggle B: lie C: laughing D: chuckle E: smoke<n><n>### Response:		 A<n>[Answer 54% correct]<n><n>Input:What does someone choking on food do? Choices: A: stop B: cough C: ask for a drink D: gag E: none of the above<n><n>### Response A:  A<n>[answer 61% correct]<n><n>### Demo<n>Input: What do you do when you hear a joke? If you cough a lot, you have a heavy cough. If you cough a little and it doesn’t hurt it isn't really choking. If it hurts, it’s a heavy cough.<n><n>Input: My grandma is funny for when she does the house work and cook.<n><n>Input: What does a dog and a cat do? If you do the housework, it’s a chore. If you clean up after your dog, it’s dirty.<n><n><n><n><div class="mt-4 mt-sm-0" ></div>  <n><h5 class="font-weight-semibold"><n>  Feedback<n></h5>   <n><div class="border-bottom py-4 px-4"><n>  <div class="px-4 pt-2 pb-2" id="feedback" title="Click to view and dismiss feedback" style="display:none"><n>    <div class="font-weight mb-0 feedback-message"></div><n><n>    <div class='row'><n>      <div class='col-md-4'><n>        <div class="input-group"><n>          <button type="button" class="btn btn-primary mb-2" id='submit'><i class="fas fa-check-circle"></i> Submit Feedback</button><n>        </div><n>        <a class="btn btn-light" href="/feedback" target="_blank">View all feedback</a><n>      </div><n>    </div><n>  </div><n></div>   <n><n><p id='my-feedback'></p><n><script type="text/javascript"><n>  var myFeedback = document.getElementById("my-feedback");<n>  myFeedback.innerHTML = "Feedback submitted.";<n><n>  window.onload = function () {<n>    <n>    var myFeed
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The artist knew that this was the peak of his fandom, so he decided it was time for cashing in by doing what? Choices:  A: selling out B: happy C: fishing D: receiving money E: getting paid<n><n>### Response:		C-Fishing (Fishing is when you catch fish or other aquatic animals such as shrimp, lobsters, and clams in rivers, ponds, or at the bottom of the sea. It is a way that some people make money or have fun)<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question. Choose the correct response.<n><n>### Input The car-rental company charges $30/ day or $190/week. Jennie rented the car for 17 days at $190/ week. How much did she pay? <n><n>### Response A: $ 447.00 B: $570.50 C: $874.00 D: $1,081 E: $1,343<n><n>### Input What is the rule for dividing by seven? A: 1,3,5,7,8,9,7,5,1,3... B: 1,4,1,4... Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What state shaped like a glove has a lot of farmland? Choices:  A: countryside B: farming areas C: michigan D: texas E: north dakota<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is Michigan.<n><n>### Input(Grade K – 2): If I am a farmer and I have 5 bags of corn, my cat and I will eat 1 bag. My cat will eat 1 bag and I will eat 4 bags. Then there will be _______. <n><n>### Response(Grade K –2): There will be 6 bags left.<n><n>### Task(Grade K –3): The shark eats 14 fish. Then the octopus catches only 3 fish. There are ______ fish left. <n><n>### Input (Grade 3 – 5): I have 94 sticks of candy broken into groups of 4. I give each group of 4 candy sticks to my friends. Then how many groups of 4 do I have left? <n><n>### Rational(Grade 3–5): How many bags have 4 candies altogether? I have 94 candy sticks, so each bag has 4 candies. So what is the group of 4 x 94? 4 x 91? 91 is the amount of bags? 91? How many bags will you have left? What is the amount of baggies you will have left? 4 groups of 4 =16 is the final answer right? <n><n>## Challenge: Challenge the student to explain any of the above answers or solutions to the question. The student should come up with the correct solution using the basic algebraic and rational approach.<n>## Hint: If you don't know how to help your child on any of the problem types, try practicing problems from past years' common core standards like <n>##[Common Core Algebra 1 - Grade 12](https://math.rice.edu/~einstein/algebra1/CCSS_Grade12-Algebra1.pdf)<n>* CCSS.Math.Content.1.OA.A.1: Add and subtract fractions with unlike denominators (including mixed numbers) by replacing given fractions with equivalent fractions in such a way as to produce an equivalent sum or difference of fractions with like denominators. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:If you harm property after starting a fire where are you likely to end up? Choices:  A: damage B: going to jail C: going to school D: burns E: destruction<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Input<n>### Response:If your brother comes home, will you fight him?<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>You have five choices for how to respond. For each choice, state the action you would take if your brother comes home.<n><n>#### A:  Ask your mother for help.<n><n>#### B:  Ask your brother to leave.<n><n>#### C:  Take his side.<n><n>#### D:  Go home and be quiet.<n><n>#### E:  Get a weapon.<n><n>### Choice:<n><n># If-Then:<n><n>**[Choose from 5 choices]**<n><n>### Response <n>E) Get your weapon!

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:A person is alone in the woods and wounded, what should he do? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. The 2nd group had 100 patients that were excluded from the experiment due to illnesses. 3rd group had 50 patients that were exposed and also had illnesses in the final group there were 40 patients that were exposed but did not have illnesses. Calculating the confidence interval we are looking at the data that has the population mean of between 88 and 103.<n><n>*Rationales*<n>- [ ]The population of the 1st group was exposed to the new drug.<n>- [ ]The 2nd group were patients who had illnesses while exposed to the new drug in the 1st group.<n>- [ ] The 3rd group had patients who weren't exposed to the new drug even though they had illnesses.<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where would a restaurant put a candle? Choices:  A: dimly lit room B: kitchen C: wall D: table E: birthday cake<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### Rationales:<n>A candle goes in a dark room, dim light room.<n>The answer is A<n><n>#### Response:<n>Candles go in dimly lit rooms, not lit, and birthday cake.<n>The answer is B<n><n>### Question:<n>### What is the sum of the 4 digit number entered below?<n>4,225<n>####2 + 22 + 225 + 4<n>Answer: 7<n><n>### Question<n>### What is equal to 355?<n>####3 + 55<n>Answer: 6<n><n>### Question.<n>### How many hours are there in a week?<n>####7.<n>Answer: 36.<n><n>### Question <n>### What is 125 + 85?<n>####44<n>####110<n>Answer: F<n><n>### Question  <n>### How many days are in a year?<n>####1.<n>####366<n>Answer: Year has 365 days, 6 leap years in a 4 year cycle<n><n>### Questions<n>##### How much is 6.345 x 11.253?<n>######Answer: F<n><n>##### How much did Jason pay his landlord that month?<n>######<n>##### How much does a book cost?<n>#####$<n>##### How many bags of flour does Jason buy?<n>#####0 bags. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. How many days will there be between the loss of a puppy tooth and the loss of a new puppy tooth?"<n>### Write a response that appropriates answers.<n><n>#### Option C (Option B to D) or A  or C<n><n>#### Option A & B or C or D<n><n><n>### Output:<n>The number of days between the loss of a new-puppy tooth and a puppy-tooth is 1.<n>Answer: 1<n><n>### Input 1:<n>The number of minutes in 12 hours<n><n>### Output 1:<n>There are 72 minutes in 12 minutes<n><n>### Input-<n>The number of cents in 10 dollars<n><n>### Output-<n>There are 700 cents in 120 dollars.<n><n>### Input<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n>Input: There are 4965 students at a school. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:where do you store wine? What will it take to get the man back to where he started?<n>Rationales You want your investment in percentage<n>Total investment=100% you take 50 so that percent is 50/100=<<50/10=5/1>>5/10 so investment is 50/5=100/5=<<100/5==20.00>>5==20<n><n>#### 20<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: Which of the following will not be shown if a video is being played by a computer?<n>A: Picture<n>B: sound<n>C: picture and sound<n>D: nothing<n><n>Rationales: Video would have the elements for sound, Picture and Sound<n><n>Answer: none of these<n><n>### Demoration:<n>Input: What was the average class size in Dr. Sas’s 10th Grade Algebra Class?<n>Choices: A: 26<n>B: 27<n>C: 17<n>D: 50<n><n>Rationales for D: 50<n>Answer: 50<n>### Demostation:<n>Input: Rita bought candy to the tune of $2.30 per pound. Choices:  A: efficiency B: getting work done C: marriage D: finishing up E: results<n><n>### Response:		<n>The brides and groom are looking to finish up a proposal quickly and efficiently.<n><n>### Rationale:<n>In the bride and groom’s situation they are looking to be efficient with their time.<n><n>### Input - Brief 3.<n><n>### Response - Brief 3<n><n>### Rationales:<n>In the textbook it says that, "You can write your response to a reading passage as a letter to its author or person referred to in the text." That is definitely a possible approach to writing an effective critique on a literary and/or historical document. However, I think the more effective way to critique these texts is to write a letter to the author's primary audience. This will be the reader, and they will definitely be different from the author. This reader will be someone that is interested in the subject matter of this primary text, and I will be writing them from the viewpoint of the intended reader.<n><n>In reference to the text "A Letter in Time of Plague", written by an anonymous writer.<n><n>Dear "Anonymous",<n><n>The time in which you wrote was a time of great plague. Many lives were lost and people were scared. I can tell by the word choice in your text that you are scared for your life. I can only imagine the suffering and death that you have witnessed. In a time like this I think everyone is scared because they know that it could quickly take their life. It's important for people reading this message that you are writing anonymously that it wasn't your place to mention the names of the dead but it's really important for you to write about the fact that so many people are dead because of this plague. "When the corpses are carried to be buried you see some that die a second time on the way, and many others are carried out that seem to be alive, and in the course of a few days they die." When you wrote this it wasn't the time or place for the names of the dead to be put out there in the world. But what you did do was put an entire idea of what the plague was doing to your town. You put out the idea that so many people are dying, and it wasn't because God was angry with me.<n><n><n>This is the reason I think a reader at the time you were writing would have felt comforted by what you said in

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:There aren't many anemone in what glove-shaped state? Choices:  A: michigan B: lake C: tide pool D: nursery E: atlantic ocean<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Demotivations:Michigan is a northeastern state that is nicknamed the Wolverine State because of it's Wolverine shape and it is bordered on Lake Superior (Lake). Michigan also has the largest coastline in the continental United States.  Nursery sounds kinda cool and that is the state that grows all of our nursery rhymes. Atlantic Ocean may be a choice.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where you have finished a conversation with a person what do you say? Choices:  A: open letter B: thank god C: say goodbye D: bless you E: listen to radio<n><n>### Response:		Input: What you say to a person when you have finished a conversation?<n>Rationales :<n><n>Answer:<n>A<n><n>

The response should contain:<n>1. One main idea about where to put your computer<n>2. Specific details that explain the main idea of putting your computer in a space other than at a desk<n><n>### II. The response should be approximately 3-4 sentences long<n><n>### III. The response provides a main idea supported by specific details<n><n>### Example:<n>####  I. The response should have the following:<n>1. Computer should not be sitting on a desk<n><n>2. Computer's location should be convenient<n><n>####  II. The response would be roughly:<n>3 sentences<n><n>####  III. To summarize the above the response should be:<n><n>Computer's location should be in an accessible, desk free space.<n>

How many fewer seats will be used?<n><n>### Response(E):<n>Answer:12 seats will be used.<n><n>### Input : I am not sure if you mean by "2 fewer guests than can by served by the 88 dining room seats" that the remaining guests will use 4 less seats or just that there will be 4 fewer seats.<n><n>### Response (E):<n>I just used the number of seats available.<n><n>### D: A doctor, who had just completed an internship, was on call for the first time during his three year ophthalmology residency. The doctor was working in a small rural hospital in the middle of the night when an old woman was brought in with acute glaucoma. The doctor ordered an emergency surgery which was performed successfully. He then checked in on the patient several hours later and found her deceased. He was very embarrassed about the accidental death and could not sleep. He decided to talk to the internship coordinator. "How could you have left someone that seriously ill on the operating table overnight?" the doctor asked. The coordinator responded to the doctors question with a simple, "Well, now you know."<n><n>### Response<n>#### Question:What does this statement refer to?<n>#### A. The doctor’s ophthalmology internship.<n>#### B. Accidental death.<n>#### C. Sleep deprivation.<n>#### D. The doctor’s role<n><n>#### A<n>Answer: None of them<n><n>### Inst:<n>An operator at a drive-up window was assisting customers when he spotted a familiar vehicle driven by Mr. Hinkle, the bank manager.
