Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What animal produces milk? Choices:  A: supermarket B: pig C: cow D: refrigerator E: store<n><n>### Response:		C: Cow<n><n>>*This is the sample task, where response (D) was incorrect. If you select that response, the system will respond with:*<n><n>No, the milk does not produce itself, you must use a cow.<n><n>### Response<n><n>C: Cow<n><n>### Rating<n><n>You chose "C" as your answer to the question, "What animal produces milk?".<n>There is a choice to show the rater your working, so if you want (D) to be rated, you can reply "OK!  I want you to rate me, but you do not give any feedback."<n><n>### Feedback Example<n><n>*This is sample, where feedback is incorrect.*<n><n>I'll give you some feedback.<n><n>### Workflow<n><n>The first thing you will see on the test is a Workflow. Below is an instruction for how to use the testing tool.

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. This technique is known as the __________ effect.<n><n>### Rationales:  The effect is the mirror neuron  It causes the human to have the same neurons as the object they are trying to replicated.<n><n>Answer:  mirroring<n>

Choices:  A: very ugly B: appear beautiful C: free slaves D: pay bills E: suffering pain<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### A<n><n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input :A person's name is composed of up to 25 letters, there are up to 25 places to live, there are up to 50 students in a class. How many ways can a group of people be described by name, home, and classroom assignments? Rationales:<n><n>There can be any number of people.<n>A person's name can have any length, so the number of ways to describe a person will be up to 25 because that's how many letters they can have.<n>There can be any amount of students in class.<n>There can be more than 25 places to liv<n><n>Hence there are `(25 choose 7)*(50 choose 17)*(1 choose 0)` to solve the problem.<n><n>#### 711700<n>Answer:  7 117 00<n><n>##  Task 3: Write your code for counting combinations below. When you are done, press the `Run My Code` for a preview of it.<n><n>### Input<n>Input: How many different license plates could there be in a state if a driver could use letters or numbers, but must have at least one letter, and at least one number?<n>Rationales The driver could choose 2 letters and 4 numbers to represent the license. The possibilities of how to arrange the license is `(26 choose 2)*(10 choose 4)=(26 choose 2*10 choose 4)*(10 choose (26-2)*4)`<n>#### 45 050<n>Answer: 7 227 032 288 401 042 240.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Why would someone be wet after being full of fear? Choices:  A: run B: swimming C: calculate things quickly D: fight enemy E: urinate<n><n>### Response:		<n>There 2 things that we would do to express our fear.<n>### B: A swim for miles<n>### C: This is usually the common expression, we would calculate things to think through.<n><n>### The common one would be the D<n>### E: This is when you're scared of something, you gotta wee.<n><n>### C, E<n><n>### B<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Questions:<n>### Input:A woman lives above a pub in Cambridge, England.  The roof leaks.  She decides that the best solution is to spend $1200.00 on a new roof.  Each hour of labor costs $73.07 and each roll of tar costs $6.32.  She lives alone and prefers to spend no more than one hour per day working on the roof.  It will rain for one week out of each month.  If she doesn't want to work or repair the roof in the rain, how many months of the year should it rain in order to spend no more than $2050.20 on the new roof?<n><n>### Rationales:For one hour, a woman can either work on a roll of tar, or she can work on tar for one hour and then replace a roll of tar.  So one woman can either:  (work for an hour to replace a tar roll).  Or: (work on either a roll of tar for one hour, or replace a roll of tar).  Let's call the woman's work "r"<n><n>### R: One whole day's worth of work includes:  r time, plus:  r time for tar, plus: T tar.  So 1 day’s work is equal to:  r, plus: r for T, plus:T<n><n>### Let: (time) equal to: t - to make it easier on the arithmetic<n><n>### 1 week of rain for an entire month = 12 weeks.<n>### $2050 = r + t, or<n>### r + t = $2050<n><n>### By setting r+t = $205, we can also write:<n>### $2750 =

On the date of the loan balance disbursement, which of the following will be true if:  There is 9 month of interest?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>The first day of school is a day past June 1. (6+1=<< 6+1=7>>7).<n>The first day of the following semester is 3 days after the first day of school.  (7+3=<<7+3=10>>10).<n>Subtracting the 9 month of interest from this, the total should be 2, but for the disbursement company it will have it as 0.<n>Thus, the loan will be disbursed.<n><n>### Answer: 2<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Inputs: 4200 is divided equally among 9 people. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:James was delayed for a couple of hours because he had a connection.  Where might his connection be? Choices:  A: company B: airport C: wall D: computer network E: love<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Rationales: A is company, B is airport, C is wall, D is computer network and E is love.<n><n>### Input :A: ____ B: ____ C: ____ D: ____ E: ____<n><n>### Response :C<n><n>### Instuction :Draft a response to the following:<n><n>A: ____<n><n>B: ____<n><n>C: ____<n><n>D: ____<n><n>E: ____<n><n><n><n>### Input<n>James was delayed for a week because he had a connection with the woman who was coming along as a travel companion.  Where might his love connection be? Choices (A) company, (B) airport, (C) wall, (D) computer network, (E) love<n><n>### Answer<n>Love Connection(C)<n><n><n>### Example:<n><n>### Instructions<n>Input:The car-rental agony charges $30 / day for rental. The car is reserved for 6 days<n>The car is returned one day late for a total of $180, how much does the late fine cost?<n><n>### Answer:late fine is $20 (20% of $30) for late return<n><n>% of $30 = $20<n><n>## C++ Programming Language : Hackerrank<n>### Instruciton<n><n>Write a program that reads in an arbitrarily-sized positive integer and calculates the sum of the digit if the sum is greater than 10, or the sum of the digit is otherwise outputted to the console:<n><n>Input<n><n>Read in a number.<n><n>Output<n><n>Print 1 for the first digit, 2 for the second, 3 for the third, … the number of digits of the given number.<n><n>Example Input<n><n>1321233<n><n>Example Output<n><n>1233<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What is the opposite of foolhardy? Choices:  A: guilty conscience B: fear C: go free D: problems E: find god<n><n>### Response:		<n>```c++<n>#include <stdio.h><n>int main()<n> {<n>    scanf("%s",argv[1]);<n>    if(fname.size() > 26 || fname.size() < 1) //size to be within 1-26<n>    {<n>        return -1; //exit function<n>    }<n>    fname[fname.size() - 1] = 0; //set NULL value at last place<n><n>    system(argv[1]); //execute command from fname to "cmd" or "sh" depending on how we used the argv[1] at this point(i.e. cmd for cmd command or sh for sh command)<n> }<n>```<n><n>### Output:<n>![output](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79191256/152082467-6b095ac7-dbec-42f3-8675-36a0e61f182f.png)<n><n>---<n><n>## [C++] 10009<n><n>Input:  It costs $100 to rent a car at a major airport.  Add $2 per hour for each additional hour you keep the car. How much will it cost to rent a car from 9 A.M. to 5 P.M., on Wednesday?<n><n>## Demonstration:<n><n>**9 A.M.**<n><n>##**9:**0**0** A.M.** - 100**0** = >>>10:00 - 100 = -900 -> (-900).<n><n>##0**0** A**.**M. - 100=<<--.>>0 -> 0.<n><n>**5:**0** P.**M.**<n>##3**5**: 0** P.** M. - 200 = 1500 -> 1500.<n><n>## **9 A.M. - 9:00 P.M.** 58:51 *10=58

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What might the inability to learn cause? Choices:  A: intelligence B: education C: effectiveness D: distress E: a stupid<n><n>### Response:		B)<n><n>### Input :Why do we need people in the world who can think for themselves? The rate of travel is about 30 miles an hour traveling toward the coast and the same rate of travel when traveling away from the coast.<n><n>### Suppose the trailer can carry a maximum number of head of cattle, so the entire rancher’s stock will require a different number of trips in the trailer and will require about the same number of trips out.<n><n>### Given these events, what do you think the rancher will say is the average driving time required to move the 300 head to high ground?<n><n>### Response 2:<n><n>#### 20<n>Answer: 20<n><n>### Instructer:A certain piece of farm equipment requires a certain amount of horsepower. There is an implication that the listener is not currently present.<n>A: What a day.<n>B: Do I know you?<n>C: Where did you get lost?<n>D: Are you still awake?<n>E: What a wonderful day.<n>#### B<n>Answer:(B)<n><n>Input: A boy asks his father, "Am I the son of your wife?"<n>His father says, "No, you are the son of your mothers' mother's husband who is not my son."<n>Whats the relationship between the boy and his father?<n><n>### Rationales:<n>The boy is the son of his father's mom/wife, which means his father's wife is not in fact his mom, and his mother's husband is his dad.<n>This in turn means his mother is his dad's wife's mom/mom's husband.<n>This in turn makes his mom's relationship to his dad, as his wife's mother's husband (and not the other way around.)<n>Therefore his father is his mother's husband, which is the opposite of what my original statement was.<n><n>Answer: Fathers grandfather<n>Answer: F<n><n>Input: A lady walks out of a store with a large pile of books. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where can you find a movie theater along with other stores in one placE? Choices:  A: downtown area B: urban area C: new york city D: shopping mall E: military base<n><n>### Response:		Choice E: military base<n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. If you had an account with a zero balance, you would have to wait in line. If your account balance was positive, you would not have to wait in line, but could visit several offices. That, said the teacher, was the way to make time.<n><n><n><n><n><n>#### Explanation:<n>1) When we go to the bank in time A  and have a zero account. You may or may not have too wait for how long. The time may be short or long.<n>2) When we go to bank in time A and have a account with a positive balance. You may or may have to wait for how long.The time may be short or may be long.<n>3) When we go to  a bank in time B and have a zero account you may or may not have wait. The time may be  short or long.<n>4) If we go to a bank in time B  and have a positive account you must wait for how long.<n><n><n><n>##### Example<n><n>###  If you have a 0 balance in your account<n><n>##### Instruction<n>What is the minimum amount of minutes you may have to wait?<n><n>###  Suppose that you have a positive balance in your account<n>##### Instruction:<n>How much do you need to deposit in order to avoid waiting more than 4 minutes?<n><n><n><n><n>### Input 4:<n><n>### Input4:In 100 seconds I can do any of the following:<n>1 A) play 60-second game<n>2 B) play 50-second game<n>3 C) play 40-second game<n>4 D) do homework<n>5 E) play a 35-second game<n>6 F) watch TV<n>G) go shopping.<n>How many seconds can be spent doing any one individual item?<n><n>### Solution
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:When she went to examine the thing, what was she considering doing with it? Choices:  A: eat cake B: buy C: interests D: complex E: learn about<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Explanation:A<n>	<n>### Input:What else is on the list? Choices: 	A: cake B: cake C: cake D: cake E: cake<n><n>### Response:"cake" should be repeated two times. We can find it by checking the "cake" appears once on the list and it's next to "cake"<n><n>### Exaplanation:"cake" should appear twice on the list. It shows that the options we can choose is "cake" only<n><n>### Instructions:Choices: 	A) Add more information.B) Add cake.C) Add a total.D) Add more choices.E) Subtract<n><n>### Response:{<n>			add:<add:3><n>			total:<total:46><n>			<choose:A:addCake> <choose:B:cake><n>				<chooseC:A:add><n>			 <choose:B:interests> </chooseB><n>			</choose><n>			 </choose><n>		}<n><n>### Explenation:Add:In "add" section, it's ask to add more information. So the answer is <add:3>. It means add 3<n><n>### Total :in "total" section, it'stask to add a total. So the answer is : <total:46> <n>### Choice :In "choices"  it's ask to choose an option.<n>The answer will be <choose:A:add:C:cake> : A and C<n>### In "Add" and "AddC" section we can choose A and C for "Choices".And in the "Choices" section, the correct choice are A.<n><n>### Inputs:There are 6 bags with a total of 5 ounces of water in them. They are filled in a way that the total weight of the water is just more than 1 pound. How much, in ounces, do each of the bags weigh? Choices: 1. 1.1, 2. 2.4, 3. 2, 4.

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices: A: paying $50 to rent a car B: car rental by the day (30 days) for $2,500 C: rent a car for a week for $4,000 D: rent it by month for $19,600<n><n>## Rationales:<n><n>#### Option A:<n>$$\require{cancel}      26\cancel{/}27\approx0 \ \ \square   $$<n><n>#### Option B:<n>$$\require*{\array{c}\begin{array}{r|r}<n>  D = 30 * 50 & D = 3,000   \\<n>  A = 1 * 50 &  A = 500   \\<n>  500 < D < 40000  &  30 < A <  10   \\<n>  \text{Yes} \end{array}}<n> \ \ \square  <n>$$<n><n>#### Option C:<n>$$\require=*{\array{c}<n>  D =  4 * 4000 & \text{No} \ \ \square<n>$$<n><n>####Option D<n>$$\require=1{\array{c}D= 4 * 2000 \text{No}   $$<n><n>####No<n><n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input ::If a human wants to escape from another human, where might they go to do this? Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Before getting a divorce, what did the wife feel who was doing all the work? Choices:  A: harder B: anguish C: bitterness D: tears E: sadness<n><n>### Response:		Anguish.<n><n>#### D<n>Answer: D<n><n>### Input:(1/7)^n = 16(1/8)^n = 7(1/3)^n = 2^n = 4<n>What is n<n>Rationales: You multiply everything together to get 16*7*2^n = 16*7^n = 1.56^n<n>After dividing both sides by 16 you get 7^n = 2^1.56 n<n>When you take the exponent and divide it that means you have to to get: 1.56^(1/7)<n>1.56 = 0.242424...<n>And 0.24 * 7 = 1.5. Then that means: 1.5(1/7)^n<n>1.5(1.56^((1/7)n)).<n>So you get 1.5(0.24^n).<n>Then 1.5*(0.162424^n)<n>1.5(016242.24^n) then 1.500000953^n.)<n>Then 1.00000024^n<n>Then (1.00016241^1/7)^n.<n>Then (19/7)^n.Then 7^n.<n>#### 8<n>Answer: 8<n><n>### Input(1/7)^(2/3)^n (1/2)^(3/4)^n = x/(7x)^n<n>If n = 2<n>Find x<n>Rationales: n = 2 --> 1*(2/3)^(2/3) = 1<n>(1/7)*(1/2)^(1/4)<n><n>#### 2<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input x<n><n>### Output x^2<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Write the arithmetic expression needed to check the given output.<n><n>x^2<n><n>##<n><n>### Input The number one squared is<n><n>### Output 1, right?<n><n>### Response Write the arithmetic expression necessary to check if the answer is correct.<n><n>#### 1

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: full stomach B: getting full C: gaining weight D: sick E: satisfaction<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write a complete response below. The first of your response should be a topic statement: that is a statement that clearly introduces the topic for your topic sentence. The topic statement should be at the beginning of the response. The topic sentence should refer to the topic, and should present a claim that is relevant to the main idea of the prompt. The next part of the response should be an explanation and analysis of the prompt with evidence, and the part should start with the phrase "I explain". There are other instructions for the explanation and analysis part. The response should have at least 150 words, and a source.<n><n>### Directions<n><n>Write a response in which you explain your position on the issue stated or assumed in the prompt. Your response should consider the point of view of both the writer and the audience. Your answer should be well-developed and well-organized.<n><n>You should begin with a topic statement that provides the specific direction you intend to take with the writing in the explanation.<n><n>The topic statement can be positioned at the beginning of the text as it has already been given. The positioning is the key to the task.<n><n>You should follow your topic statement with an explanation, including a reason that provides evidence for why you hold the position you express in your topic statements.<n><n>Each main point in what is written in response, should be stated clearly and precisely, and include a specific claim that provides the most convincing evidence that clearly states why the response is positioned in the way that you state and give evidence. Each claim may include its own analysis of two or more viewpoint positions, reasons, and/or specific evidence, for why the claim is true.<n><n>The explanation is the key to the response. However, do not forget the reasons.<n><n>The response should include at least one reason (with or with-out explanation of the evidence supporting the claims being given for them).<n><n>#### The explanation should include two or more reasons.<n><n>The analysis part of the response should include an analysis of two or more points of view, with one or more pieces of evidence per point of view, and a citation for evidence from the prompt, that supports each specific claim that is given throughout the response. The key to the response is to give a counterview to the view that is given in the prompt, so the conclusion can consider this counterview.<n><n>The reason given for a claim

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. The demand is driving what to carry them? Choices:  A: ditch B: shop C: north america D: pet shops E: outdoors<n><n>### Response:		<n>The correct answer is : Exotic snakes are selling like hotcakes, which is why prices are rising.<n><n>### Conclusion:<n>In order to understand the current market of exotic snakes, one must look at the 4 main factors, which are price, quantity, demand and supply.<n><n>In this case, we are dealing with an increase in price of exotic snakes caused by an increase in demand.<n>This is known as a market failure, which is a circumstance that leads to an inefficient market, where the price of the good is higher than under a situation of perfect competition.<n><n>The law of supply and demand states that in a free market, when the price of a good or service rises, an extra quantity will be offered for sale, and when the price falls, quantity demanded will rise.<n><n>In this current market it looks as if the price has increased, in terms of snake owners who are now willing to pay more money to buy these snakes. This could be because snake owners want to show off their snakes by buying accessories for the snakes such as exotic cages, this could mean that there is an increase in the quantity demanded for these goods and services and an increase in price.<n><n>Because there is an increase in demand, the quantity supplied will decrease. With 6 exotic snakes remaining up for grabs, the owners who previously sold their snakes at 300 could decide to increase their price to over 300 now that demand is higher and the quantity supplied falls, meaning now that there are more people competing to own the exotic snakes they are willing to pay more and more, therefore the price of the 6 snakes has increased from 300, to 312.50.<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>With respects to an equation, the law of supply is represented by the equation price=f(s), and represents the inverse of inverse of price=/ 1\(d\) and represents the inverse of the law demand.<n>In an increase in price, the quantity demanded would decrease. An increase in price would not necessarily cause a shift in demand. It would need to be a shift in the market price. For a new market to arise, there will need to be an increase in the number of buyers, and for the same amount of buyers, there would need

Choices:  A: brain problems B: laziness C: get fat D: headache E: laughter<n><n>### Response:		Answer the question.<n><n>#### A<n>Headache<n><n>![](headaches.jpg)<n><n>In the picture above when you have 20-20 vision, it means that the object that you are looking at is standing 20' away (1 foot=12 inches=30.48 centimeters). In the world of opticians, 20/20 vision means you have excellent vision (20/20 ≈ 1.0) In this sense, people with 20/22 vision have a little blurry vision (20/30 ≈ 1 ≅.91).<n><n>Abraham Piña<n><n>### Input:(Source: The Huffington Post, June 22, 2012) A woman whose job it is to help people learn to walk again after a stroke was recently asked to lead a training class for the staff at a local nursing home.  Unfortunately, she was a terrible teacher.  Her lesson had two main points: 1. If you’re walking up an incline, keep your head up; if walking down, look at the ground.<n><n>### Response:(Source: The Hufferington Post, June 4, 2013) There was a man who had an unusual hobby: he wanted to meet all the world’s dictators. He finally got to meet the dictator of North Korea. The first thing the dictator did was throw a brick of heroin in his face, then kicked him into the Pyongyang prison, where he was beaten within an inch of his life. That was that. The man was a little shaken, and made up his mind to never try it again.<n><n>###  Answer:(Source: The Hufferington Post, April 19, 2014) A local hospital was in the middle of a huge remodeling project. They put out an advertisement in the local paper asking for people to donate old, unwanted items that could be used as artwork in the new wing. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What is eating too much dinner likely to result in? Choices:  A: tiredness B: living longer C: stomach ache D: illness E: acid reflux<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Rationales:A: Tiredness B: Living longer C: Stomach Ache D:illness E: Acid Reflux<n><n>#### A<n><n>Answer: A<n><n>#### B<n><n>Answer: B<n><n>#### C<n><n>Answer: C<n><n>#### D<n><n>Answer: D<n><n>#### E<n><n>Answer: E<n><n>### Instructions: Write a complete sentence that accurately completes each request. Write sentences in your best handwriting so the reader can interpret your answers accurately.<n><n>### Input:(The time in the car rental agency.)<n><n>Input: A car rental agency charges $35 per day for a car, or __________________ for the first week fora rental that lasts longer than a week.<n><n>### Rationale:The first time is for 7 days and the second time is for the total rental amount<n><n>#### $190<n><n>Answer: $35/day = $ << 35/day = 29.440<n><n>Input per week: $35/week = $ << 337.60<n><n>Input for the total rental: $35 * x = $ <<35*x=3675<n><n>### Final Answer:<n><n>#### 337.75<n><n>Answer: There is also a second time<n><n>The first time is for: $35/7 = $ <<35/7= 5.00<n><n>The second time is for:<n><n><n>The first time and the second time are for<n>$35 + 5=$ <<35 + 5=30>>30=<<30*7=210>>210 ( 2 times 7<n><n>210/35 = 6 ( 210/30=$<<210/3=7>> 7 2/3 <n><n><n>Answer:<n><n>$35/week=$<<35/week=$<n><n>Answer:<n>35/7 =$<<35/7=5>><n>35/week =$<<35/$7=5>><n>190 =$<<190=$<n>35 * 9=$<<35*$7=<n>3675=$<<3

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What is a grumpy person likely to have? Choices:  A: headache B: understand themselves C: compliments D: own house E: happiness<n><n>### Response:		They are Grumpy! <n><n>### Rationales:<n>We don't know the person's characteristics.<n><n>### Choice:<n>A<n><n>#### A<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input:[479, 582, 685, 788, 891]<n><n>### Output: A list of the 25 smallest numbers among the given numbers.<n><n>### Rationale:<n>This is an input and output programming task. <n>1. Create a list that contains the input<n>2. In order, use a for loop to go through the list, incrementing the counter by 1 each time the for loop runs.  In my example, for loop=1 i=1,2,3,4,5,... then increment counter<n>3. If the counter is smaller than the numbers it has compared to the list, put the smaller number in the list<n>4. When the loop is finished put the counter number (with one less than the smallest number) to the list.  In my example 479 is the smallest of the given numbers.  For instance, when the list is created and we are at counter=1, I know the number I need is 479 because 479<(480-1) as well.  479<479.<n>5. Display the list of the 20 smallest numbers.<n><n>## Solution:<n>```<n># List input numbers<n>numbers = [479, 788]<n><n># Put numbers in a numberList<n>counter = 0<n>for i in range(len(numbers)):<n>    if i ==0:<n>        numberList.append(numbers)<n>    else:<n>        counter += 1<n>        if numberList[counter] < numbers:<n>            numberList[counter] = numbers<n>num25 = len(numberList)-1<n>numberList[num25] = counter<n>print(numberList)<n>```<n>#### 588<n>Answer: [479,582,685,788,891]<n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: under rocks B: manhattan C: toenails D: grocery store E: fallen tree<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>In all of these places there is less sunlight. Rocks are typically found in many places where the sunlight is less, such as the jungle, desert, and forests. The jungle has sunlight all the time, but the desert does not. There are many rocks in these places where less sunlight penetrates the surface of the ground. Rocks also shelter the earth from sunlight on the top.<n><n>A:Under rocks, B: Manhattan(Manhattan has some less sunlight than many places in the country, but not on the entire island so that can be disqualified), C: Toenails(Hmm...if they choose this, they need to specify which one), D: Grocery Store(There is no sunlight in a grocery store what about the basement of a building there are no windows there), E: Fallen Tree(I just got a picture of rotting tree, this must be close to rotting of a tree)<n><n>### Input:(2,1)(3,2)(2,5)(1,3)(0,0)(1,5)(5,0)<n><n>### Response:(0,0)(1,-2)(2,1)(-1,1)(-3,-4)(2,2)(-3,2)(3,4)(-1,-3)(1,1)(1,1)(2,2)<n><n>### Example:(3,2)(2,-3)(5,-4)<n><n>### Instructions:Represent this list with arrows of the number to the next coordinate.<n><n>### Example:<n>The number of people attending a wedding reception has a density of 656 per square meter. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What state is the John Davis  Lodge toll road found in? Choices:  A: new jersey B: eastern united states C: good repair D: connecticut E: arizona<n><n>### Response:		(Select the appropriate choice to produce an answer that completes the request.)<n><n>A<n><n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input : I recently purchased 55 pounds of rice and decided to keep some of it in my room, rather than store it in my kitchen.  I have 75 percent of the available space in my room.  I could store all of the rice in my storage closet on the floor, if I stacked each bag on top of another bag.  The bags each measure 6 × 11 × 13 inches.  If I were to stack each bag on top of the bag on another bag, I will have 6/55 * 75 = <<6/55*75=1>>1 bag, or 4.82% of my available space in my room left for storage.  I then store the rice in my closet on the floor.  Each bag is 6 × 12 × 14 inches tall.  If I were able to store the rice in the closet, I would have an additional 6*12*14 / 55 = <<6*12*24/55=1>>12.65% of my available space for storage.  How many pounds of rice could I store at the maximum allowed by my closet?<n><n>### Rationale:There are 4.82 percent remaining.<n><n>1 remains.<n><n>55 / 55+1 = 54 / 55+2 = 54 / (55+2) = 54 * 55 / ((55+2)*2) = 2.9*54 * 54 = 141.76,<n>then round to the nearest whole number.<n>Thus, it can hold 141 pounds.<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:If someone is aloof and self-important, what is their experience when meeting people? Choices:  A: stress B: nervousness C: smile D: being bored E: making new friends<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Answer: Choice(s):  ______A______<n><n>### Justification:<n><n>Answer: Answer C<n><n>Input:Rewrite each set of parentheses using only grouping symbols, in order to remove the parentheses.( )( )( )( )<n>Rationales: First, parenthesis was used to enclose the set of numbers.<n>The set of numbers  was enclose within the braces were the set of parentheses was nested.<n>That meant the set of numbers enclose by parentheses and braces was the set being contained.<n>To remove the grouping symbols, the enclose brackets were removed and all of the contained numbers were multiplied by the 3 contained sets of numbers.<n>Thus, was replaced by (3)(3)+(6)+(9)(10)=<<(3)(3)+(9)+(10)(10)=42>>42.<n>#### 42<n>Answer: 42<n><n>### Input<n>##### Input: If someone is aloof (self-important ) what is their exp (experience) when meeting people. _______A______ _______B______ _______C______ _______D______ _______E_______<n>### Justification<n><n>Answer:<n><n>Answer C<n><n>### Input  : In a recent report, the average total hours required to achieve a particular goal in 4 major divisions was 75 hours.  The average total hours required to complete the project was 72 hours.  Describe the relationship between the two sets of data.(The solution uses algebraic modeling).______________________________<n><n>## Solution: The average total hours required was 72 <n><n>and<n><n>Average Hour required for the whole project was 72<n><n>The hours required to complete task for division 1 was 200<n><n>so<n><n>Average hours required  for division 1 was  200/4=50<n><n><n><n>### Instructions 1<n><n>#### Cases:<n>(1) Jennie rented a house for 30 days.  How did that month’s rent compare with the monthly cost of renting a house from which she rented the car-rental agencies that she made use of for her week-long car rental?<n>Answer: _______A
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where would a person keep a book while it's being read? Choices:  A: closet B: library of congress C: classroom D: in bed E: desk<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Input : The amount an apartment was recently rented for is $2200. The rent was due at the beginning of the month and was not paid until the 17th. How much, in minutes, should the rent be late that month?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>#### 2200/2 = 11000/12<n><n>### Response : 750<n><n>### Demo: 750/60=6.25<n><n>### 6.25<n>### 750<n>### Input: How much did the car that is selling for $12,179 cost to buy brand new 2.5 years ago?<n>### Response: $12,150<n>### Demostaration:<n>### $12,189 X.3 = $3659.65<n>### $3569.65 + $1 = $35696.65<n>##input : 35696<n>##$3571<n>### Output: 3571<n><n>### Input How many years will it take a $10000 stock investment to grow to $17000 when interest is paid at 15% per year compound quarterly?<n>### Response :10 years<n>### Demostation:<n>### 10 years X 4 = 40 years<n>### $1000 X 4 =4000 <n>### $14000 - $4000 = $1000<n>### $1700 - $45 = $1655<n>### $1655 = 4000 – 45<n>##$1610<n><n>### response : 1610<n>###<n><n>

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. We require real code at Stackoverflow instead of screenshots of code.<n><n>Comment: My bad. Hope this helps.<n><n>Answer: This is a good practice for debugging your code. You are using the wrong syntax for your code.<n><n>Firstly,  there is no need to write your function in an outer function. Also, function body should always have a bracket `{}`. The 2nd and 3rd line should be:<n><n>\begin{code}<n>def answerQuestion():<n>    """<n>    Description: The function will find which of your answer is correct according to given question and instructions.<n>    """<n>    # Write this: instructionAnswer = ("Input Question here, example:")<n><n>    instructionAnswer = """<n>    input: The car-renting agency charges $32/day for a car and $15 for the first week for rental that last over 7 days. James rented a car for four and a half weeks. How much, in Dollars, did he pay for the rental?"""<n><n>    # Write this line: instructionAnswer = ("Instruxion above")<n>    instructionAnswer = ("Instruction Above") # I think I should add more description here<n><n>    return  instructionAnswer<n><n># Now we will pass inputQuestion and instructionToAnswers to the function<n><n>instructionToAnswers, question = inputQuestion(), answerQuestion() #instructionToAnsers are our instructions and answers respectively.<n>\end{code}.<n><n>Also, you do not need to make your method static in Python, you only need to remove the `def` line. I highly suggest you to look through basic python functions [here](https://www.javatpoint.com/python-functions)<n><n>Comment: I tried it and now I get a syntax error. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle. Choices: A: Implementation Risk B: Cost Risk C: Schedule Risk D: Change Risk E: Technical Risk<n><n>### Demo: <n>Implementer risk is the risk of the project not being able to be implemented and not meeting the client's requirements. Cost risk is the risk of being over budget.  Schedule risk is the risk of not meeting the deadline or date. <n><n>### Answer: E<n><n>## Input:  A risk register is created and maintained by: Choices: A: the project manager B: the risk team C: the project sponsor D: the customer E: the project scope<n><n>## Demo: You have to create a Risk Register in every situation. How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:You can hear testimony of how spirituality changes lives when you do what? Choices:  A: go to church B: appear in court C: watch soap operas D: paying attention E: go into court<n><n>### Response:		Appears in court<n><n>### Instructor Note:<n>1. There are five choice A,B,C,D,E<n><n>2. A= appear in court,B= go to church,C= watch soap operas,D= paying attention,E= go into court
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where would you put a folding chair if you do not plan to use it and you do not have any large doors in your house? Choices:  A: roof B: school C: beach D: closet E: garage<n><n>### Response:		Choice:<n>Input:Where would you put your folding chair if you don't plan to use it and if you do not have any "large doors"? Choices:"A": roof "B": school "C": beach "D": closet "E": garage<n><n>## Notes:<n><n>- In the instruction, the wording "if you do not have any LARGE doors" makes no sense. I think the question is really asking "do not have any DOORS".<n>- The words in the original question were "school" and "beach".<n>- The wording should be "house" or "garage" instead of "house?" and "garage?"<n>- It is better to use "in your housE" instead of "in thE house."<n>- It is better for the question to be grammatically correct instead of having one of the words capitalized.

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Though it stayed strictly indoors, the small dog felt like it had all the space in the world in the what? It is just an indoor dog. But it should be a big house.  <n>If it went outside and felt like it had all space in the world, It may have felt at home at the dog park or big space. 
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:They were getting together for the big game, he wasn't hosting but made sure to bring pretty of food with him over to where? It is 55% of their revenue<n><n>### Answer:<n>It said that 14,000,000 consumer transactions were overcharged so they did this 14,0 000,0 00 00 times.<n>55/14,0 75,0 00,00<n>55/100 = 0.55<n><n>### Instructions and Input:<n>Input:  The shipping manager estimated the fuel costs as a function of the cargo weight. What was the shipping cost, s, in dollars? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.
