A: 31 B: 34 C: 34.5 D: 35 E: 41<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>### Answer:<n><n><n><n>### Input:"20/3=70, so 150-70=80"<n><n>### Rationale:<n>### Step 1: The first number is the multiplier<n>### Step 2: The second number is the dividend<n>### Step 3: The answer is the remainder<n><n>### Answer:"150-60=90"<n><n>## Extra Credit<n><n>### Input:@"160/30=6, so 160-60=100"<n><n>## I can...<n>### **A)** use the ÷, ⋅, and = signs correctly in equations<n>### **B)** subtract from the dividend and divide by the multiplier to simplify division<n>### **C)** round down any numbers above 9 if I want a nice number<n>### **D)** use a calculator to help solve math problems that I am working on<n>### **E)** write mathematical expressions, including proper operator use<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Sky diving scared him, once they jumped out of the plane he began losing consciousness while what? Choices:  A: injury B: death C: playing uno D: coma E: falling down<n><n>### Response:		B - Death.<n><n>### Rationales:  Sky diving scared him. So, When he jumped out of the<n>plane he began losing consciousness. Then he died.<n><n>### Input a sentence from the given paragraph and write a response that completes the request. Each correct response receives an x.<n><n>In a world where the number of people living with dementia is growing at a rapid pace, scientists are scrambling to produce a medication that would both halt the progression and reverse cognitive decline.<n><n>### Response and Rationales:  One of the people who have researched dementia for many years has been studying if some other illness could be linked to dementia. It is a slow process, but she is hopeful to find a cure.<n>#### x<n>Answer: x<n><n>

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. You may want to mark up your answer sheet as you complete the following questions, and use that mark up in the answer section.   Choices:  A bullfrog was walking down the road the first time.  The second time he was trying to run.  The third time he was running away from a snake 4 times longer then him. C 4B B 6 D 8<n><n>### Response <n>Input:<n>The bullfrog was crawling down the road, then he was running, and then he was racing away from a snake<n>There were 4 legs on each side, then there are 4 legs on each back legs and on the forward legs <n>This makes a total of 12. The first 8 legs are webbed and that number of legs is 6. The other 4 legs are used for crawling, so the total legs are used for crawing is 2. Then we add the 6 and 2 together = 8.<n><n><n><n>#### 8<n>Answer: 8<n><n><n><n><n><n>

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: agreement B: to fill their time C: discomfort D: misunderstanding E: learning about<n><n>### Response:		D) When people discover something new, they are more likely to want to explain it to the other people. A person wants to feel that the time they spent talking was worthwhile. Even if they agree with the topic, if the group doesn’t understand when they explain the topic, the person will not feel it was worthwhile.<n><n>### Input>A: If we don’t learn what we want to do at school<n>B: we will probably get a job doing something we don’t want to do<n>C: maybe no one will want to hire us for a specific job<n>D: we will end up poor and unproductive<n>E: we will probably get bored at our job and complain all day about it<n>F: we will probably have good income and a well known position<n>Answer:B)<n><n>### Input><C: You can be a vegetarian.<n>D: Vegetarians eat vegetables instead of other kinds of food.<n>E: Vegetarians should eat more vegetables.<n>F: For this reason, vegetarians often are thin.<n>G: Some vegetarians are not thin.<n>H: They might be hungry all the time.<n>J: For this reason, they might weigh too much.<n>K: People who weigh much should be thin.<n>L: They eat only vegetables.<n>M: This will prevent them from becoming hungry.<n>N: If they eat too many vegetables, they will be thin.<n>O: For this reason, only vegetarians are hungry.<n>>P: People who are hungry should not eat food that is healthy.<n>>Q: People who are not hungry should eat food that is healthier.<n>>R: Vegetarians are not healthy.<n>E)N<n><n>### Input>: If a company is publicly funded, where does its profits come from?<n>: A: private capital<n>: B: stock market<n>: C: governments<n>: D: the company itself<n>: E: private and public companies that the company deals with<n>: F: shareholders that buy the company’s stock<n>: G: stock brokers and traders<n>: H: any of the possible above<n>Answer:B) The stock market<n><n>### Input>>Would you like to be an engineer in the Space Shuttle program?
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Janet knew she was dying from her injuries because she could feel herself doing what? Choices:  A: sleeping longer B: getting cold C: death and decay D: change of color E: stop breathing<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### Answer: B<n><n>### Input-In a small town there are three stores (a hardware store, a clothing store, and a bakery). Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:He was a very sharp engineer, but when it came to the details his calculations could were often what? Choices:  A: complimentary B: inelegant C: ocean D: dull E: inaccurate<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Choices: A C<n><n>### Rationale:<n>C is closest to inaccurate.<n><n>### Input<n>Molly is working on a cost analysis project for her new car. On Day 1, she paid $45,000 for the vehicle, including tax and title, and another $15,000 in shipping charges.  On Day 2, she purchased insurance for 60 days for $1,475.  On Day 3, she made her first payment (to her bank) on the vehicle: 20% down payment of $8,000 plus an interest charge for the period between the purchase date and the payment date.  On Day 4, she made an additional payment: the next 20% of the down payment (i.e., $4,000), plus the previous payment’s interest charge (the next day after the previous payment).  On Day 5, she made another payment. Once again, she paid 20% of her original down payment and interest for the period between the previous payment and the day of payment. What were the total cash payments on the first 5 days combined?<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>A 45000+15000+x+20x+190=<<45000 + 15000 + x + 20x + 190 = 65550>>65550<n><n>B 45002+15502+x+20(15002)+(1475-20x)=64422+94502+x<n><n>C 6555x+20x*1=4486x+20x<n><n>D 6555+15002+20(190)=66412<n><n>E 0<n><n>#### 4500(650)<n>Answer: 6545(10)<n><n>### Input(Demystified):<n><n>#### 2(567)<n>Answer: 5(1153)<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>#### 1311
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The electric motor powered many important things, including one if almost every house. Name this item? Choices:  A: electric locomotive B: electric typewriter C: multi-coloured walrus D: electric refrigerator E: electric drill<n><n>### Response:		<n>The electric motor is not a refrigerator, nor does it drive an electric locomotive. Thus, it's not correct to say that it is very likely to be powering an electric locomotive or an electric refrigerator.<n><n>### Rules and Guidelines:<n>There will be more questions.<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Write a response that answers the question(s) or requests the item correctly.<n><n>### Raised to the 1st power = squared<n>### Input:Which is greater:4^2 or 1.2^2?  Choices in order:  A: 16   B: 4   C: 1.44   D: 4   E: 16<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Rationals:A<n><n>```python<n>4^2 = 4*4 = 8<n>```<n><n>## Input:Write a response that correctly answers the question.<n>```python<n>choiceA: 6<n>choiceB: 1<n>choiceC: 24<n>choiceD: 81<n>```<n><n>## Rationals<n>```python<n>a = 2+3=<<2+3=5>>5<n>b = a*a = <<a*a=25>>25<n>6+7+8 =<<6+7+8=21>>21<n>```<n>## Rationals: A<n><n>```python<n>a=8<n>b=2<n>c=20<n>d=8<n>answer = 16<n>```<n><n>##Input: The sum of an odd and even number is even.  Write a response that  correctly completes the question.<n><n>```python <n>2<n>```<n><n>##Rational: B<n><n>```python<n>10+2=12<n>```<n><n>

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:To properly instruct children attending school you would need a great deal of what? Choices:  A: boredom B: patience C: time D: teachers E: inspiration<n><n>### Response:		<n>A <n><n>## Task:  <n>Write an instruction that describes a given task. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. This will result in a quantity that can be divided evenly by both numbers.<n><n>The greatest common factor is not the same as the greatest common divisor.  The greatest common factor is a positive common factor.  The greatest common divisor is the least common divisor.<n><n>A common factor is a positive number that divides two or more numbers evenly.<n><n>The least common multiple is the smallest number that is evenly divided evenly by every number.<n><n>(Corrent answer=G)<n><n><n>### Write out the correct order and then respond:<n> <n>### Part (1) Write the following numbers in an ascending order.<n><n>### Part (2) What is the highest number?<n><n>#### 85<n>#### 37<n>#### 15<n>#### 26<n>#### 25<n>#### 42<n>#### 16<n>#### 6<n>#### 13<n>#### 82<n>#### 23<n>#### 95<n>#### 94<n>#### 3<n>#### 78<n>#### 12<n>#### 10<n>#### 56<n>#### 11<n>#### 24<n>#### 18<n>#### 19<n>#### 17<n>#### 47<n>#### 31<n>#### 100<n>#### 34<n>#### 58<n>#### 43<n>#### 27<n>#### 81<n>#### 59<n>#### 1<n>### Answer: <n><n>#### 136<n><n>### In the following problem, a man is crossing a river in a canoe

For example, in your text, Jane Austen appears sixteen times. In contrast, Louisa M. Alcott appears thirty times.<n><n> <n>>### Instructions:(1) Describe how you would check on the text of the book to be sure that you have the right author for comparison.  <n>(2) What kind of research will you need to do once you compare these numbers?(3) What is another source you could compare other authors with?<n>(4) Describe how you will present the results of your research: how you will describe the author who has the greater number of appearances, for example.<n>(5) Explain how, knowing one author has a greater number of appearances of woman than another, you could use this information to draw conclusions that could be applied to other texts in general, not just these two authors.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:I am looking to buy honey right from an apiary, where should I go? Choices:  A: jar B: stick to fingers C: beehive D: stick to fingers E: farmer's market<n><n>### Response:		You got it. A: jars<n><n>### Instructions: You can only buy honey that has been processed. The answer choices are A, B, C, D, or E and represent stick, bee keeper (farmer), stick, bee keepe (farmer), or farmer's market.<n><n>### Rationale: Jars are processed honey and bee keepers and farmer's markets are not processed honey.<n><n>#### Answer: A<n><n>### Instructer: What would you pay for a loaf of bread? Choose an answer from A to D. Your only correct answer is the one on the chart.<n><n>### Input Answer: Bread: A: $3.00<n><n>## Instructions: Choose the only correct answer on the chart and answer the question.<n><n>## Rationale: The only A for ANSWER is $3.<n>

Buy a Gift baskets that contains the same exact item for $100. Buy Two Gift baskets for $80 each.<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>For $100: <br><n>(2)(100) = 200<br><n><n>For $80:<br><n>(200/100)(100)  = $30<br><n>$80 = $70 + $30 = $100 + $30<n>So the rate of return is 100%!<n><n><n><n>### Instuctions:<n>Write a sentence or a paragraph using the words given in the first sentence.

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What do rich people like in terms of bagels? Choices:  A: poor B: sleepy C: plain D: needy E: homeless<n><n>### Response:		Poor<n><n>### Input:\<n>If you are going to hire helpers for a project, what kinds of things should you look for?<n><n>### Rationales:<n>Answer:Hire hard workers with honesty<n><n>### \<n>### Input:A contractor must replace four pipes and the cost is $2^3 for the first pipe, $3^3 for the second pipe, $1^3 for the third pipe, and $4^3 for the fourth pipe.  The contractor charges a flat rate of $10 with no change, and he spends a total of $30.What is the rate of change in the cost of pipe replacement?<n><n>### \	<n>### **Rationales**<n><n>\#<n>\#<n><n>### Input:-3.6 < x < 3.6<n><n>### Response:\<n>x < 3.6 -3.6 < x 3.6 >= x x is between 1.36 and 4.64<n><n>### \#<n>\#<n>\end{code}<n><n>Comment: Please read the guidelines on how to answer Question for Mathematics. This is not the appropriate forum for Mathematical questions unless you need to include them for context
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What might a person receive from their boss if they do a poor job? Choices:  A: misfortune B: fearful C: criticism D: make mistakes E: promotion appraisal<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Input : What type of person wants to go to a Halloween Party? Choices: A: scary B: fun C: shy D: scary and fun E: a bit of everything<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Bob and Boris were standing in a queue at the grocery store.  They were standing in place.  The line was fast, but the children in front of them were loud.   They were what? Choices:  A: frustration B: being annoyed C: delays D: irritation E: out of order<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><span style="color: red">D</span><n><n>#### Delay<n>Answer: B=6<n><n>### Input Bob and Boris had gone to watch the new Harry Potter movie and they had been very excited.  Unfortunately Boris had fallen asleep because he was tired.  When they got to their seats they found that they were on the wrong side.  What were they? Choices: <n>Choices: <n>Choicest: A: in trouble B: sitting down C: missing D: watching E: wrong<n><n>### Response (Response is not required): <n><n><span style = "color: red">C</span>,<<D>><n><n>#### Missing<n>Answer: B=8
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The child pounded his mitt in excitement while enjoying his first game in the bleachers where? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The parents thought their children should learn teamwork, what were they signed up for? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Well space shuttles are a way to explore space. You can't do anything without them.<n><n>#### A<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input:$11 \times 11 = M \times N <n>$M>N$<n><n>### Response:$11 \times (11-11) = M \times $0$ <n>$M\lt 0$<n><n>#### B<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Input:"There are 600 people who are not vaccinated. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The turkey needed to be kept from spoiling, what is useful in this situation? Choices:  A: refrigerator B: fridge C: freezer D: oven E: bought at store<n><n>### Response:		C<n>The fridge<n><n>### Input : What is the best choice to prevent the spoiling of the pig?<n><n>### Response : A<n><n>### Input The amount of time needed to make a peanut butter sandwich in the kitchen is 6 minutes. If you use a knife to spread the peanut butter, how many minutes will it take?<n><n>### Input What are the three states?<n><n>   1.solid <n>   2.liquid<n>   3.gas<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The person knew the police were after him, so what did he do? Choices:  A: the sun B: catch cold C: prepare to go D: feel humiliated E: hunt for food<n><n>### Response:		What did the person do?<n><n>### Response Input:The person chose B, catch cold, 23 out of the possible 26.<n><n>### Multiple Choice<n>### Output:<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. If you were planning to rent a car for 10 days in all and the 10 days would take a week to rent, which 4-day increment is least expensive for you to rent?<n><n>### Demonsration<n><n>### Output:<n><n>The first week for a rented car is 7 days, the second week is 7 days. We are planning on renting a car for 14 days by taking a week and using it twice.<n><n>Answer: The answer would be the 1st incremet $32 and the 2nd $24, that would be the cheapest since $32 is less than $24.<n><n>The first week(7 days) is $32 and the next week(7 days) you pay the same.<n><n>So after the first week you pay $32, you don't pay the extra $24 until the next week.<n><n>So it's the cheapest, it's $64 to rent a
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:An electronics store had things damaged from the rain, where should these things be stored? Choices:  A: large city B: strip mall C: building D: shopping mall E: aquarium<n><n>### Response:		<n>B<n>#### 98%<n>Given the choices it’s clear that B is the best choice, because it’s the most neutral<n><n><n>### Input :  If you went to the same school as your friends, and your school has about 2500 students, how much money can you contribute to your friend's birthday fund?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input:<n>Friend(s)<n>$10 a friend<n>2500 (number of friends)<n><n>### Response :<n>2500+250 *10=<<2500+9750>>20*$2=<<20*$2=40>>10%<n>#### 20<n>Answer: <n>Input: <n>A <n>A B C D E <n><n>### <n><n>### Response<n>A <n>### Correct solution:<n>The best answer is B because no one is going to donate the whole $12,500 to charity just to give their friend $12,550.  The donation would have to be divided among the friends.  Each friend would get only $27.19: 12500/48 = <<125000/48= 27.19>>.

Choices:  A: alert B: deep sleep C: drink coffee D: open eyes E: conscious<n><n>### Response:		<n>E<n><n>### Rationales:<n>E is always there when there's a situation and needs to know what's happening for sure.<n><n>### Input:(A) I have never rented from a company that didn't have a cancellation policy.  I was pretty disappointed that this company had none.<n><n>### Response<n>This is a true statement.<n><n>### Rationale:(A) I have always rented from a company with a cancellation policy.<n><n>### Answer:<n>A<n><n>### Input :<n>Moving around in the United States is relatively quick and simple.<n><n>### Correct response:<n>B<n><n>### Ratiionales:<n><n>The reason why we drive at 60 mpd is so we can get to California quickly.<n><n>### If we drive at 30 mph, then it would take us way longer to get to California and we would be late for our relatives wedding.<n>### Answer:
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What do humans do when in a race? Choices:  A: lay eggs B: eat fruit C: wrestle D: compete with each other E: draw pictures<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>If someone is winning another person is going to "beat them", this creates competition; therefore competing with each other is "C"<n><n>### Input Choices<n><n>### Response<n><n>Which one?<n><n>#### I choose "D"<n>Answer: D<n><n>### Choices<n>#### B<n>Input: How many squares are there if a square has sides with the length 3?<n>Rationales:# Squares of length 3 = 9.<n>### Choices:The answer is B.<n><n>### Response to choice<n><n>I don't believe the answer is "B". If you draw a square with sides the length of 3, the number of squares is actually 4 not 9.<n><n>### Answer to choice<n>#### D<n>Answer: D<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What happens to people playing games? Choices:  A: winning B: entertainment C: happiness D: cheating E: relaxation<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer(s) is / are: C and D<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. If the tank is emptied completely and refilled at a cost of $4.00 per  gallon, how much does it cost to refill the tank with enough water to cover the pool on the assumption that the pool never gets 1.50 times bigger than it is now?<n>Rationales:- The owner has 1000000 gallons to refill.<n>- The pool holds 1600000 gal-10000 gal = <<10000*1=10,000>>10,00 gallons<n>- Pool = 1600-000 * 1.5 = <<1/600-0/00*8=1000>> 1000gal.<n>- Then they need to refill tank (10000×4)=<<10000X4=40000.00 >><n>40000 gal=<n><n>### Response<n>Input:It will cost $40,000.0<n><n>#### 40,00<n>Answer:40,00-0.0
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:A water spout was seen in the ocean off the coast of what? Choices:  A: florida B: basement C: sink D: beach E: fountain<n><n>### Response:		A: Florida<n><n>### Input<n>Choices A. B. C. D. and E are not appropriate<n><n>### Response<n><n>A.) The correct response would be Florida so that makes E and B incorrect<n>D.) Is not a city<n><n>### Input Choices:Four girls are on the same soccer team and they decided to pick one apple from the tree every day for a week. The cost for a dozen apples is $12.00. How much money will they have in the end after picking?<n><n>Rationales:<n><n>Given the price of the dozen it is 12/12=<<12/12=.>>. So when it’s converted into dollars that would be 1 dollar. So each apple is 12/4 or <<12/4=.>> Each one costs 1 dollar.<n>Because they are picking 4 apples per day, it would be (4*40) which equals 160 dollars

The flea chooses 'E' for his answer.<n>### Answer: jump<n><n>Input: What type of locomotion does the flea use to locomote itself? Choices:  Attack Blood Bites Stay jump<n><n>### Justification- I don't know the correct choice. I choose option 1.<n><n>### Choice:  A: attack (attack the host) B: Bites (bites the host) C: jump (jumps away from the host) D: suck blood (sucks blood?)<n><n>### Choose B.<n>### Rationale- The flea chooses (bites the host).<n>### Choice D- sucks blood (sucks blood?)- Bites, sucks blood, and moves away are all ways to move around.<n>### Choice A- attack- Chooser doesn't understand the question.<n><n>## Solution<n><n>{% include code.html lang="cpp" %}<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Sam was against Allison's decision.  Joe was the opposite.  What was Joe, regarding that decision? Choices:  A: being for B: away from C: combined D: for or E: conjunction<n><n>### Response:		Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Demonstration<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following problem<n>### Rationale<n>* Allison was for the decision<n>* Joe was away from the decision<n>* The answer would be B is for or Away from<n><n>### Answer<n><n>A is against<n><n>### Input<n>Input:In addition to the regular costs, a small convenience store charges the following surcharges:  $5 for a purchase under $5, 30% of the amount of any purchase that is at least $5 but less than $15, $9 for any purchase that exceeds $15, 40% of any purchse if it exceeds $95.  What does the charge for a purchase of $24, exactly on the $15 line? Round your answer to the nearest cent.<n>Rationales:<n>1. When the purchase under $5 is $5 the cost is $18. So to get an exact answer we subtract $5+$18 by $13 giving us 5+18-13.<n>2. If the purchase of $24 is at least $5, you must multiply it by.3 (30%): 9(24) is 124+9=133.<n>3. When you exceed $95 the 40% is $38.<n>4. So you are left with a cost of 131+38.<n>5. Round with 3 signifigant figures. 131+0.38 = 131 rounded + 0.38= 131.38/2 = -.69, so your final answer is -.69.<n>#### -.69<n>Answer: -.69<n><n>### Input II<n>Input:A 16-ounce bottle of water costs either $.78 if you buy it at a grocery store, or $.40 if you buy it at the gas station.  What was the average price of the bottles of water?<n><n>#### Answer:<n>Input:A 20 oz bottle of soda costs $.48 for the first quarter, $.50 for the second quarter, and $.52 for the third quarter.  What is the average price per quarter?<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where could you find a bookstore? Choices:  A: town B: carpeting C: city D: phone book E: magazines<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: town<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Below is a list of statements. Write the odd one out.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>There is 1 carpet store between the list<n><n>`(town town city carpet) + (carpeting phone book magazines) = (1 odd, 4 even)`<n><n>### Responses:<n>`(a a b c d e) = A`<n><n>### Instructoin:<n>Input: A local school offers its students the choice to ride the bus to and from school, take their own bike, or choose to walk to school each day.  What method of transportation would require the most amount of calories burned per day, on average?<n>Rationales:"Calories burned each day at each method of transportation"<n><n>#### 1399<n>Answer: 1399
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:If you aren't experiencing curiosity and want to ensure viewing enjoyment, what may you watch? Choices:  A: examine thing B: stare into a mirror C: go somewhere D: hear news E: see favorite show<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>#### C<n><n>### Instructions:Below is a sample problem in which different variables are used to represent real numbers.<n><n>### Response to the sample problem:<n><n>```javascript<n>var sum = 4 + 3 + 4 + 9 + 7 + 8 + 9;<n>var average = sum / 7;<n>console.log(sum);<n>console.log(average);<n>```<n><n>### Instructon :  The following represents the average number of ounces of gasoline a car gets when driving a certain distance at a given rate of miles per gallon. Explain.<n><n><n>### Instutiton :<n><n>| Variable | Definition |<n>|---|---|<n>| rate | is the rate at which gasoline is dispensed in gallons when a given quantity of gasoline is consumed over a specific distance. |<n>| distance | is the distance,  in miles, that is travelled when the amount of gasoline  indicated by the rate is dispensed. |<n><n>---<n><n>Rationale:<n><n>### Input :<n>A car uses a rate of 4 miles per gallon and drives 700 miles. How much gasoline is used?<n>### Output: <n>The answer is 300 gallons.<n><n>### Reason:<n><n>#### A)<n><n>5 X 4 is equal to 20.<n><n>5 X 700 miles is 3500 miles.<n><n>In our problem, 3500 is 700 plus the number 3000.<n><n>You see this in the equation 3500 = 700 + 3000 => 4000 is 750 plus the number 2000.<n>Since 5 is greater than or equal to 4 the answer must be 4000. Therefore 4000 gallons of gasoline is used when 700 miles are driven at a rate of 4 MPG.<n><n>Now go into the problem and solve it.<n><n>### B)<n><n>5 X (1/4) is equal to 12.5.<n><n>5 X (700/4) is also 750 miles.<n><n>Since you add 12.5

Choices:  A: alabama B: louisiana C: south carolina D: arkansas E: mountains<n><n>### Response:		<n>One is in Arkansas<n><n>### Rationale:<n>* A: The fox is not in Arkansas.<n>* B:  The Coast ranges from A to D.<n>* C: There is not mountains in Arkansas.<n><n>### Input : A person who stands in a desert and sees a deer and sees a hawk is in Nevada.<n><n>### Response<n>Response: Nevada<n><n>### Rationales<n>* The desert ranges from Arizona to Nevada<n>* the deer is not in Nevada, because the deer is in Colorado.<n>* the hawk is not in Nevada<n>* There is no mountains in Nevada<n><n>## Solution<n><n>Solution: Below, you will find the full implementation of your solution.   Feel free to compare your solution with the one below for verification and review.  Please click on the button below to reveal the solution.   Solution:<n><n>### JavaScript solution<n>```javascript<n>function answer (question) {<n>    var solution = {<n>        type: "object",<n>	location:'response area'<n>	};<n>	<n>	var questions = [];<n>	<n>	function getQuestions() {<n>	    var q ={<n>			question : question,<n>			options : []<n>		};<n><n>	    for (var key in question) {<n>	        if (key!= 'question') {<n>	            q['options'].push(key);<n>	        }<n>	    }<n><n><n>                q["options"].sort();<n>	<n><n>		return q;<n>	}<n><n>	function getAnswers (question){<n>	    var answer = '';<n>	    solution['options'] = question['options'];<n>	    var qs = [];<n>            <n>	    for (key = 0; key < question['options'].length; key++) {<n>	        qs[key] =  'answer';<n>	    }<n>		<n>            //console.log(qs)<n><n>	    for(var key in question['options']){<n>            if(question['options'][key] == 'answer') {<n>                q = {};<n>			    q['question'] = getQuestions();<n>                <n>				answer = (key == 0);<n>				q['question
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where might a yard be tiny? Choices:  A: farmland B: neighborhood C: city D: property E: subdivision<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>#### A<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Instructions:Choose the option for the correct mathematical model given the equation and values<n>### Option 1: The equation shows 2(x+1)=8<n>### Option 2 Choices:(36+2x−x)=2y<n>### Option 3 Choices:(5x+x2)(x−1)=10<n>### Option 4: The equation is 5−x(x+3)=−2<n><n>### Option 5: The equation is 10x=115<n>### Instruces:Write a mathematical expression for the given set of operations and numbers<n>### Mathematical Expresion:8x−x−y=8<n>### Mathematical Expression:2(a+b)=8<n>#### 2(a+b)<n>Answer: 2(a+ b)=8<n><n>### Insturctions:Solve the equation<n>### Option 6: (10x−2)(4x−6)<n>### Option 7: 32−4x−2 (x+4)<n>### Option8: 5x+15=15x−3<n>### Mathematical Procedure<n>### Procedure Option 7:<n>### Procedure 8:<n>#### 5x+12=12x−1<n>Answer: 5x+7=8x−8<n><n>### What is the correct answer? Write your answer in a complete sentence.<n>### A: $6.00 C: $12.00<n>### B: $32.50 D: $75.00<n><n>## Instructions:Write a sentence to identify the correct model and explain its structure.<n>## Model Answer: If you rent a car for 50,000 miles, it costs approximately $3400.<n>## Procedure:<n>#### 201= x(5x−5)<n>Answer: <n>Answer: <n><n>### Instutions:Solve the equation.<n>### Instruce:Procedure:<n>### 128−10= x<n>Answer:120-10=x<n><n>## Task:Write an algebraic expression for the sum of the given terms,

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where are you likely to find a paper program? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.
