Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:If they were celebrating the occasion, how could the occasion be described? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. But I had a crippling fear of going where? Choices:  A: outside B: vacation C: idle D: apartment E: neighborhood<n><n>### Response:		<n>When I was home, my apartment was like a prison: I didn't get out and when I had to go out, it was horrible.  I spent a lot of time thinking: Where I want to live, what I want to do, how I wanted to spend my time.<n><n>#### The only place I knew I wanted to go was out.<n>#### However, going outside was even worse: I knew I wasn't made for living outside, and so, I never did.  I spent my time indoors, feeling bored out of my mind, and was never truly at home.<n><n>#### When I went out to meet friends, I felt awkward and uncomfortable; I had no sense of freedom (choices: A & B & C & D & E).<n>#### But, the most awful experience for me was going home from work.<n>#### As soon as I stepped through my apartment door, I had a terrible feeling;  I knew right then I would stay indoors for another day, with the same thoughts in my mind: where I want to be, where will I go, What will I do?<n><n>#### I knew I wanted to be outside, on the streets of my neighborhood.<n>#### I wanted to see all the people, talk to them.  I wanted to know what they were thinking; I wanted to experience how they felt, to know how they saw the streets, the city, and me.  I wanted to wander down the street, to discover what was around the corner.<n><n>But I never did.<n><n>#### I had let my fear of going outside control my life (choices: A).<n>#### My crippling fear of leaving my apartment became my new home (choices: D & E).<n><n>#### A year later, I finally did leave my apartment and start wandering down the streets.  The experience was liberating:  I felt like I was on top of the world.<n><n>#### I finally went out and started to explore.<n><n>#### Over time, I became happier (choices: A, B, C, D, & E).<n>#### Since then, I have moved countless times.<n>#### Now, my house is in a perfect street and block.  But, I feel like moving again soon because, well, I'm bored.<n><n>#### I am learning that I can't remain
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:John's RV needs electricity so that he can cook lunch.  Where would he go to plug in? Choices:  A: toy store B: basement C: school D: rest area E: building<n><n>### Response:		John goes to where he can plug in his RV, which is the rest area (D).<n><n>### Output:The following students are not feeling very well today.  Describe the types of illnesses and, in the column next to each name, list the symptoms for each illness. A: Headache B: Flu C: Stomachache<n><n>### Response The correct response is Headache, flu, stomachache.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What is not a safe way to transport jewelry on vacation? Choices:  A: suitcase B: department store C: safe deposit box D: these twos are not safe way to transport jewellery E: lady's boudoir<n><n>### Response:		 B and C<n><n>### Response Explanation:<n>This question is asking us to choose two things that are not safe ways <n>to transport jewelry.<n>Two are correct:<n>A: suitcase<n>B: department store<n><n>### Comment(s):<n><n><n>### Demosession: <n>1) Input: 10 * 7 = <<10*7>>49<n><n>2) Input: 94-59= <<94-59>>35<n><n><n>### Solutions: <n>(310) => Rationales:The first 7 days were 190.<n><n>      There were 11-190-=<<11-19=10>>10 days left.<n>          <n>      The additional 10 days were 10*30 =<<4*30>>300<n>    <n>And 191+300=<<191+35>341<n><n>    And 341<n><n><n>

Now, how do you determine how many gifts you can buy?<n><n>### Input A bakery has an inventory of $500 for the month. The cost to make a certain product was $3.39

Choices:  A: nature B: toilet C: computer science D: computer store E: human body<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Rationale:This answer is the combination of computer and science.<n><n>### Output:<n><n>### **B**<n><n>### **C**<n><n>### Output2:<n><n>### *A computer.*<n><n>### *Iphone.*<n><n>#### **A**<n>|**Device**|<n>||||<n><n>### **Device**<n>Input: Which of these devices is an electronic device?<n><n>#### A: toilet<n><n>#### B: Computer science<n><n>#### C: computer<n><n>#### E: human body<n>\end{code}<n><n>Answer: When I copy this (or any) code into an online IDE or in Visual Studio, the syntax highlighting makes it easy to find the \begin{code}<n><<<n>\end{code}.<n><n>Answer: \begin{code} <<n>\end{code}> is what's called "preprocessor token", it's used to "prepare" code for running, and then it's replaced by another token.<n>\begin{code}<n><n><<<n>\end{}<n>"<n>\end{code}\begin{code}<n><<n>\end{code}"<n><n>is code \em{after} the code which is replaced by preprocessor token, while \begin{code} \<<n>\end{code}-code after that will \em{not} be replaced.<n><n>Comment: Well I see this as being valid syntax (it is technically valid, even though not as a Python expression).  In this case, the preprocessor is being overloaded to support a syntax extension.  I would argue that it is not so much preprocessor token replacement as it is "evaluate this first and make it part of the final expression", but I suspect that is splitting hairs. A better question might be "why isn't this valid syntax for a Python expression (i.e. it doesn't work unless you use an interpreter that is being extended to accept it)?<n><n>Comment: I think it's because of the same reason, that it's technically valid but not the correct/existing syntax - python is not a lisp or a prolog or a Forth. I'm sure that a preprocessor could overload such notation but I'd argue that such a feature should be *outside* the scope of preprocessor and should be the standard syntax. Anyway I

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Someone who doesn't care about about someone else and wishes them to fail has what feeling towards them? Choices:  A: unfeeling B: negligence C: antipathy D: indifferent E: rapport<n><n>### Response:		C<n>####A-antipathy<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Input<n>- A farmer can sell each of her apples at one of the following prices: $5, $8, or $11. For each apple sold, she receives $3 in profit. What is the maximum amount of profit the farmer can earn?<n><n>### Demorstration<n>- The farmer will need to sell her apples as below:<n>- 1 apple at $5 = $5 <n>- 1 apple  at $8 = $5 <n> -1 apple  at $11 = $5<n>- She receives $3 as a profit for each apple. Thus, she has a $45 profit.<n><n>###<n>### Maximum profit = $45 (maximum 11 apples)<n>####E<n>Answer: $45<n><n>### Input:(A)  The company has developed a new machine that produces 50 percent more output than its rival (B) The company has determined that the machine produces the same output and therefore will not be affected by (A)<n><n>### Demostration:If company A has developed a new machine than they can increase their profit by 50%.<n><n>### If the company thinks that the new machine will not make them more profit or the same as the other company, why would they have developed the new machine.<n><n>### Company A has to think twice before making this new machine because if it doesn't the profit will be the same.<n><n>### Rationales:If the new machine costs the company more to make they don't need to make them and the profit will the same.<n><n>####Company A<n>Answer: Company does not need to make the new machine.<n> Company B will loose profit<n><n>### Input:-The city of Los Angeles has a population of 4,652,282. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. How much do you need to spend on ingredients if you need to buy 122 pounds of ground beef? _____ pounds<n><n>Input:<n>```python<n>Input: The car rental agency charges $350/month for a rental that is made for 12 months or longer. How much additional amount of rent will she pay for the rent period that is less than 12 months?<n>Rationales There are 12 months to begin with, so any period that is less than thirteen months is 12-x of x.<n>Therefore, after 12 months, the remaining amount for the rental period will be $350.<n>However, for periods that are less than 12, the amount will $350*(12-x)<n>### 22<n>Answer: 22<n><n>### Input In three weeks, the bank will charge your account 4 times the principal plus 8 percent compounded interest. What is the result of this compounded interest over a 4-week period? 31<n><n>### Rationale: Compound interest is not compounded for the whole 4-week period, but rather, every 12th of a month, which is 1/12 = <<1/12=0.083>>0.083 months every 4 weeks.<n><n>### After 12 weeks, compound interest will occur once more.<n><n>### Using that, I have a compound interest for 3 weeks of 4*(4x+8%) + 3 = <<(4(4x+8%)0.08)>+<(4(4x2+8%)+(4(4x+1)x12+(4(4x) +4 )*1

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where are all participants likely to need sports equipment? Choices:  A: dicks sporting goods B: sporting event C: mall D: sears E: sporting goods store<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>#### Answer: D<n><n>### Input<n>What is the radius of a circle that is 54 3/4 inches in diameter?<n><n>### Response<n>9 9/16 inches<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The mother finished wrapping the very last gift, she then placed it under the what? Choices:  A: department store B: fraizer fur C: specialty store D: christmas tree E: christmas stocking<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Input<n>**Car repair: The next one can you help with is very simple and probably not worth a repair. What is the next repair job on the list?**<n>**Furnace needs to be cleaned.**<n>1. Is the furnace outside or inside? Outside?<n><n>2. How much does this job cost and what does it include? $ 400.<n><n>3. How much does this cost a month? $ 12.<n><n>4. How expensive is it (based on a 5 point scale -1 being the cheapest and 5 being the most expensive)? 4<n><n>### Input**Car repair**<n>Next one is outside the car<n>1. What kind of car is it? Audi<n>2. How much did it cost to repair? $40<n>3. How much is it per trip to gas station? $10<n>4. What is the mileage of the car? 25<n>5. How much is it a month? $1,497.50<n><n>**Miles traveled: How many miles per week do you travel?**<n>**4 miles a week**<n><n>**How much does gas cost per mile?**<n>**$ 1**<n><n>**How does this cost compare to your normal commute, if it does?**<n>**It is less than my daily commute**<n><n>**How will your mileage change over time as you pay for repairs?**<n>**It will gradually change in price**<n><n>###<n><n>### Input*Airplane ration*<n>### <n>```<n>I would like to buy an airplane ration for the next 76 flights, costing 2368.00 and there is no shipping cost. There will be 76 flights in length, with approximately every 4 days going on the plane. How much is the airplane ration per day for the plane ride?<n>```<n><n>### Output:8.82<n><n>### Explanation:For 76 days the price of an airplane ration is \$8.82. This is calculated by finding the cost of the rations, finding the total number of times per day there are rations eaten and then dividing that number by the total number of days.<n>```<n>1.7

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: villa B: spacecraft C: hall D: palace E: hotel<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### E: hotel<n><n># Solution<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>### The task that you are solving is described in the problem statement above.<n><n>### Write a clear description of the problem you are trying to solve without writing code.<n><n>In the next section you will implement your solution.<n><n><n><n>---<n><n>### Code<n><n><n>````<n>package problems.hackerrank.car_rental_agency;<n><n>import java.io.BufferedReader;<n>import java.io.*;<n>import java.lang.Math;<n>import java.util.*;<n><n>class Solution {<n><n>    static double answer1;<n>    static double ans;<n>    static double res=0.0;<n>    static BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(System.in));<n>    static int total=0;<n><n>    static void calculate(BufferedReader br,int no){<n>        int day=0;<n>        for (int i=1;i<=10*no;i++){<n><n>        int total=br.readLine().replaceAll("\n","")/br.readLine().trim().replaceAll(".*","");<n>        res=no*(total*total)/total;<n>        total+=i;<n>        }<n>        <n>        double temp= res;<n>        ans+=1/no;<n>        ans++;<n>        System.out.println("ans="+ans+","+res);<n>        ans=temp;<n>    }<n><n><n><n><n><n>    public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {<n>        try {<n>            String line = br.readLine();<n>            int no= Integer.parseInt(line)/11;<n>            calculate(br,"");<n>            answer1= 1-Math.sqrt((10/no)/(1-ans));<n>            System.out.println(answer1);<n>            while (total>0){<n>                if(total>60){<n>                    System.out.println(((99/total)*total)+"");<n>                    break;<n>                }<n>                <n>                total+=60;<n>            }<n>            System.out<n>           .println("Answer: 2 days \n1-"+total+"-3") ;<n><n>    }catch (NumberFormatException e) {<n>        e.printStackTrace();

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:A projector displayed people on the huge screen while the audience laughed. This statement is True.<n><n>```Java<n>this.height() < 200;<n>```<n><n>2. This statement is False.<n><n>```Java <n>height!= null<n>```<n><n>3. This statement is True<n><n>```Java<n>height() > 200;	<n><n>this.height() > 2<n>```<n><n>#### Correct<n>```Java<n>this(this.width()) > 200 <n><n>this.height<200<n>```<n><n>#### Incorrect<n><n>```Java<n><n>this.height < 200 	<n><n>this(this.height()) < 500<n>```<n>

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What is illegal to do when you play cards at a casino? Choices:  A: remember B: help C: count D: winning E: dealing<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Rationales:<n>Cause your brain cannot remember and help, so that leaves you with only dealing and winning.<n><n>### Inputs:A: The grocery store charges $6 for a single avocado, $66 for a 6-pack of avocados, $10 per kg for anything larger, and a single banana costs $2.  You want to get enough avocados and enough bananas to make a healthy snack that is cheap to eat.  How can you minimize the total cost of food you purchase?<n><n>### Response/Method:<n>You would need to get more Avocados and less number of bananas because the more avocades the cheaper it will be per avocado<n><n>$$ (2\ * 2 + 66) \div 6$$<n><n>#### 66<n><n>### Answer:66/6<n>### Input: What is an advantage of hiring an assistant?A:It will help you pay for lunchB:You won't have to spend as much time on the jobC:All employees pay for their own lunch<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Input :A:I'm sure the assistant can make a pretty good living without a job.<n><n>### Response :B<n><n>### Method:<n>As stated the company or whatever will hire you as there assistant and have the pay you to keep lunch.<n><n>### Answer : $42,000 * 40 = $2.2 * 10 = $22,000<n>### Input: How much would Tina save in the next 10 years if she invested $900 a year at a 7% annual interest rate compounded yearly<n><n>### Response / Method<n>### She would invest $900 +$900 +$1,690 and so on until she gets to $17,400<n><n>$17,40=$900*20<n><n>#### $900*2<n><n>#### $940*2<n><n>$.25*10 = $26<n><n>### $ 900 x 20 =$18,000<n><n>## Rationales / Income<n><n>## Input
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:At a state fair judging pigs requires careful what? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The lady was doing a one man show of her tell story, when the show began she did what? Choices:  A: persuade B: slept C: take center stage D: challenge E: speak clearly<n><n>### Response:		Choice: D<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following question.<n><n>## Instructions: Answer either questions 1-2 below.<n><n>### Input 1:If 5 people are in a room and they are evenly divided on a question. what is the probability someone in the room thinks the same as everyone else.<n><n>### Response 1: The probability the 5th person agrees is.163. This is because the probability of 5 people being divided equally on a question is around.2, and the probability of getting the 5th person wrong is.3 because they are evenly split between yes and no. Adding the two and dividing by the total sum is.163<n><n>### Input2:If 5 people in a room are evenly split on a question. what other way to split them evenly?<n><n>### Response2: The only other way to evenly split the 5 people is have 2 think yes and 3 think no. This is because everyone agrees with 1 or 2 in those groups.<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What could you put a table in if you want the table to be in your house? Choices:  A: library B: demonstration C: corner D: football ground E: rug<n><n>### Response:		<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Where might he look for a potato. Choices:  A: restaurants B: casserole C: root cellar D: pockets E: pantry<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer will be D<n><n>### What does it mean to find the least common multiple of two numbers?<n><n>### Is 1 a prime number?<n><n>### Does every multiple of 11, such as 11, 22, and 33, start with a 1 or a 2.<n><n>### What is the answer when multiplying 2 by 4?<n><n>### In order to find what number will divide evenly into each pair of numbers, we begin dividing the first pair to find the greatest common factor (GCF).<n>In a given problem, we must understand the question.<n><n>## Questions<n>| Qn|    Qn.1|Answer|<n>|---:|---:|---|<n>| 1.<n>2.<n>3.<n>4.<n><n>## Answer

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:When we are thankful for getting something what do we do? Choices:  A: say thank B: smile C: looking for D: get more E: show appreciation<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is B<n><n>### Demostration:<n>You get an apple from the tree with apple, say thank you.<n><n>### Inputs:<n>You're out of gas on a trip across the country. Your car has a tank with 30 gallons of gasoline. In addition you have an extra 33 gallons gasoline in an extra 10 gallon container.  You have decided that you can get 21 miles to the gallon traveling at 60 mpg. A) How many days do you have gas before there is absolutely no gasoline?<n><n>### Rationales:<n>The tank has 30 gallons, the 10 gallon can makes it 40<n><n>30/21= <<30/21 = 1>>1.43<n><n>.43 times 33=<<.43*33=14.79>>14.79<n><n>14.79/21=<<14.79.21=0.69>>0.69<n><n>The problem was solved<n><n>#### 1.69<n>Answer: 1.69

The card at the far left may be identified by its green color. The card at the second position may be identified by its blue color. The card at third position may be identified by a yellow color. The card at fourth position may be identified by an orange color. The card at right end may be identified by its purple color or may be identified by a gray color. What is the correct response for identifying the cards in that order?  For additional assistance, see the hints for identifying a card.<n><n>### Response (The hints describe a mathematical idea or statement)<n><n>### Card in far left may be identified with the mathematical idea of the smallest prime number or 2<n><n>### Next card is the second position and may be identified with the idea that the product of the two adjacent faces is even (blue with blue is even)<n><n><img src="./image/math.jpeg" alt="Mathematician" width="150" height="150"><n><n>### Next Card may be identified with mathematical idea of adding another number to 2 and it's 2+1=3<n><n>### Next two cards are the same in color so it should be identified with the idea of adding one or both of the adjacent faces<n><n>### Right most card may be identified with the card that is missing<n><n>### Input the set of cards as:<n>```  green; blue; yellow; orange; purple; ```<n>To identify the cards from far left to right, they are numbered:<n>``` 1,2,3,4,5  ```<n>The green card to the first card is "2" (the second card's math is: 2x "blue" = 4). The 4th card's math is the addition of it's surrounding color (yellow and orange color)
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:A yard is made up of what? Choices:  A: city B: michigan C: three feet D: subdivision E: three arm span<n><n>### Response:		Answer the question.<n><n>#### C<n><n>### Demostration: A yard is made up of three feet<n><n>### Rationales:  The answer is the three feet.  There are two other options which are 1)city, 2)Michigan.<n>1. Choice A for your answer: city<n>2. Choice B for your answer: town<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>A town is made up of 12 feet (3*4=<<3*4=12>>12).<n><n><n>### Input:{A: A is for Alpha B:B is for Bravo C:C = Charlie D:D = Delta E:E = Echo}<n><n>### Response:{A:Alphabet<n><n>### Demos:<n>The Answer is alphabet, for example A is the first letter in the alphabet B is the second letter, etc.<n><n>### Answer:{A = alphabet}<n><n>### Instuction: Answer the following multiple choice question<n>### Input:How much is 8 less than 0<n><n>### Answer:(answer)<n><n>## Output: (response)<n><n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:(8: the cost of car insurance.<n><n><n>### Demolitions<n><n><n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The graveyard was important to build, where should it be built? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What could fighting inflation cause if it is not successful? Choices:  A: problems B: not noticeable C: deflation D: economic instability E: eat cake<n><n>### Response:		<n>Deflection is what inflation can cause if it is not managed.If we fail to control inflation we may be left with deflation which can lead to an economic slowdown.Though fighting inflation is of utmost importance in any economic situation but once it is taken care of what we are left with is deflation.<n><n>### Input<n>You would like to find the average of a number where there is a minimum of a 12 percent variance from one number to another. The minimum number should be 2.<n><n>### Response<n><n>You must find the average of a minimum of 12% in order to calculate the average of a set of numbers which should be from 2.<n><n><n>### Input You would like to find the mean of a number. You must add it to an existing set of numbers, which includes an average of 19%. The numbers should be from 53.<n>(1) How will you add it to two numbers with 19% average and should be from 54 and less than 97?<n>(2) How will you add 43% to a set of numbers that includes an average of 29% and less than 572<n><n>### Response <n>You add 43% with adding 4 numbers then 43%/4 = 10.84<n><n>```python<n>num1=num2=num4=num3=0<n>sum=0<n>num3=float(num1)<n>num4 = float(num2)<n>num1 = num1 + float(num3)<n>num2 += float(num4)<n>sum += float((num1+num2)/2)<n>print(sum)<n>```<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:A strong laxative will help you keep what kind of bowel movements? Choices:  A: strongwoman B: cake C: regular D: weak E: fragile<n><n>### Response:		<n>B<n><n>### Request:Input:What is the value of 4?+<n><n>### Response:(Answer is given here)<n>3<n><n>### Instructions:<n>You are given 2 numbers and asked to compare them.  The two numbers __________ equal.  The comparison of equal numbers is ___________.<n><n>### Input:(Answer is given here.)<n><n>3 (first number) and 6 (second number).<n><n>### Rationales:<n>This is a question asking for a synonym of equals.  The answer of 6 to 3 is not exactly what is being asked.  We know to add a 6 to 3 and 6 equals 3+6=<<3+6=9>>9.  Therefore 6 and 3 is given but not the answer.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where would you carry a pen as you go through your day? Choices:  A: pocket B: office supply store C: friend's house D: desk drawer E: city hall<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: A = pocket<n>The answer is "none of the above" because none of the statements given would be correct.<n><n>### Test Yourself.<n><n>### Input<n>- A dog costs $1000 and a cat costs $600.  If you buy both, how much does it cost?<n>- If it costs 12 cents per stamp to mail 100 letters, how much will it cost to mail 40,000 letters?<n>- A hurricane is about to hit a certain city.  It needs to be evacuated.  They're planning to bus all the people to a city 30 miles away.  They have 2 buses.  As many people as can fit in 1 bus will fit.  There are 150 people.  Given that they plan to evacuate everyone, what should they do?  (1) Evacuate everyone at once using both buses simultaneously.  (2) Wait, and then evacuate the remaining 50 people using only 1 bus.  (3) Split the remaining 50 into equal groups and use 2 buses simultaneously.  Answer: I believe that you should go with (3)<n>- If you drive on a two-lane highway, what happens if you put 75 cars on the two-lane highway?<n>- An attorney charges $200 to sue someone.  He doesn't want to lose a client, so he waives the $200 fee and gives a discount.  The person, wanting to pay less, sues again, this time in court.  Is the judge required to accept this discount?  Answer: I believe no, it's like a coupon<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Why do people engage in chatting with friends in class? Choices:  A: necessity B: answers C: inspiration D: love E: fun<n><n>### Response:		Answer Choice D.<n><n><n>### Instructions: Below are descriptions of four tasks. For each task, determine whether the description is positive, negative, or neutral.<n><n>### Reasoning:<n><n>1) My friend is really into fashion and makes it a point to always be on style. Because of this, she can be selfish at times.<n><n>2) She’s a really good friend to me. She gives me good relationship advice.<n><n>3) I met her in college, and we’ve been very good friends since then.<n><n>4) She’s one of my best friends because she likes to help other people. When she’s around, it makes me feel good about myself.<n><n>### Rationales: 1)-3) are positive 4) is negative.<n><n>### Example from Lesson:<n><n>1)She’s a really good writer, but I don’t like all her stories that well<n><n>2) You seem very smart to me<n><n>3) I don’t like to talk to you<n><n>4) You seem like a very intelligent person<n><n>### Required Output:<n>[x,y]<n><n>### Demo:<n>1) x="positive"<n>1) y="negative" or maybe "neutral">

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:If I wanted to thank someone for saying I have done a good job, what would I do? Choices:  A: smile B: shake hands C: express gratitude D: say you're welcome E: appreciate compliment<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>A Smile is a symbol or action that visually shows a gesture. People usually give smiles to tell people that they have been appreciated or to convey a good feeling.<n>B Shaking hands is another way to show respect and appreciate another person. It is also a sign to show that they are well acquainted with each other.<n>C There are a plethora of ways to express gratitude. Some of them are: 1. “Thank you for your concern, it meant a lot to me at that time.” 2. “Thank you for being honest and direct when you have something to say. I really appreciated that, thank you.” 3. “Your note really meant a lot to me. I appreciate everything you’ve done for me in the past.” 4. “I am sure about this, I mean, when I get married you are really someone to depend on. 5. “Thank you for letting me know about the event. It means a lot to me that you took your time out of your day to inform me.” 6. 2. “Thank so much for your time and effort, I am so thankful for the time you spent with me, please don’t hesitate to contact me if I can do anything else for you.<n>D “Saying you are welcome is a quick way of showing that you appreciate something someone has said or done for you, it is a formal and polite way of thanking that person.”<n><n>### Choice:<n><n>### (Choice D) I appreciated the compliment.<n><n>### (Response) A: Smile<n><n>### (Answer) I appreciated the compliments<n><n>### Demystify:<n>If you could take one of your friends on a date, where would you go? How many blue shoeboxes are in the company's stock?<n><n>### Question: The answer is 72<n><n>##### First, the first half of the problem is to identify which types of shoes are which.<n><n>##### The second half is to determine how many of what types there are. <n><n>##### In the first half of the question, he asks What types of shoes are what<n><n>##### 1/3 of shoes = blue<n><n>##### 5/6 is blue = 30<n><n>##### 4/4 is blue = 16 so that blue = 46  <n>##### of blue = 46 the question then asks of the blue 23% =  7 blue shoes, so blue = 53<n><n>##### 3/4 is blue - 16 (46 subtracted from 53) =  3 blue so blue = 56<n><n>##### Of the blue shoes remaining, 1/4 of lace up =

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The children saw superman fly overhead, what did they exclaim as a result? Choices:  A: ouch B: skip C: enjoyed D: awesome E: watch television<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: Watch Television 350<n><n>### Response Explanation:<n><n>350 is the answer to the instruction.<n><n>### Input<n>What’s 6*3*2=<what’s 6*2=>>what’s 6=<<6=what’s what’s 6 what’s 6=2.<n><n>###Response<n><n>6*3*2 = what’s 6 = 12<n><n>###Response Explanation<n><n>408 is the answer to the input<n><n>###Input: What is $20 divided by 8?<n>###Rationale: What is $2 divided by a tenth? Divide by tenths<n>###Answer:  $25<n>

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:People always talked childlike to him, even though his disability was physical and didn't affect his what? Choices:  A: strength B: brain C: potential D: qualification E: competence<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### A: strength<n>Answer:<n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.
