Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where would you see some people doing jumping jacks? Choices:  A: military base B: opera C: water fountain D: bus stop E: church<n><n>### Response:		Bus stop<n><n>### Rationales:<n>##### 1) If you wanted to run as fast as a cheetah you would need to do _______ jumps a day.<n>##### B) 10,000<n>##### 2) What is the longest human _____?<n>##### C) jump<n>##### 3) Many people jump for a few minutes at night because they are _____.<n>##### D) Exercising<n>##### 4) Are there any differences between a _______ and a jump jack?<n>##### A) Running jumping and pile jumping<n>##### 5) What did a cheerleader _____ for in the movie?<n>##### E) Do<n>##### 6) Can you do the jumping jack at any time of _____?<n>#### A) during the day<n>#### 7) Would a soldier use the jumping jack at the ______?<n>##### A: military base<n>###### 7) Would a bus driver jump for joy at work?<n>#### A) No
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where is there usually a fiddle playing? Choices:  A: music store B: dance hall C: orchestra D: symphony E: tennessee<n><n>### Response:		F:orchestra <n><n>Answer: orchestra<n><n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where would you see people in uniform playing with a ball? Choices:  A: hole B: television C: sporting goods store D: pool table E: sporting event<n><n>### Response:		A:Hole<n><n>### 14/8=14/8= <n>Answer: none<n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:She needs to visit a bookshop after buying the latest fashion, where should she look? Try to write a complete sentence that responds to the comment in an appropriate way.<n><n>### Inputs:  My classmate: I live in a town that is home to a well-known university. If I want to buy a ticket for the biggest game of the season, I have to get to the box office before sun rises or I’m out of luck. I really need to start going to bed earlier.<n><n>My response: _________________________________________________________________________________________________________<n><n><n>### Input 2: <n><n>### My classmate: My roommate and I recently made the decision to leave our town when the spring semester ends, but we don’t know where we are going. I’m not looking forward to having to travel back and forth, but it’s much cheaper to rent an apartment in a small town than in a big city.<n><n>My response : __________________________________________________________________________<n><n><n>### Answer: <n>I’m not going to get to bed much earlier than usual, but if I want a ticket, I’d better get there very early!  <n><n>### Your response: __________________________________<n><n><n>## Resources<n><n>### Online<n><n>[https://www.khanacademy.org/humanities/ss/math-modeling-hs/ss/ss_practice_exams/a/problem-solving-practice?utm_source=video&utm_medium=cpc&utm_campaign=videso-ap&utm_content=pr:video:40285d111dc4de206aece430:video:sid:40286049477641]
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The man went to clown college, he had always want to run away with the what? Choices:  A: circus B: carnival C: surprise D: spoons E: party<n><n>### Response:		 C <n><n>### Rationale: C is the only choice available<n><n>### Example:<n>#### Explanation:<n><n>Input:<n>The man went to cranial college.<n><n>#### 36<n>Answer: 36<n><n>---<n>© 2014 Trilogy Education Services, a 2U, Inc. brand. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:He was receiving workman's compensation, he had tripped over a metal rod while building where? Choices:  A: factory B: construction site C: engine D: insides of skyscraper's walls E: shops<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Rationale:<n>I think the answer is A, because according to the definition of workman's compensations:  _(Web Defenition)_  is a form of insurance providing wage replacement and medical benefits to employees injured in the course of employment in exchange for mandatory relinquishment of the employee's right to sue his or her employer for the tort of negligence.  Workers' compensation may also provide rehabilitation services.<n>```<n>There's an example on the website below:<n><n>A carpenter in Missouri was helping paint a roof repair.  His employer paid him a per day-rate for everyday that he worked.  He fell off the roof and suffered personal injury.  His employer would not make future payments to him because it found he had misrepresented his health in applying for work.  It turned out that the employer had obtained workers' compensation insurance to pay for worker's benefits but hadn't paid its policy premiums for that insurance.  There's nothing in workers' compensation law that prevented the employer from terminating the worker, but if the worker had brought an action for negligence against the employer, it was required to purchase insurance to cover that tort.  Since Missouri has compulsory workers' compensation, it must make all necessary insurance payments.<n>```<n>According to this example, workman's compensaton is paid in the factory of an apprentice.<n>```<n>In Workman's Compensation - Construction Industry, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) requires employers to carry workers' compensation insurace for all employees, as long as three or more are employed anywhere, or they are employed as domestic service workers in private homes.<n>```<n>So the answer must be A, because the guy tripped over a metal-rod on the building (factory) and he was injured. <n><n>### Credits:<n>I watched Youtube video to know the answer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iIyM0Duq1Fc<n><n>### Link:https://www.youtube.c

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The teacher told all the students that listening was key, it was the main way they would gain what? Choices:  A: empathy B: anxiety C: knowlege D: falling down E: hear things<n><n>### Response:		Option (E)<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write a sentence with a similar response.<n><n>### Rationale:<n>A: Anxiety is the main way to gain empathy.<n><n>B: Empathy is the main way to listen to anxiety.<n><n>C: Listening to anxiety is the main way students learn empathic-like knowledge.<n><n>D: Students learn about anxiety as they listen to it.<n><n>E: You listening to students will teach you the knowledge to gain empathy and hear.<n><n>### Answer:Answer with (E) is the correct way to respond.<n><n>### Input<n>The hunter's dog has been chasing a deer for 3 hours. The chase is now heading away from the hunter for 1 ½ hours. Which of the following answers is closest to how this chase is going?  Choices (A).  Its only a 1½ hour chase. (B). Its a 4 hour chase. (C). The dog is right in back of it. (D). The dog has run the deer into the woods. <n>### Response<n>My answer to this multiple choice section is ________________________ and my rationale is ___________________________.<n><n>### Answer<n>My answer (B) is the correct answer because by following the statement "its only a 1½ hours chase" from the first sentence of the question the 3hrs was the chasing and the deer has then run on for at least 4hrs the dog should be right behind the deer or on the deer<n><n><n>### Instuction:Write three responses that describe the following situation.<n><n>#### Input:You are preparing to cross town in your car by way of the highway, when you discover that you do not have cell phone service. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What is a good result of losing weight? Choices:  A: increased energy B: healthier C: loose skin D: beauty E: death<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Rationale: I selected C because exercise allows your body to be at optimal function and energy efficiency as well as being healthier. Your body is able to maintain a low internal temperature and more efficiently use the oxygen, allowing you to exercise for longer periods of time.<n><n>### Output:<n><n>### Which option best describes a job interview? A: finding a candidate to fill the current role in a company B: finding a candidate for a role in the company<n><n>### R: finding a candidate for the current role<n><n>### Rational: This answer best describes a company interview looking to hire employees for a specific role the company is currently in need of filling.<n><n>### Out<n><n>### How do you measure a liquid volume of a substance? A: by its weight B: by its mass C: by its density<n><n>### Rated: B<n><n>### Rather than mass, weight and mass, there is only one measure of a liquid volume and that is density. Density is an indication that the volume of the solute cannot be measured by its weight; however, the volume can be measured by its mass.<n><n>### <n><n>### What is the name of the person who provides a medical diagnosis, treats, manages, and is responsible for your healthcare, and acts as a health adviser? A: primary caregiver and psychiatrist, physical therapist, and nurse B: counselor, nurse, and psychologist, and specialist doctors C: nurse and specialist caregivers, physical therapist<n><n>### Rating: A<n><n>### The name of the person responsible for your healthcare is a healthcare provider.<n><n>### Option A:<n>### Primary caregiver and Psychiatrist, physical therapy, caregiver, nurse, and specialist doctor is not the name of the person responsible. They may provide some care to you, but these providers are not the person responsible for your care.<n>### Option B:<n>### A healthcare provider can sometimes be a nurse, specialist doctor, nurse, and physical therapy specialist. The nurse and physical therapist may occasionally provide care for you, but they do not provide the health care and do not have responsibility for your health care.<n>### The counselor

How will this situation be solved?<n><n>### Response : The people crossed first, the elephant could not jump out even when the man had help and the canoe can only carry two large objects at a time at the most. So,<n>Total $ = $30*(9*24) + $30*(1/2*24)/2 – $33*(1/2*8)<n><n>#### 33*1*24*4<n><n>### Input     : You have 2 quarters, a nickel, 3 dimes, 4 pennies and 5 dollars. Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What will happen to skin pinched in something? Choices:  A: feel cold B: feel pressure C: feel bumpy D: itches E: feel clammy<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>- [A]: Choice: A - Feel cold  Rationales: Skin feels cold at the touch of something<n>- [B]: Choice: B - Feel pressure  Rationales: In response to pressure, the body attempts to restore equilibrium. This can be caused by physical force, such as the pinching of skin by a clothes hanger, for instance.<n>- [C]: Choice: C - Feel bumpy  Rationales: When something bumps into your skin, it sets your nerve endings into motion.<n>- [D]: Choice: D - Itches Rationales: When skin rubbed constantly on something, it leads to itching, which then may lead to scratching.<n>- [E]: Choice: E - Feel clammy  Rationales: After some time, some skin starts to retain moisture.<n><n>### Input:(3 people: John and Jim and Peter ) You can put John in position 2, Jim in position 3, and Peter in position 4, or in position 4, 2, and 3<n>\- [3]: Position: John <n>Rationales: Each person takes position on the first, second, and last column.<n>\- [2]: Position: Jim <n>Rationales For first, second, or last column.<n>\(5\): Position: Peter <n>Rationales : Each choice for first, second, or third column.<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>\- [4]: Position: John  Rationales: Each person in a row.<n>\- [3] Position: Jim Rationales: In row and  with the two people in the column<n><n>\- [2] Position: Peter Rationales: With the second person in the column<n><n>### Explanation: The choices will be for 3 positions in a row<n><n>### Instructions: Which sentence best describes this quotation?<n><n>### <n>```<n>Crossing the Bridge to the Twilight Zone<n>```<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>- [3]: Crossing the Bridge to the twilight zone <n>Rationales The bridge was closing before sundown.  So, they should hurry to get over it before it’s dark.<n><n>### Choices: 
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where is a tabby cat likely to be happiest? Choices:  A: burlap sack B: hot country C: purse D: pet shops E: deep grass<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>Option A B C D E<n>```<n>#### A is Correct <n>Answer: B<n><n>### Input:[The] car-rental agencies are charging \$30/day for [a] car, or \$190 for the [first] week for [a] rental that lasts [an] entire week or longer.<n>```<n>    A rental is defined as (the first) week. So in order for a rental to be classified as a rental for a week or longer it would have to be for more days than the first week.<n>    However, only the first week has a cost of \$190 and if you do the math after this 1st week every additional week you would keep the cost at \$30/day.<n>```<n>    This statement is true.<n>##### An additional rent for a week would be calculated as \${190\over7}*{30\over7} \<n>        where the number of additional days is greater than 1 in this case it would be 6 more days<n>```<n>Rationales:<n>      1 week = \$190.<n>       1 week + 6 days = \$190 + (6*30)<n>       30/7 = \$4\<n>       4 x \$30 = \$120.<n>        So \${190+180 = 370 \$  \$ 50 + \$30 = \$80<n><n>```<n>       50/7 = \$7.142857 **2 \<n>       190 is the total cost for 1 weeks worth of rental.<n>       <n>```<n>       190 = 120+30(6 days)<n>```<n>Answer: E<n><n>### Input<n>Answer: A<n><n>### InputAnswer:B<n>```<n>    If the car rental cost is classifed as (the first)week then it would have to be paid for as per the week.<n>    If the entire week is not a week then it cannot be regarded as a week and therefore you pay for an entire week and not a whole<n>```<n>Input: A horticulturist is planting a field of carrots in a rectangular field. How many square feet of land does 47,000 carrot plants

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where would someone learn to play an upright piano? Choices:  A: music room B: music store C: music class D: medium E: house<n><n>### Response:		Answer: D<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Input:The car-rental agancy charges $30/ day for a car, or 190 for the f irst week for a rental tha.t lasts an entire week o  or longer. Jennie rent a car for 1 1 days...<n><n>### Rationales: the firrst7days were 190.there wer 11-7 = 4 days left. the additional 4 dayswere 4 * 5 = 20. and 190 + 20 = 310.<n><n>### Input<n><n>### A hurricane is ap-<n><n>### Rationale.<n><n>### Total driving time, in hours<n><n>### Input <n><n>### Answers:4<n><n>This is the code that I wrote for multiple answers:<n><n><n>```python<n>Input:the agency charges $35 for one day and $175 for all seven days. Dana needs more days than she can afford. Write a program that calculates how many $35 days she must buy for the time she needs.<n><n>Input:The agency charges $37 for one day plus an additional $5 per day if you rent for more tha 10 days. How many more days does Tom need?<n><n>Rationales:The car cost 37*5=<<37*5=185>>185 days.<n><n>Input:What would be the total cost of renting a motorcycle with a gas tank that can carry 5 gallons for 25 miles?<n><n>Rational:1 The tank 5 gallons that cost 5/25=<<5/25=0.2>>0.2 times 25 miles.<n><n>Input:Find the average of 560 and 640<n><n>Rational:first a 560 and a 640.<n><n>Input:Diana can clean a floor in 8 hours. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Who is likely going in to a market? Choices:  A: stress B: food C: that you D: spending money E: walking<n><n>### Response:		<n>A.  Stress<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n>### Instructional Goal:<n>By the end of the lesson, you should be able to solve for a variable without seeing it given an equation.<n>### Input:<n>The car rental agency charges $35/day for a car. The price of a daily rental is the price of a weekly rental multiplied by __?__.<n><n>### Response Guides:<n>A. ANSWER:<n>The equation written in the problem is 35X?=___________________________________<n><n>In order to solve, just plug in the given numbers and solve the resulting equation in order to find the answer.<n><n>First plug in: 35 and the answer should be 35X=____________________ (We do not need to put a question mark since we provided the value of 35)<n><n>However, this would not work because we simply divided both sides of this equation by 35.<n><n>Then plug in: 30 AND THEN 50 (and do this for all numbers). You should then be able to find the answer since the equation should stay the same. The answer should then be 30X=X 50X=X and so on.<n><n>B. COMMENT:<n>The number of times I would multiply will be for the multiplier and the number of times it is divided would be 1.<n><n>### Answer:<n>65<n><n>### Input<n>The car rental charges $30 per day for a car. The rental rate for a week is $180 plus $19 for each day.  Find the rental rate per day for a rental that is 12 days long<n><n>### Response guide:<n>Step 1:<n>Find out what information we are solving for:<n>30, per day<n>Step 2: Identify what information we have:<n>Per day $30, week $180, and for each day $19<n>Step 3: Eliminate all variables except for the day rate<n>Step 4: Find out the per day rate  by using equations that will end up in the numbers representing the $30 rate for a day.<n>Step 5: Find the total cost for 12 days by multiplying the per day
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where would you be able to hear a bassoon played in an unpleasing fashion? Choices:  A: orchestra B: baritone woodwind sound C: symphony D: play music E: high school band<n><n>### Response:		I would be able to hear a symphony. A symphony can consist of different types of instruments. The different instruments will all play their own parts and the bassoon will make it's sound. One of my favorite symphony's is the 4th movement of Beethoven's 9th symphony. The bassoon will make some of the higher pitches along with a cello. It can sound very pleasing.<n><n>### Input:[(3)+(1)+6]=(<n>[(4)+(7)+(12)-(5)+(3)]=(<n>[(5)+(6)+(9)]<n>)=<n>[(<n>(4)+(5)-(8)]<n>)=

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where could a printer be used by thousands of people? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:An expressway can suffer from traffic, this traffic gets worse the closer you get to any what? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What can someone feeling happiness fall into? Choices:  A: lead to laughter B: love C: laughter D: smiles E: tears<n><n>### Response:		A: lead to laughter<n><n>### Instrucion:Explain why your answer is correct or correct another student's answer.<n><n># C1. Rational:A:<n><n>### Instructio: What can someone feeling happiness fall?<n><n>#### Choice: A:<n><n>### Rationale:<n><n>#### Answer:<n><n># C2. Rational:A<n><n>### Instuctio: What can someone falling feel happiness?<n><n>#### Choice :<n><n>### Rational:<n><n>#### Answer :<n><n># C3. Rational: A<n><n>### Instuction :<n>What can someone feeling happiness fell into? Choices A: to laughter B: Love C: laughter D smiles E:<n><n>### Answer :<n><n><n>#C4. Rational: A.<n><n>###Instruction :What can someone feeling happiness feel?<n><n>#### Choices :<n><n>###Rational:<n><n>####Answer: A<n><n>#C5.Rational :<n><n>###Instructions :<n>What can someone falling feel happiness? Choices A B c D  E<n><n>###Rationlle:A<n><n>####Answer :<n><n>#C6.Rational :<n>   <n>### Instruction :<n>What can someone happiness feelings fall into? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The people in class were instructed to brainstorm ideas, how would they use their minds for this? Choices:  A: shake hands B: control events C: talk to each other D: think creatively E: dress themselves<n><n>### Response:		<n>I'm sure the people in class did not expect that the instructions will include ideas. But it is actually a good example of how the brain works to figure out the task at hand and how people collaborate with each other to use it more efficiently.<n><n>### Input:"The United States has 27.6 trillion dollars in national debt." D: this number can be used to tell you how many dollars the United States has spent at least 27.6 times. E: 27.5 trillion dollars<n><n>### Response:"The United States has been in trouble since the 60's or 70's. And since I started driving, I only paid the state $13 dollars. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:If you've thrown a rod you've done damage to what? Choices:  A: fishing camp B: hardware store C: engine D: your spine E: sporting goods store<n><n>### Response:		A<n>A<n>#### A<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Instiution: The car-rentlal agency charges $25/day for rentals of less than 5 days, and $15 to 5 days. If Jennie used her own car for 12 days and paid $175 in total, what is the length of her rental periods?<n><n>### Response<n>If she has to pay $175, then she must have made some extra payments. I find that the first 5 days are cheaper than the next 7 days.<n>She used her own car(which is the better choice), so she probably wants to rent as short as possible.<n>The day is $15, so then the days is between 175/15=<<175/145>>7 days and 7 days.<n>7 =<<7=7>>7 = 7.<n>Now we find how much she has paid for what amount of days<n><n>### Demostration:<n>We find how much she has payed for 7 days.<n>175= 175<n><n>Then we find out how many she has payed for<n>7*175 =<<7*175=1225>>1225<n>The amount of hours is 7*12=<<7*12=84>>84<n><n>### Answer:<n>We find the answer<n><n>84=<84=84>>175+175<n><n>The answer is 107.5/64.<n><n>### If a car rental agency charges $22/day for rentals longer than 5 days plus $21 for a weekend, if you've rented a car for a week long rental at $125 and had to return it in the morning of Sunday, how much, in dollars, was your weekly total paid to the rental agency.<n><n>### Response <n>Here were some of the steps of this problem.<n><n>1. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:If your watching television and accomplish nothing what have you done? So, b/c =3<n>#### 11<n><n>Solution: c = 5 and d = 15<n>#### 12<n>Solution:  c = 2 and d = 4.<n>#### 93.  c>d = 5>16. b=16. <n>b/c=16. so a=16/5.<n>

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. They are all $35 per acre; all cost $35 per hundred pounds and take 36 gallons of water per bushel of corn.<n>* A pesticide can be used on 60 bushels/acre.<n>* A pest control tractor costs $190,000 and is available from dealers for $325,000.<n>* A plow costs $65,000 and can cost as little as $87,000 or can be sold for as much as $140,000. The plow is available at a dealer for $135,000 for the cheapest model.<n><n>Rationales:The 60 bushels per acre translates to 260000 bu for 60 bu/acre of 60 bu per acre = 2600 bu/acre of corn<n><n>Each hundred pounds of product is $35 = $35/100 = 35<n>Then 35 per hundred pounds = 35 X 100 lb = 3500 lb (per gallon)<n><n>36 gals = 260 = 260 quarts (in gallons) <n>There are 128 fl oz in a gallon (g/l) and there are 128 quarts in a gallon which means to buy 260 quarters of pesticide it will cost $3500 in total ($35*128) for all 60 acres<n><n>60 acres/128 quarts = 0.46 (rounded) or 1/2 bucket on an acre<n><n>To purchase the tractor you need to pay $350,000<n><n>To purchase a plow you need to pay $95,000<n>To get a cheaper plow
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Two friends wanted to spend a quiet evening together, what did they go see? Choices:  A: wedding B: friend's house C: internet cafe D: movie E: restaurant<n><n>### Response:		The answer is B which means their friends house<n><n>### Why: I believe so because the wording of the question said so in the paragraph: "They wanted to hang out together as they love so much. Therefore they went to their friend's house to have quality time together."<n><n><n>### Input<n>A rental agency charges 12 dollars per day. How much, in dollar, does the rental agency charge for five days?<n><n>### Answer<n>The total is $12*5=60<n><n>### Response<n><n>You just showed how the amount was $12*5=$60. The question was asking for the charge if they rented for 5 days. Not the amount of $60 that you spent. So you do not need to show that the answer is $60.<n><n>### Recommended to revise <n>You should start from the beginning<n><n><n><br> <br><br> <n>### Demo:<n><n>### Input:"One of the four largest cities in the USA has a population of 3,000,000, and 3,344,800 miles is the city?"<n><n><br><n>### Answer:  Los Angeles, California<n><n>### Why<n>Answers are Los Angeles because of the population and the size of New York and Chicago are greater than 3,345,800 miles<n><n><n>### Demo response<n>Los angel is the answer.<n><n>### Review<n><https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j-qsM0qpN6S><n><n>You don't need to say the entire population because you are supposed to be showing how you got the answer. For example, you said one of their population is 3,00,00,0.<n><n>## Challenge<n><https://www1.aaastudent.org/Resources/Programs/CompBudGet/pdf/C1-6.pdf><n><n>How to determine the answer for all the multiple choice questions.<n><n>## Suggested Answers to the Questionnaire<n>[1] How to read & answer?<n>The reading will be followed by the understanding followed by the application followed by the test. <n>[2] What is the objective of the reading?<n>The objective of

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:John ran out of pencils.  Where did  he go to get more? Choices:  A: desk drawer B: cup C: pencil case D: shelf E: office depot<n><n>### Response:		<n>*E: office depot<n>### Input:The car rental agency charges $50/day for a small car, $75/day for a full size car, $100/day for a luxury car, and $150 for the first week (from the day the customer rents until the end of the first week).  Cars cost an average of $65.75 per day.  The total cost, in dollars, of renting a car for 6½ days was as follows: Small car (6½ days): <$65.75*6.5=<<$65.72*6.5=394>>$394.  Full size car (6½ days ): <$75*6.6=<<75*6.08=479>>$479.  Luxury car: <$100*8=<<100*8>>800.  Add the total for each type of car.<n><n>### Response<n>$394+$479+$800<n><n>-<n><n>### Input<n>Ramon needs to pay for fuel, tolls, and parking for his trip.  The cost of diesel fuel is $4.15/gal.  The cost of driving, without tolls and parking, is $0.04/mile and Ramon paid $1.49 to park.  He bought 6.75 gallons and drove 164.5 mi.  The fuel and parking together is how much?<n><n>-<n><n>$4.15*6.75+1.49<n><n>-<n><n>A customer bought an air conditioner that cost $1,152 plus a delivery charge of $40.  Additional charge: $30 per mile. How much will the delivery cost?<n><n>-<n>$1152+40+30*(1/2)
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:When you plant a garden you can harvest what to eat? Choices:  A: flower B: animal C: flower petals D: vegetable E: alive<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input: The plant dies and stops producing fruit.<n>Answer: vegetable<n><n>### Explanation<n>Input: This describes dead plants that do not produce fruit.<n><n>### Input#<n>Input: When you plant a garden you cannot harvest what? Choices:  C: petals  B: flower  A: flower<n><n>### Response#<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Explantion<n>```<n>Plant produce flowers and flowers have petals.<n>```<n><n>### Input Example:<n>Input: Can someone explain what I have to do?<n>Answer: E<n><n>### Explabation<n>```<n>To understand what she wants to know she wants to ask someone what she has to do to do the task so she will ask someone if she doesn't understand them.<n>```<n><n><n>### InputExample:<n>Input: I got a head cold from singing a chorus of Happy Birthday to my friend.<n><n>### ExampleResponse:<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Exemplalation<n>```<n>The "singing a chorus" in the sentence is the activity and "head cold" is the side effect that she is saying.<n>She got the head cold from singing the chorus of happy birthday so she is saying that the head cold was caused by singing a chorus.<n>```<n><n># Auxilliary
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Jackson is a popular city name, but the one with a governor's office is where? Choices:  A: michigan B: wyoming C: mississippi D: tennessee E: mississippi<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer: C -> This is a multiple choice question<n><n>### Instructions: What is the value of \(\sqrt{1000}\) to 5 decimal places?<n><n>I would expect something more than 100.4 for the correct answer.<n><n>### Demo:<n>5 answers:<n>```<n>1000<n><n>```<n>1010.03<n>```<n>10.031<n><n>```<n>1.00000,0328<n>```<n><n>1.003<n>```<n>```<n>1<n>```<n>```<n><n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Though nearby, an apple from an apple tree where would be an imported product to the USA? Choices:  A: ohio B: washington state C: alaska D: canada E: flowers<n><n>### Response:		E<n>E is the same as importing a flower<n><n>### Input<n>What is the number of shirts Aiden purchased? 12? 15? 6? or 10?<n><n>### Response The correct answer is 15<n>### Rationale Aiden purchased 12 shirts originally, but then an additional 3 were purchased, for a total of: 12 + 3 = 15<n><n>### Input 17 cats and 14 birds each cost 30 dollars. You spend 15 dollars. How much do 17 cats cost? Choices: A: 57 B: 109 C: 51 D: 216<n><n>### Response B<n><n>### Rationale:  17 cats C cost $17 * 30 = 510 + $15 = $525.    14 birds (216) cost $14 * 30 = $420<n><n>### Choice A is incorrect because the price of 17 cats added to 14 birds is only equal to 510 + 420 = $930.   <n><n>### Choices C and D are incorrect because they are not real numbers. Choice C is equal to 3, which is an actual number in terms of shirts. Choice D is a decimal, so not a whole number at all.<n><n>### Input The gas station charges $4.50 per gallon for gasoline. Two people bought gasoline. One bought 13.65 gallons. The other bought 44.62 gallons.  Who spent more?<n><n>### Choise A. The first person<n><n>### Rationales: The rationale is for the amount of gallons, not for the 13.68. You can use 13.6 and 44.63 to get the answer <n><n>### Input a truck can hold 150 gallons of water.  One person bought 100 gallons and the other person bought 150 gallones how much more did the first person spend on water?<n><n>### Answer B. The person who spent 600 more on water.<n><n>### Question
