Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What do humans do when they want to reproduce? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where is a monkey likely to be found in the rainforest? Which of the following sums is largest?(Choices: a) 55 b) 48 c) 40 d) 36 e) 18 <n><n>### Demnstration:<n>Given the five average rainfall data values in inches are 9,14,16,12,and 8 <n><n>#### 9+14+16+12+8= 82=48<n><n>### Input 14<n><n>### Input13<n><n>### Input5<n><n>### Input6<n><n>### Input<n><n><n>### Input=<br /><n><n>### Input3<n><n><n>#### 17<n>Answer: 3<n><n>### Instructions:<n>You have been invited to go bungee jumping. Below is a list of 9 items you could choose to bring on the jump.  Write a response that explains which items you would bring and why. To receive this grade, it is imperative that you support or justify your decisions.<n><n><n><br /><n><n><br /><img alt="Image_20190624_120531.png"/><n><n><n>### Response<n><n>The items that I would bring are ear plugs, safety line, helmet, harness, bungee cord, 2x clothes, shoes, life jacket and waterproof camera.<n><n><ul><n>  <li>[A]<n>When one goes for the bungee jumping one needs to be careful of the sound of the bounce. And for this I would bring ear plugs to avoid disturbances caused due to the bouncing.<n>  </li><n>  <li><n>The other thing which is essential is a safety line. You need an additional line to secure your harness so that if in case you fall, you can get back to the ground safely.<n>  </li></ul><n><ul><n>    <li>[B]</li><n>    <li>Helmet <n>      This is to avoid the risk of hitting the face with the rope.

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What does reckless driving lead to on a person? Choices:  A: injuries B: fatigue C: traffic jams D: tired E: accidents<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Explain:<n>A reckless driver can cause accidents.<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>### The Answer<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Rationale: I believe the answer is A but the answer is B<n><n>### Explaination: The answer is B, since reckless driving leads to fatigue.<n><n>### I think the answer choice should be reworded.<n><n>### Instead of saying it "leads to" or "causes" it should say "results In" and "can cause."<n><n>### The word "leads" doesn't fit since a person cannot drive alone nor is a person driving.<n><n>### To be safe please change it to "can cause" and "results In."<n><n>### Rationales: The first sentence of the question says: "What does reckless driving  >>"leads>>" to on a person?" We can safely remove "to." When the sentence is restated as: "What does  >>"leads to a person>>  on reckless driving?" we can drop "reckless" because it's part of the sentence. So, the sentence can now be restated: "What does  driving to a person on a person?" We know the answer to this is B, fatigue.<n><n>#### B<n><n>Answer: B<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where is a ferret getting lots of attention likely to be found? Choices:  A: trouser leg B: sick bay C: own home D: petting zoo E: mother's hair<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Demorestration:<n>For Option A: trouser leg<n>It is likely to be found inside a trouser leg in the home or in the petting zoo. However that may also mean it is found in sick bay. That makes B sick bay and D petting zoo and E mother's hair.<n><n>For Option B: sick bay<n>It is likely to only be found in sick bay.<n><n>For Option C: own home<n>It is likely to found only in the own home.<n><n>For Option D: petting zoo<n>It is likely to always be in the petting zoo or sick bay.<n><n>#### E<n><n>##### No Response<n><n>## Author: joseph<n><n>## Contributor: joseph.yuen99<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The animals weren't good at swimming, so it was hard for them to do what? Choices:  A: pass water B: bathe C: listen to each other D: feel pleasure E: reproduce asexually<n><n>### Response:		<n>D<n><n>### Rationales:<n>When the animals pass water they can hear each other and that's the only clue that there is an island close by.<n><n>The animals are so thirsty that they can only see the horizon in front of them. This gives them a small and blurry picture of the horizon. The water they are drinking gives them the power to see again.<n><n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>### Input How long will it take to reach that location?<n><n>### Response<n>The time it takes will be<n><n>52-16 hours<n><n>### Rationale:<n>The trip takes 52 miles and we are going 60mph for 16 hours at least.<n><n>#### 140<n>Answer:140<n><n>#### Note: There’s not actually a question for this one.<n><n>### Input Can it take longer?<n><n>### Answer<n>Yes it can<n><n>### Rationale:<n>The distance is 52 miles but that’s the maximum, we only could go at minimum 30 miles per hour. In theory we could be traveling and a lot of things could stop us from reaching the destination on time. Such as bad weather, bad roads, animals, or any other problems that would take time for us to solve<n><n>### Note: There<n>### Input<n>How many times has she gone to Texas?<n><n>### Rations:<n><n>Since she has gone two times to Texas, the third question is implied.<n>We can say that she went 2x to Texas.<n><n>#### 2<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input<n><n>How many times has he gone to Mexico?<n><n>### Note 1:<n><n>### Answer 1:<n><n>He has been to Mexico more than twice, even though he hasn’t visited more than two times, the answer of 1 implies that he is going to visit Mexico twice again if it weren’t for the fact that he is going to Texas.<n><n>### Note2:<n><n>###Answer2<n><n>I don't quite understand what this question is asking but I guess it has something to do with what is an acceptable time of day? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: cupboard B: countertop C: water D: hardware department E: england<n><n>### Response:		What does a teakettle have to do with England? Teakettles are used in England just as they are used in the United States. A teakettle is not found in a hardware store. A teakettles is found in the "kitchen" department. A teakettl does not usually sit on a countertop. And a teakettle is definitely not found in a cupboard.<n><n>### Input/Output:A man sells fish. Choices:  A. Fish B. Fishing poles C. Fishing line D. Fishing boat, E. Fishing charter <n><n>### Response/Answer: A man that sells fish sells frozen fish (usually) so his business is fishing charters. Chartering a boat is nothing with what fishing supplies have to do with selling fish. He may sell fishing poles, but he wouldn't be selling them to people for fishing, but for a past time.<n><n>### Actions:This question is a bit weird. Instead of putting in a few answers for a list of questions, it makes you put in a question and answer it yourself. If you do this wrong, it will still mark your answer as wrong. This question isn't as easy as it seems.<n><n>### What are the two kinds of tides?   Choices A: The high tides B: The low tides<n><n>### Response(What are the two kinds of Tides?)/Answer: The questions asks for A: The high times and B: The low tide. A high tide is very high and a low tide is very low. So, if your answer is A: The high times, then you'll get the answer right since your answer is correct. And if your answer is B: The low ties, then you'll be marked wrong even though your answer is wrong.<n>### The earth, The moon, and The sun are objects found in the sky. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. The water is in the gulph is rushing in to fill in all the areas that the storm was causing. The speed at which the water is filling in these areas is roughly 275 miles per hour. It is expected to take 8 days for all the water created by the storm to flow in.<n><n>Answers:<n>```<n>1 - The hurricane will probably cause a flood to hit this city.<n>2 - We need to stop the flood from coming to shore.<n>3 - The hurricane could break dams in the area.<n>4 - We should close all the roads in the area.<n>5 - Maybe the hurricane will make more land than expected.<n>6 - Wow! Hurricane season is going to be really hard this year!<n>```<n><n>## 束縛制御手段について<n><n>### Task<n><n><n>### Task:Answer all the questions.<n>Input: The hurricane will kill a number of people; it kills people in two different ways. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:We were having a canned food drive and I needed to pick up some contributions, where did I go? Choices:  A: shelf B: cellar C: refrigerator D: cupboard E: grocery store<n><n>### Response:		<n>Demonstration:My mom would buy the canned food from the grocery store, but where would she put it, the shelf or the cupboard?<n>**E**<n>#### 80%<n><n>### Instructions: Choose the answer that demonstrates the strongest understanding of the question.<n>1. A: Shelf B: Cellar C: Refrigerator D: Cupboard E: Grocery Store<n>2. A: Shelf<n>3. A: Cellar<n>4. A: Refrigerator<n>5. A: Cellar  <n><n>**1,2,5**<n>**6**%<n><n>### Input<n>A shipping company wants to know the cost of shipping their product to many towns around the United States.  The rate per shipment depends on the weight of a case of the product and the distance from the loading dock to the destination <n>The shipping rate for a case of product is $8.  If the load is 100 lbs, how much does it cost to ship the product to a location 300 miles away from the loading dock?<n><n>Weight to ship = <<Weight to ship = 100 >>100 <n>Delivery to <<Delivery to >><<100>>100 <n>Distance <<Distance>> <<300>>30<n>Delivery Rate = <<Distance rate = >> <<300/100 = 3>>3<n>Round-trip delivery = <<Case round-trip delivery = >> <<24>>24<n>Round-tripdelivery rate = <<Round trip delivery rate = >> <<24/3 >>24/3<n>Cases delivered at <<Weight rate = >> <<25/8>>25/8<n>Cases delivered = <<Cases delivered = >> <<30/25>>120120<n>Total Cases = <<Total delivered = >> <<3 * 120 >>360<n><n>Input: The shipping rate for a load is $6.00 per 100 pounds for shipments up to 700 miles from the shipping dock.  The delivery rate for each load is $8.00 per 30 miles.  I have a load of product that weighs 3,000 pounds. How
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The wheel was loose, and threatened to fall off when they were what? Choices:  A: footloose B: sailing C: fast D: tighten E: bind<n><n>### Response:		A: footloose<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The teams were evenly matched when competing against one another, what did spectators want to find out? Choices:  A: envy B: resentment C: winning or losing D: one winner E: two winners<n><n>### Response:		A: Choice: A<n><n>### Input:: Two cents per second equals 24 cents per minute. If her rate per hour for service is two dollars flat. How many hours would it take to make 45 dollars?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>We first have to multiply $2 \times 60 \times 60$ and we would get 7200 dollars<n>Then we have 25 dollars left on the second part of the equation to find how many hours are required so we would subtract 7200 from 45 and now we have 3760 left then we just have to divide 3760 by 25 and the answer would be about 153 hours<n><n>### Answer: 153<n><n>### Input:#In mathematics, a number, also called a real number, is a value that represents a quantity along a line and can be specified by a real number<n>#It can be thought of as a precise direction from zero that has no end. The first and third quadrants are positive numbers, the second and fourth quadrants are negative numbers, and the center of the graph is zero, where x=0. How many distinct negative numbers greater than -2 have an absolute value of 10?<n><n>### Response::: B: Because the center is zero. Any integer can be represented on the number line, so no other negative numbers besides -2 could be smaller than -2 and still have an absolute value of ten.<n>### This means we can solve for any of those 4 quadrant by multiplying a number that represents a certain direction on the y co-ordinate. In the x co-coordinate. To be very specific on the number line. We can multiply our y co-ordinate to -4 when it goes down because we want 10 absolute value and 4 is the size and we can multiply 2 to the other x co-ordinate when it goes down because it goes down by the number we want and we get absolute value of 1 and we can multiply 3 to the other x co co-ordinate so it goes up because it goes up in the other direction. That is the positive side and we can get a minus of our x co-ordinate. That leaves us with absolute value of negative 1. Then we have only a multiplier of 1 and we have already completed the problem.

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: apartment B: pantry C: table D: living room E: shelf<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Concept:<n>> Definition: A container, space, or area used to store something often in a systematic organized manner, e.g., in a library in the alphabetical order.<n>><n>> This is true because of all of the choices given in the question, "shelf" would be a more appropriate definition for this question, because each of the choices is not a place where you usually would store dishes but not book.<n><n>### Input<n>In a class, there are 40 students and all of the students take calculus. The student has 5 calculus teachers, with each teaching 5 classes a day. It can make 100 classes a day.<n><n>### Response<n><n>> The answer is 500, because there are 40 classes and 5 teachers. It was divided by 10 because there are 5 classes for each teacher.<n><n>### Analysis:<n>> The question states that there are 40 calculus teachers in the class.<n>The number of calculus teachers is equal to the number of classes in the class.<n>```<n>  40=500/1      (40/5)<n>```<n>> The question states 40 is divided by 5, so there is 40 classes. Since there 5 teachers, you can find the number of classes there are in each class.<n>```<n>      5/5  5      10<n>```<n>**Example**:<n><n>```<n>      Let <n>        n = Number of classes <n>        m = Number of the mathematics teachers.<n>        <n>        n=500/m<n>           500 = Number of classes,<n>               5 = Number of the mathematics' teachers<n>           5=m<n>        m=100<n>```<n><n>### Conclusion/Explanation<n>The conclusion and the explanation are that in a system a there are 500 classes. There are 5 classes in each class.Therefore, there are 5 classes.<n><n>This explains how to perform calculations. It tells what to do to make this problem easier.<n><n><n>### Questions?<n>If there are any questions, please contact me. I will be available on slack.  My username is "saviluz19"<n>I will give my cell phone number as 4105401650<n>

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What could there be in a beauty salon? Choices:  A: city B: strip mall C: clerk D: neighborhood E: rooster<n><n>### Response:		Option D<n><n>### Input<n>You are given an integer. The input ends when the symbol  “$”<n>is obtained. Enter the following:<n><n>$ 39<n>$ 31<n>$-14<n>$ 215<n>$ 343<n>$-7<n>$ 481<n>$ 189<n>$ 465<n>$ 131<n>$ 287<n>$ 81<n>$ 523<n>$-2<n>$ 122<n>$ 459<n>$ 9<n>$ 7<n>$ 206<n>$ 89<n><n>Your task is to sort the integer according to the last symbol<n><n>### Output<n>$ 130<n>$ 17<n>$ 110<n>$-77<n>$ 261<n>$ 213<n>$ 43<n>$- 10<n>$ 139<n>$- 0<n>$-187<n>$ 123<n>$- 98<n>$ 402<n>$- 29<n>$ 200<n>$- 89<n>$- 412<n>$ 517<n>$-404<n>$-193<n>$ 179<n>$ 288<n>$-222<n>$- 8<n>$- 477<n>$- 22<n>$- 94<n>$- 21<n>$-224<n>$-172<n>$- 62<n>$ 5<n>$ 321<n>$ 667<n>$ 170<n>$ 315<n>$ 176<n>$ 233<n><n>#### $ 343<n>Answer: $ 7<n><n>#### -14<n>Answer: $-77<n><n>#### - 193<n>Answer: $179<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What feeling might propel one to instituting civil action? Choices:  A: complications B: tiredness C: anger D: trial E: court case<n><n>### Response:		A or maybe B<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>### Inputs:Which of the following may help a writer improve paragraph transitions?Choices:  A: 3:3 sentence pattern B: adding details C: linking words D: topic statement E:  parallel structure<n><n>### Response:"A", "D", or "E"<n><n>### Rationale:"A"<n><n>### Input:"A" is grammatically true.<n><n>### Response"D" or "E"<n>### Rational: "D" can be helpful in transitioning and linking paragraphs.<n><n>### Input"D" or "A"<n><n>## Input:The students have to write an essay of 350 words:<n><n>### Choice D<n><n>### InputChoice D is grammatically true because it is an essential element.<n><n>### In a 350-word essay, how many words can you write for the abstract, introduction, body paragraph and conclusion?<n># Input11/9, 11/8, 12/8, 11/9<n><n>### ChoicesB,D,G<n><n>### Choosing B<n><n>### InputThe students have a task of writing a 250-word essays. They have 20 minutes to finish the task.<n><n>### Choicing D<n><n>### Ratiocination<n><n>* Choice D is grammatically appropriate since it has the correct number.<n><n>* In the given time, 20 minutes, the students can write 20/20 = << 20/2  = 2>>2 words per minute.<n><n>* 20/2 = <<20/2=5>>5 is the minutes and 5 is the number of words needed to write in 20 minutes<n><n>### InputWhat is greater<n><n>### Choose D<n><n>### Choicet D is greater than C<n><n>### RationaD is greater than C<n>* 5 is greater than 2.<n>* Therefore, Choice D is greater.<n><n>### What is the largest of the following whole numbers?<n><n>### Choiced B<n><n>### ChooscB is the largest among the given whole numbers.<n><n>### RaitiC>B only

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where can you buy a fishing rod? Choices:  A: furniture store B: fishing camp C: hardware store D: sporting goods store E: engine<n><n>### Response:		<n>### Instructional Design Rationale:<n>This is an opportunity for students to be able to create a new logical argument based on what is being asked for:<n>What is the correct way to ask the question?<n>How could the question be reworded to get at the answer?<n>How does the original design ask the question? How does the original design allow for a logical argument?<n><n>### Student Response:<n>The correct way to ask the questions is to add a comma and add the word: where<n><n>The question is now asking: <n>How can you buy a fishng rod?<n> <n>The original question has the words: Where can you buy a fishg rod?<n> <n> <n>### Instruction Desgn Rationale:<n>Student does well explaining their thoughts and then asks a question<n><n>### Student response:<n>What a terrible design of question: the student is correct!<n>The best way to ask the question is to add a comma: where can you "buy" a fishing rod.<n><n>### Student analysis of their answers:<n>1. The best way to ask a question is to add a coma: where did you get the answers?<n>2. The best way to reword the question is to add "where"<n>3. The original way to ask the question was terrible!<n><n>

The flight took 58 minutes. How far did the plane fly, in miles? Choice: B: 287.3 C: 314.5 D: 496.6 E: 617.5<n><n>### Response :<n>**C.** If the average speed was 320 then multiplying by the minutes (58) you get 19280/58 = 335.5 minutes. 335.6/60 = 5.57 minutes which means that for every minute they traveled 320/5.57 = approx 56.6mph<n>```56.6 minutes will get them 56.6/.60 = 945.9 miles```<n>So you take the first number 320, you add the rest to it and take the value 2 times 60 then subtract it: 320 + (5.7 x 946) - 5.7 = 287.22 miles<n>### Input: What is another word that rhymes with the word, plague?<n><n>### Response<n>**B.** **beguile**<n><n>### Input How did Cynthia arrive at her solution? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Boss b. Bossy c. Moss d. E. Mosses e. Mossy f. Boss g. Bosslike h. Mosses<n><n>### Rationales<n>1.) What do the following words have?<n>> Choices: a. Boss b, Bossy<n><n>2.) With what other word do they both share a common relationship?<n>> Choices b. bossy<n><n>3.) What would the "boss" be?<n>> Choices g. Boss<n><n>### Answer:<n>1.) Boss and Bossy would both have a common relationship due to sharing the letter "boss".<n><n>2.) bossy and boss both start with the same letter.<n><n>3. bossy would be called a boss.<n><n>### Answer2<n>a. Boss<n>b. has a common relationship to bossy.<n><n>1. The boss would be the bossy.<n>2. they both start with boss<n>3. The boss would call you bossy.<n>4. they rhyme.<n><n>b. Bossy<n>boss is in bossy so bossy and buss are alike becuase of the words that start with b.<n><n>### Rewrites:<n>A: Win money<n>b, Bossy<n>c, moss<n><n>### Rewrite2:<n>A: amusement<n><n>### Demand:<n>Choose the best synonym for each of the words or phrases shown, based on the definitions in this set of explanations. a. aunt b. amphibian c. amenable d. bossy<n>Rationales<n>1.) Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The department store is located in the Northwest USA.  Where might it be? Choices:  A: new york B: big city C: town D: idaho E: shopping mall<n><n>### Response:		(A) new york<n><n>### Input:"Who is stronger, Bob or Mark?" "What does John think of the project?""Is there a pizza place nearby? "What movie am I watching?""Is this a book?"<n><n>### Response:"Bob is stronger than Mark.",<n>"John thinks the project is great",<n>"The pizza place is over there",<n>"You are reading a book",<n>"A book"<n><n><br><n><n><table><n>	<tr><th style="width:50%">I will ask you your opinion</th><th style="width=50%">You will ask me my opinion</th></tr><n>	<tr><n>    	<td>I’m leaving for my vacation</td><n>    	<th style="background-color:#020B1D;">I’m going to my vacation</th><n>	</tr><n>	<li><n>    I have some free time<n>    I am free<n>    My car has run out of gas<n>    I am low on gas<n>   </li><n>	</table><n>### Answer:<n>I will tell you my plans for my vacation and I would also like to hear your opinion if you have any. I hope that you'll respond by telling me about your vacation plans as well. Thanks<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:John is studying animals. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What can happen in your mind while sleeping? Choices:  A: snoring B: talking C: get cold D: nothing E: might dream<n><n>### Response:		I will give an example of what happens in my mind when I am sleeping. I might dream, but I don’t talk or snore. I won’t get cold, because I will be covered and warm<n><n>### Input:\#491021<n><n>### Response:\#481021<n>### Explanation:Both of these examples would work, but in the second one the number was larger than the maximum size that could be stored in an int.  So it was padded with a zero that was not needed.

He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What divider stores papers for work or school? Choices:  A: street B: binder C: obesity D: living room E: office suite<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Demographic input:A woman is having car trouble.<n><n>-If the car repair service was located in the same building as the auto parts store, it would take her 12 minutes to locate the parts.<n><n>-If she were able to get the parts she needed she would wait an additional 12 more minutes to do the work. <n><n>-If she was able to get what she needed, she could complete the repair in 26 minutes.<n><n>How long, in minutes, did she need to find the parts and do the work?<n>Rationales:-12+12=<<12+12>>24<n>12(1/2)=<<12(1/4)>>6<n>26-24=<<26-24>>2<n>2<n>#### 2<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input:- <n><n>- <n><n>- 
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where would one find a captive monkey? Choices:  A: rain forest B: tree tops C: toy store D: zoological gardens E: great outdoors<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Demographics: 10% of 42 is:<n>I don't know<n><n>### Inputs: The sales tax in the city of Tucson is.<n><n>### Response- 6.9%<n><n>### Input/Rationale: The 2015 Census Bureau population figures for the city of Glendale, California, were 209,701. Of that number, 26,046 were males and 183,655 were females. What would the 2016 population of the city of Glendales be if the population remained the same in 2016?<n><n>### Response 223,019<n><n>### Input 17<n><n>### Input In a city there are 800 males, 468 females, and 210 kids. Write an expression whose value is the number of people in the city.<n><n>### Rationales: So we have 800+322=<<800+302=1122>>1,122<n><n>### Input For 30 miles, how many gallons of gas can a 30-gallon gas tank get?<n><n>### Rationale There are three gallon increments so 30/3=<<30/3=10>>10 10/3=<<10/3=3>>3 of a gallon per increment so the number of increments is the whole number divided by 3. We get 30/3 4 times resulting in 30/3*4=<<30/2=15>>15
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:If someone is outgoing what are they likely to seek? Choices:  A: new experiences B: playfulness C: own house D: good looking E: beautiful<n><n>### Response:		A: new experiences <n><n>Input: Given that two numbers are relatively prime, what is the greatest common factor of thos numbers? Choices:  a: 1  b: 2  c: 3  d: the same number as the smallest number<n><n>### Response D: d. d
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What sport is the audience the loudest at? Choices:  A: show B: theatre C: hockey game D: movies E: event<n><n>### Response:		<n>Let S(audience) = loudness |H|<n>Let Q(audience) = question<n>Let R(audience) = response<n>A: Hockey – S = 1, Q = Is it hockey? R = hockey<n>B: Theatre – S = 2, Q = Whats on? R = show<n>C: Movie event (Bring your dog) – S = 3, Q = Is dog allowed? R = yes<n>D: Movie Event (bring your dog) – S= 2, Q = Is dog permitted? R = no<n>E: Movies – S =3, Q = Is there a film that you recommend? R = yes<n>#### D<n>Answer: The loudness of the audience in a hockey game is the highest.<n>

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Sarah took poison by accident She found it in the cabinet and. thought that it was what? Choices:  A: drinkable B: junk food C: medicine D: antidote E: nutrient<n><n>### Response:		In a question like this the answer will be a little out there and hard to see<n>#### A<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input:-22 + 32 + 62  Choices:  A. -365  B. -348  C. -48  D. -35 E. -22<n><n>### Instructions:Solve the inequality and answer the question.<n><n>## Instructions:Solving the inequality and completing the question.<n><n>#### -108<n>Answer: D<n><n>### Input-25 cm + 15 cm  Choices:  C. 20 cm  B. 30 cm  D. 35 cm<n><n>### Input; A 4 ft 2x4 is 4 2nd's by 4 2nds so how many cubic ft is a 6 ft 2x4? (4 second foot are in a foot).<n><n>### Input<n>-3x + 17<n><n>### Input.<n><n>### Input.-2^x 1/2x Choices:  B. -1/4  E. -1/2  D. -1  C. 1/2<n><n>### Input! 32- 8- 4 Choices:  C: -22 E: -2 D: -1 A: +1 B: +2 <n><n>### Input -3 + 4  Choices:  B: -11 D: -1 A:-9 E: -7  C: -8<n><n>### Input 8 -16 < -4  < -20<n><n>### Instuctions: The answer can be 1 or -1<n><n>### Instutcions: The answer will be 1 or -21 as it is in answer options.<n><n>### C:92  B:84 C:78  D:-23 A:-27<n><n>### A:3  C:6<n><n>## Answer = 384,816,144,127,266,228,000=10 (with repeats!)<n><n>### Input What is 26^x? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where would there be a connection to go to another place? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What white meat goes well with potatos? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. For those who already pay a fee above $150 per week to have rubbish collected from their home, the government will not provide a discount. What is the value of 100/53?<n><n>### Response  : 2.0<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>So the number of households, that would get the benefit of the government for their disposing the solid waste, would be less than 53. Which is written in the given statement that, if the household generates less than 53kgs of waste, then they would avail the benefit of discounted collection. <n><n>But, if households generate less than 53 kg of waste per week, then its also possible that they would be above 53 kg. But it is also defined in the statement, if household already pay 150 dollars, then they wouldn't be given the benefits. <n><n>Thus, 100-53= << 100-150=25>>25 houses gets the benefit. But out of 25 house, if a 150-dollar houses also gets the benefit, then their has to be 25-1= << 25-1 =
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where can you get a stray small dog? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. We also learned some of the language features of JavaScript. We introduced the concepts of data types, functions, and if else statements. We learned about conditionals, loops, and objects. We also learned about arrays and the concept of nested loops, especially useful in recursion.<n><n>---<n><n>We learned how to build a function that accepts an array as input and sums all the numbers in the array. We can use this function to sum up any array of numbers by changing its input like so:<n><n>```javascript<n>// sum function to sum numbers<n>function sum(array) {<n>  var sum = 0;<n>  for (var i = 0; i < array.length; i++) {<n>    var value = array[i];<n>    sum += value;<n>  }<n>  return sum;<n>}<n><n>// sum function to find sum of even numbers using array<n>function sumOfNumbers(array) {<n>	 return sum(array, value => value % 2 === 0);<n>}<n><n>// call function<n>console.log(sumOfNumbers([4, 1, 2])); ➞ 7<n>```<n><n>

A: football stadium, C: car show B: surface of earth E: movie<n><n><h2>Correct answer is:</h2><n><n><b>D</b>: The people attending an “opera” are looking at the actors moving; the players attending a “football” game are looking at the people moving.<n><n>### Response 2:<n><n><h2 class="answer">-1) Operas are held in a building called an opera house.</h2><n><n>-2) A player at a “football” game may be in the air while attending a “car show.”<n><n><h2><b class=alternative>-3) People attending a “car” show are looking at the show floor, where the cars are moving around.</b></h2><n><n>![picture4](../Images/Pictures/picture4.png)<n><n>### Feedback<n><n><h3>This is the answer for the instruction</h3><n><n><h3><img src="../Images/Pictures//check1.jpg" class="pic" /></h3>
