Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where do  you park in the parking lot with shopping bags? Choices:  A: amusement park B: urban area C: airport D: shopping malls E: train station<n><n>### Response:		Which place do you park with  shopping bags?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: Amusement park<n>Rationales: It is more likely or  obvious that  you would park in  an amusement park with a lot of people, there are a lot of distractions and it is harder to focus on your shopping bags.<n>This  would also get to you to a shopping mall.<n>#### A<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input and Response<n>Input:  Would you buy a CD player for  $15.00 or DVD player for  $75.00?<n><n>Response: What would you buy for  $75?<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Demonstration:<n>Input and response match!<n><n>This is like this:<n><n>### Input<n><n>Input: Would you buy a CD  player or DVD player for $75.0<n><n>Rationales : When people  have money what do they want to do with it, or most likely.<n><n>$15 = >>$15=2.76<<$75=21.61<n><n>It would be easier to purchase the 2x price which is a DVD player since you are going to buy 21 to the 0th power.<n><n>#### B<n>Answer: B<n><n><n>### Input, response and evaluation<n>Input: The car rental agency charge $30/day  for a car, or  $190 for  the first week  for a rental  that lasts  an entire week or longer<n><n>Rationales:<n><n>Input: Jennie rent a car on day 4 the 5 day the 6 day so she paid for $190 but was only renting for 3 days<n><n>Response: How much, in dollars did she pay for the  rental?<n><n>### Input & demonstration <n><n>Input:  60 miles per hour<n><n>Rationales<n><n>Input: Total driving time,  in hours it will take to transport  all of his cattle to  higher ground?<n><n>It's just like this<n><n>Input: A car rental agency  charges $30/  day for a car   Or $190  for the first week for  a  rental  that    lasts
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:James used the cannon to shoot at something while seeking lunch. It was overkill.  What did he shoot at? Choices:  A: body armor B: ungulate C: bomber D: kill people E: animal<n><n>### Response:		 James shot the kill people.<n><n>### Explanation: Aung is wearing body armor so if the cannon is used to eliminate someone with body armor then it would be classified as overkill.<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: station B: every car and house C: shop D: bedroom E: space shuttle<n><n>### Response:		Shop!<n><n>### Input::If a person has ever gotten carved in a pumpkin, which of these would be the best guess at the age of the person?<n><n>### Rationals:<n>A 1-2 year old is likely carved into a pumpkin for Halloween.<n><n>C 1-2 years old is likely carved in a pumnpkin for Halloween<n><n>D They may be carved in a pneumonic<n><n>### Response C 1-2 years is best guess!<n><n>### Instructions:What is the following expression equivalent to in the BINARY number system?<n><n>### Response::<n><n>6100010000002<n><n>### Inputs:<n><n>### Response B 2 8<n><n>### Instuction::Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Instructions:<n>#### Answer Choice A:<n><n>#### Answer Choice B:<n><n>#### Answer choice C:<n><n>#### Answer Bottom:<n><n>## Instrucions:<n><n>## Instruction:The area of an apartment is 15 square feet. Which of the following could it measure?<n><n>## Rationales:<n><n>## A and B 324 square feet<n><n>## C 10<n><n>## A-<n><n>## B- 888 square feet<n><n>## D 54 square feet<n><n><n>## Answer:<n><n><n> <n>## Rationale:<n><n>## A- 324 square inch<n><n>## B- square inches<n><n>## C Square Centimeter<n><n>## D- 54 cm2<n><n>## Instrucation:<n><n>## Answer:True or false-<n><n>## Rational:<n><n>## A true because 888 inch is a fraction.<n><n>## B is false
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Learning usually leads to greater what? Choices:  A: get to know B: gain knowledge C: intelligence D: education E: gaining knowledge<n><n>### Response:		B Learning requires memorization of facts and information from educational materials taught in school or taught by personal mentors experienced in a variety of fields.<n><n>### Next: Answer the questions.<n><n><n>### A The first step of building a house involves _____ing the land.<n><n><n>## Input:Which of the following is the BEST description of the difference between the two words think and think?<n><n>### Rationale:  The two words think and think do not have similar definitions.<n><n>###<n>The term think refers to a group of words that have similar definitions but do not rhyme.<n>The term think implies a specific type of thinking.<n>The term think refers a form of cognitive functioning that is different.<n>The term think is what people think about.<n><n>### Output:The term think refers to cognitive functioning and the term think refers to a specific type of thinking about different things.<n><n>### Answer:Think is a word that is a homophone and that has a different meaning than think.<n><n>### The term think refers to a form of cognitive thought and the term think refers a specific kind of thinking about different things than think.<n><n>

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where does a marmoset not usually go? Choices:  A: dictionary B: wilderness C: fly D: underground E: colorado<n><n>### Response:		Option C: Fly<n>Because it's a jungle and there are many deadly venomous things there that could eat it.<n><n>### Input:-4 < 15<n>Answer:-11<n><n>### Response:-(-2+9)-(-4+5)<n><n>### Input.Input and Output for the following code:<n><n>##### Input:  input = input1 + input2 + input3<n>Output:  output = input<n>In other words: output1 + output2 + output3<n>##### Input: input = 1<n>Output:  output1 + output2 (output is returned twice)<n>##### Input: output = 3<n>Output: input + 1 (output is added to input)<n><n>##### Input1:  input = 123<n>Input2:  input = 234<n>Input3:  input = 345<n>##### Input:<n><n>##### Output:<n><n>### Output:462+392<n><n>### Task:<n><n>The problem is of the following type: You are a caterer at a popular bar and have to cater for 20 people but you only have 15 bowls for soups and broth. You need to decide whether to use both or one of the following methods:   <n><n>Methods:<n><n>  1. You split the 5 bowls of broth evenly over the 20 people and the 15 bowls of soup evenly<n>     over the 19 people (the last person will get their share of soup in a cup).    <n><n>  2. You split the 10 bowls of soup even over the 20 guests and use your additional 5 bowls to serve    <n>     the 20 guests the broth.<n><n>Which of these is the better choice?<n><n><n>### Input for the code:<n>    var input = input1 + 123 + input2;<n><n>### Response for the code:<n><n>Answer: 462 <n>Input + 392<n><n># Instructions<n><n>### Instructor writes: In order to move all the digits in the 30 digit number 341545454578909383394152345

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:When going to sleep what noise does a human make? Choices:  A: loss of consciousness B: relaxation C: snoring D: dreaming E: talking<n><n>### Response:		B<n>**Rationales:** Humans become more relaxed when they go to sleep and may make noise called snoring. This does not mean that they will all be talking or dreaming in their sleep.<n><n>#### B<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Input :What is the average of 2, 4, 6, and 8?<n><n>#### Solution: Add 2 and 4 <n>divide by 2<n><n>#### Result : __4__<n><n>### Input:: A car is a four-wheeled vehicle without an aircraft. Choices:<n>**A. true**<n>**B. false**<n><n>### Response : A<n><n>### Input 1: 4 hours<n><n>### Input2 40 hours<n><n>### Soluation : 4 hours is less then 40 hours<n>### Solucution: A<n><n>### Answer : A<n><n>##<n>### Instruction : In a study of college students, it was found that<n>  students were most likely to have a car in college in the West,<n>and least likely to have a car when they finished college. Which of the following statements is true?<n>Choices: 1. A student’s odds of having a car increase in college 2. A student’s<n>odds of having a car decrease in college 3. A student’s chances of having a car in college do not depend on geographic location 4. A student’s car ownership in college does not change their car ownership when they graduate
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What is the opposite of a village? Choices:  A: rural area B: africa C: ohio D: big city E: tribe<n><n>### Response:		A is correct<n><n>### Instructions:Find the sum of the product of two whole numbers. Round the product to the nearest hundredth if necessary.<n><n>### Input1:8.73247<n><n>### Input2:122<n><n>### Response4058.732 is correct.<n><n>### Summary<n>Answers:<n>#### 31<n> Answer: 31<n><n>#### 11<n> Answer: 11<n><n>#### 29<n> Answer: 29<n><n><n>#### 317<n> Answer: 369<n><n>#### 69<n> Answer: 341<n><n>#### 3<n> Answer: 6<n><n>#### 84<n> Answer: 92<n><n>#### 711<n> Answer:1598<n><n>#### 27<n> Answer: 154<n><n>#### 37<n> Answer: 62<n><n>#### 217<n> Answer:695<n><n>#### 221<n> Answer: 703<n><n>#### 283<n> Answer: 765<n><n>#### 157<n> Answer: 214<n><n>#### 12<n> Answer: 72<n><n>#### 47<n> Answer: 94<n><n>#### 76<n> Answer: 108<n><n>#### 10<n> Answer: 82<n><n>#### 35<n> Answer: 165<n><n>####12<n> Answer:144<n><n>#### 446<n> Answer: 519<n><n>#### 33<n> Answer: 172<n><n>####11<n> Answer:201<n><n>#### 409<n> Answer: 548<n><n>#### 61<n> Answer: 222<n><n>#### 57<n> Answer:308<n><n>####10<n> Answer:310<n><n>#### 89<n> Answer:501<n><n>####960<n> Answer:970<n><n>#### 26<n> Answer:486<n><n>#### 452<n> Answer: 604<n><n>####18<n> Answer:70<n><n>### Instuction : In a game of chance, it is important to have an accurate understanding of which choices you have to

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What place would a person go to look at zebras? Choices:  A: zoo B: museum C: hospital D: desk E: opera<n><n>### Response:		A: Zoo<n><n>### Instructor-Submitted Content:In the first multiple choice question above, the renter pays $310. The number of days is not listed in the question. How do you get $310 from the provided information? Can you explain further?<n><n>### Instructor-Submitted Content 2:In the second multiple choice question, the first 7 days was $ 190. Then there were 11- 7 = 4 days left. The remaining 4 x 30 = $120. Finally, you added the $190 plus the $120 = $310. Is this correct? Explain. Can you explain further? <n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What would someone wear to protect themselves from a cannon? Choices:  A: ungulate B: bomber C: body armor D: tank E: hat<n><n>### Response:		What would someone wear?<n>The correct response is choice A: ungulate<n>Explanation: Choices that are not correct are A, C, E, D.<n><n>### InputA box contains only round objects. One of the objects is flat. The others are: Choice A: 3 2 1 Choice B: 4 1 3 Choice C: 4 3 2 Choice D: 1 4 2<n>Given all 5 choices, use your knowledge of each choice’s shape to determine one that is different from the others.<n><n>### Response1:How many objects are there in a set<n><n>2 there are two different round things<n>2 there are two flat things<n>2 there are three different things<n>2 there are four different objects<n><n>### Response2:There are two things in a set. One of them is different. How would you guess which one?<n>Both round/flat and round/round<n>Both round/round and flat/flat<n>Flat/flat and round/flat<n>Which guess would be correct?<n>The correct response would be FLAT/FLAT because it has two options and one is different.<n><n>### Explanation of choices<n>Choice A: 3 3 1 This is a set with three objects.<n>Choice B: 2 4 3 This is also a set with three objects as they are different but it is the opposite<n>Choice C: 4 10 3 Because its the same thing you are repeating<n>Choice D: 1 5 2 Because if one is flat and the other is round it's repeating the shape of the object so its the wrong answer<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where does someone not happy to take their car? Choices:  A: down a river B: city C: repair shop D: parking lot E: neighbor's house<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>#### Answer:<n>D<n><n><n>### Input 1:  A rancher has 130 sheep and 55 goats. The goats are worth $4 each, and the sheep are each worth $10 each.  The rancher wishes to sell half her sheep and her goats.  How many sheep and how many goats does she have to sell to get $1650?<n><n>Response 1: The answer depends on which is being sold.  The answer can be no more that the sheep sold or the goats sold.<n><n>__If I sell sheep__, I would have to get the value of 70/130=$3.23*60=$196.60 and that would be the value of 71 sheep. I would end with that value being 130-196.6=33.4. You have to also take into consideration that you can only sell half or 18.7 the sheep.<n>__If I sell goats__, I can sell 22 goats since the goats are worth $82.00. I will need that value since it is less then $165.00.  I will have 22/55=42/55=3.7 goats left and since they are all selling for $4 each, I would end up with $148.00 that I have left to play.<n><n><n>__If I have 15.3 sheep and 38.4 goats__, I will need to sell 8 goats worth $33.60.<n><n>#### 33.60<n>Answer: 15.3<n><n>### Response 2: <n>__If I sell my sheep__, I would need to sell 69/130=53/130=0.42 sheep to get the value of:<n><32.3 * 60 = 1,964.6><n>This would leave me with 130-0.42 = 129.58 and I could end up with 4 goats.<n>__If I sale my goats__, since I can only sell half, I would sell 29/55=0.5
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:To gain her trust the real estate agent was very polite, delightful and all around what? Choices:  A: manipulate B: charming C: deceive D: exaggerate E: incompetent<n><n>### Response:		<n>The answer is B.<n><n>### Rationale<n>The answer A manipulation is not the correct answer.<n>The answer D exaggerated is not the correct answer because that might get her in trouble, it is not what the agent would put as the answer. The answer would be manipulation and the answers manipulation is not there.

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Why would I want to be exercising? Choices:  A: fatigue B: relaxation C: tiredness D: muscle weakness E: losing weight<n><n>### Response:		A. fatigue<n><n>### Input:{20}/100 = 0.2<n><n>### Response:{20}/17-100 =1/5}<n>20 divided by 30% is one fifth of 20.<n><n>### Input:"I"m sorry, but I don't have any $6,000. Do you have any $2,000 bills?"<n><n>### Response:"I do not."<n><n>### Input:'A' is for 'apartment', 'T' is for 'townhouse', 'H' is for 'house'. Choose the correct letter 'C' for 'condominium'.<n><n>### Response:'a' has one vowel,<n>'a'.<n><n>### Input:( 1 + 2 + 4 + 8 + 16 + 32 + 64)/2 = 16<n><n>### Response:( 1 + 5 + 9 + 25 + 49 + 99 + 199)/2 = 25<n>The denominator is 199, which is odd, so it's remainder 1.<n>The quotient is 1 + 1 + 5+ 15 + 33 + 73 = 166; which rounds to 170.<n><n>## Solution:<n>### Answers<n>Solution: A. fatigue is correct, because they want to be exercisng to lose weight.<n><n>Solution: 20 divided by 100 = 1/5, as 20/1.70*100 = 20 divided by to 5<n><n>Solution: Do not, because sorry is negative<n><n>Solution: apartment, townhouse, and house have vowel in the correct places, so C should be also. However, condo has three vowels, so it should still be D.<n><n>Solution:(a)+(2)+(4)+(8)+(16)+(32)+(64)/2 = (a)+(3)+(7)+(35)+(69)+(139)+(279)/2 = (a+3+7+35+69)+(b+7+3
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The wind tore off the shingles, what was the wind like? Choices:  A: dry hair B: spreading C: blowing hard D: change direction E: wave wheat<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input:"How fast did the biker go?" Choices:"A: 25 mph' B:326 km/h" C: less than 20 mph" D: 125 km/h"E: 20 mph or below<n><n>### Response:"B"<n><n>### Input:: There is an old joke that the two happiest days in a boat owner's life are when he finally buys one and when he finally gets rid of one.  He got rid of his boat when he moved to the desert.  How long had he owned the boat?<n>### Response:"It had been 8 years since he bought the boat"<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following Multiple Choice Question<n>### Demonstation:<n>Input:"My 7-year old daughter said the other day that she would like to visit the beach.  I explained that she is far too young to go swimming alone.  If she wanted to go swimming, she would either have to have me go with her to make sure she is OK, have one of her grandmothers swim with her, or her grandfather go with her."  Which of the following is a valid choice?<n>### ChoiceA:"She likes to play in the water with boats and such"<n>### Response:"None of the above"<n>### ChoiceB:"I took her fishing last year, she likes fishing"<n>### Response:B"I took her fishing"<n>##  C:"Her grandmother really wants to take her, she likes her grandmother"<n>##  D:"Swimming should be restricted to adults"<n>##  E:"She likes to splash in the water from the boat while I drive her around"<n>##  Response:"D"<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Ice fishing can be done surprisingly far out most winters on what greatest of the Michigan's greats? Choices:  A: pond B: underwater C: aquarium D: lake superior E: body of water<n><n>### Response:		<n>1) Ice fishing can be done amazing distances up, most winters, on which greatest of the Michigan' s greats? <n>Answers: <n>A: Pond<n>B is underwater<n>C is aquarium<n>D is lake Superior<n>E is body of water<n>### Input:What is greater, the radius or the diameter of the wheel? Choices: <n>A: The radius is less <n>B: They are at the same<n>C: The diameter is greater<n>D: The diameter is less<n>E: They are the same<n><n>### Response<n>### A: The radius is less<n>B: They are equal<n>C: The diameter rises more<n>D: The diameter rises less<n>E: They're the identical<n><n>### Instructions:<n>#### Below you will find a written answer<n><n>An electric mower cost 120 $ and needs 8 hours to charge. How long till it can be turned on and used to mow a lawn which is 1/6 an acre?<n><n>Rationales:<n><n>The lawn is 1/6 of an acre and the mower can handle an acre. This means the mower would need to be used 1/6th of the time to mow that lawn.<n><n>The mower has 8 hours to fully charge once it has been charged, it will be able to be used for 1/6 of 8 hours. This means it will be able to have 1/6 and hour to mow.<n><n>1/6 an ae can be turned off in 1/6th a full of an hour at 8pm.<n><n>#### 4 Hours<n>Response:<n><n>### Instrumentation:<n>I will grade based on following aspects<n>- Rational (15 points)<n>- Correct answer (15 points)
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:If there is a stale smell in the air coming from the kitchen, what should one check for the source of the smell? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Collections of atoms called molecules make up everything you can hold in your what? Choices:  A: atom B: anything C: air D: feet E: hands<n><n>### Response:		Hands<n><n>#### Response:Hands<n>Answer: 1<n><n>### Instructions: Write a response that answers the question.<n><n>## Extra Credit<n><n>### Instruct:Which is a better approach?<n><n>### Answer: I'm not certain<n><n>### Rationale: 3<n><n>### Answer A: I think writing a function first and then coding it to complete the task would be a better approach.<n><n>### Answer B: I'm not sure if a better approach would be writing a function first and coding it to work then completing the task after coding it.<n><n>### I'm not certain if my first approach would be the better approach for the task at hand.<n><n>> [Back](../../index)<n>

You also know that the answer to any expression is the amount of times the first number is in the expression.<n>The answer is your sum (1+2=3); the answer to (2+5) is (2+2+5=7).<n>Find the answer to the following expression: (1+2)+(2+5)+ (5+10)+ (10+15)...<n><n>### Demarestation:<n><n>#### The steps are:<n>  * Find the last number<n>  * Subtract 1 from that number and replace it by 1<n>  * Add one to the value of the next number in the list using the step above<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>We know that A+B = (1+A) + B<n>When we have two or more numbers such as 1+2+3+4+5+6+7+8+9, the first two numbers are the same and they need to be added to. We call these numbers A and B.<n>To add A+B we start from the answer and start at 1 we go until we are left behind 1 or we have A+B.<n><n>#### What is the answer to the expression: 10*(4*6*8*10)<n><n>### Response :<n><n>10 540 5600<n>```<n>### 1212 <n>Input:  'Drive from Loch Ness to Edinburgh'<n><n>### Rationale:<n><n>We know Edinburgh is 34 miles from Loch Ness.<n>And we know a trip takes an hour.<n><n>A trip from A->B takes an hour. We drive from A to B at an average speed of 55 mph.<n>

An incomplete pass is worth minus two points, a touchdown one point, a touchback three points, and a safety two points. The Green Bay Packers led the Baltimore Colts 21 to minus-3 by the end of one quarter, and 25 to 6 at halftime.  What was the score in the second half? <n><n>### Response - Rationale: The Packers lost a point for each completed play. They scored five touchdowns, and the other team scored once, therefore the Packers scored 5 points and the other team scored 2 points. They gave one point to the other team, therefore the final score for the game was 32 for the Packers and 4 for the other team (32=21+11)<n><n>### Input –  Question: What is the range, in degrees Celsius (0 to  100), of a temperature of 25 degrees Fahrenheit (77 degrees Farenheit)?<n><n>### Response — Rationale: If you consider that the range is going from 0-100 the answer would be going from 25 to 75. You would then have to solve for the cost.<n><n>### Rationales: You have 7 days left.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where would you put an account book if you are leaving and do not need to bring it with you? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Next, we have 180 - 12 = 168.  Next, we have 6 - 4 = 2. So 2 - 84 - 168 = - 204. But we still need the other factor, 2, so we have 204/2 + 96/2 = 202/2 + 48/2 = 101/2. 101/125 - 25 (which equals -3/8). And this is 190.7 / 8, which is 192 rounding the whole thing down so that it can fit in the 2 digit system.<n><n># Example 1<n>Input:3 / 4<n><n>#### Explanation:<n>3\(3\)\(3\)\(1\) or \(1\) or \(4\) or \(4\)<n>Rationale: we must multiply 3 by 1 as this example was 3/4, which means 3 times 4.<n><n>Input:(8)60+(1)40-(7)15<n><n>#### Explanance:<n>The answer is (1)40+(7)15 for several reasons. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:During the brainstorming session there was a lot of talking and what? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. The winds should be low (10 knots), but the temperature will drop into the 10-20 range and climb back up into the 30s.<n><n>Each day of a five-day trek, the guide informs climbers, requires the equivalent of a rest day spent down at lower elevations.  Therefore, after two days of travel, with a planned campsite somewhere near the summit, the climber needs to choose one of the following two options: 1) rest in the campsite provided at the base of the mountain, or 2) return to the nearest trailhead to spend the night.<n><n>Which is the correct description of the forecast information given above?<n>RationalesThe temperatures are expected to rise on day three from low temperatures on day two into temperatures that are close to those experienced on day five.<n><n>Days two and three are supposed to be quite windy, and it is also quite unlikely that conditions will be as calm as expected at both campgrounds on those days.<n><n>During day two and day five, the conditions can be as calm as they are expected to be on day four.<n><n>Since the guide estimates that each day is the equivalent of a restful day, and the guide expects that each of days two, three, and five will be rather windy, it is logical to assume that either campground could be windy and uncomfortable

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The print was extremely small, as he was reading letter after letter he began to suffer eye what? Choices:  A: strain B: though C: happiness D: realization E: understanding<n><n>### Response:		The Correct Correct answer was [A: strain] because the writer is using an old fashioned letter of the [A: strain. B: though. C: happiness. D: realization. E: understanding.] of it that's why he suffer a eye strain.<n><n>### Inputs: A 1976 Buick with a 455-cubic-inch engine, 5.7-liter-displacement engine, 390-horsepower engine, 400-horsepower gasolineoline V-8 engine with twin-turbochargers, 4-barrel-fuel-injection engine, 5-inch-head-pipes engine, 500-rpm tachometer, and single exhaust system, which is not fuel injected, has a turbocharger, is a supercharger, and has dual exhausts?<n><n>### Response<n>The Correct Correct answer was 1976 BUICK with  a 5-liter-engine, 225-horsepower engine,1978 model and a turbocharger. Because the question ask about engine types, B for 1978 model year only? The answer has all engine types mentioned which is a 5-liter engine, 225 horsepower engine.<n><n><n><n><n>### Input 1 : What do the following phrases mean? Choices:  The bride-to-be was a lovely blond.  She was very happy.<n><n>### Response 1:   Correct Answer was [The bride-to- be was a lovely blonds] since lovely blonds means a girl or woman is beautiful and has long blond hair.<n>Happy means a woman or a girl is happy with her partner choice.<n>Happy refers to the woman’s moods.<n><n><n><n>## Input 2 : What do the following numbers mean in scientific notation? Choices: 4.46 x 1013<n><n>## Response 2 :  The correct answer is [4.46 x1013] since 10  is base on 10 it means the value is to power of 10<n><n><n>### Response : Answer: 4.4 x100,00
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:If I have a reception with many people attending, where should I be sure to hold it? Choices:  A: grand casino B: large room C: restaurant D: country club E: lobby<n><n>### Response:		<n>Cause D and E<n><n>### Input A:A cowboy rode his horse at a rate of 20 miles per hour over a period of 240 minutes.  How many miles did the horse travel?<n><n>### Rationales<n>Cause I know D and C<n><n>### Response B:<n>Cause D<n><n>### Input B: A car-rental agancy charges $30/hr. for a car, plus a one-time charge of $45. How much, in one dollar, does a renter pay the car-rental agany for a four hour rental lasting four hours?<n><n>### Cause C<n><n>### Output<n>45<n><n>### Answer<n>45<n><n>----<n><n>### Submitted by<n><n>### Name:<n>Yilong Pan<n><n>### TA:<n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What past time are people engaged in when they are traveling along liquid? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Bill was awaking, what was happening to him physiologically? Choices:  A: tiredness B: grogginess C: discomfort D: getting out of bed E: eyes opening<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### 1<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Inputs:<n>- Name: Jennifer<n>- Major: Psychology<n>- Hour: 830<n><n>- What time is it?<n>- Subject: Psychology 101<n><n>### Response<n><n>#### 1630<n><n>The time on the calendar is 5:30. The calendar shows that it has been 12 hours, or 2 x 1 x 60 = 120, since midnight. Now it shows 8:30 and the 16:30 indicates that there are 16 times 30 = 192 + 30 = 222 minutes since midnight, when converted to hours is 3:44.<n><n>__Example__: 12AM = 00:00, and that 12:15AM would be 00:15. The next day, it would be 12:45AM.<n><n>| | The year is 2019 because the number "19" is above the zero. The month is the one before the number of the month next to the year. |<n>| 2019 | It is September because September is the number after the "2019". A few months before that is June, and a few months after that is November. |<n>| 16:35 | 4:35 PM |<n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. The following questions refer to the two largest newspapers in a certain city.<n>Renewal notices for subscriptions to the city’s two newspapers went out last week.<n><n>If a subscription is less than one year old, how many women will renew their subscription to the morning paper?<n><n>Option A: The morning paper will lose 24% of its female subscribers.<n> Option A: The morning paper loses 20% of its female subscriptions.<n>Option C: The morning paper will need to make 120 new subscriptions among its female readers to break even<n>Option B:<n>Option D:<n>Option E:<n>#### Option A:<n>24% * 100% = <<24% * 92% >17.6%>>17.6%<n><n>Answer: Option:<n>24%*(92%)-17.6% = 24%*0.92-0.176 = <<24*0.92 - 0.176>>92.40% remaining<n>Option E: 92.4%<n><n>### Input<n>You have a 26-ounce container of whipping cream, which you could use in any of the following ways: 1) 5.4 cups of whipped cream, 2) 11.5 cups of half-and-half, and/or 3) 16 cups of ice cream or froyo. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The jar was plastic, just like most of the stuff in the kitchen.  John preferred glass, and wished he was somewhere else.  Where does he want to be? Choices:  A: cupboard B: anywhere else C: everything D: own home E: garbage dump<n><n>### Response:		If John prefers glass over plastic, we can determine a rule to calculate where he wants to be based on the condition of the jar. The easiest way to determine is to eliminate choices that are false because then we can eliminate choices based on that.<n>Eliminating options A and B is easy because they are false. To eliminate E we can eliminate choice D because it is the only choice that involves glass. <n><n>A B E<n><n>1<n><n><n>If John wants to be somewhere else than with the plastic he wants to be in a place with glass.<n><n>#### 9<n><n>Answer: D or E, John wants to be in a home or at the garbage dump.<n><n>### Input :The man who invented the plow was named J. Smith. Mr. Smith died in 1877 and was buried under a large tombstone that reads, “J. Smith 1776-1877.” Which of the statements below is correct?  The year on this tombstone is most likely 1876, not 1877.  The year on this table stone is most likely 1776, not 7701877.<n><n>### Response :We are given the first statement that is true and the second statement is a false statement. We know that the year of 1877 on the tombstone is correct. Because the year is 1877 it means that 7701 is false. Which means that our answer should be (1)<n><n>#### 4<n><n>Answer: (1) The year on this tomb stone is 1876<n><n>### Instructions: A large company had 70 employees.  Ten employees chose to leave the company.  How many employees did the company have 5 years ago?<n><n>### Response A:<n>You will notice that the problem does not include the number of employees it started with. This means that it is not necessary to use a ratio.<n><n>In order to solve this, all they did in this situation was they took the difference between how many are left and how many were. Therefore, they took the difference of 70-10 = 60. Since we know that 10 are leaving, we know that the answer will be smaller.<n><n>#### 7<n><n>Answer: 60<n><n>###
