His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:To locate a choker not located in a jewelry box or boutique where would you go? Choices:  A: jewelry store B: neck C: jewlery box D: jewelry box E: boutique<n><n>### Response:		Answer the following question.<n>A: jewelry B: neck C: box D: box E: J
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The only baggage the woman checked was a drawstring bag, where was she heading with it? Choices:  A: garbage can B: military C: jewelry store D: safe E: airport<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Input : The only baggage the man checked was a duffel bag. where was he heading with it? Choice: A: garbage B: military C: Jewely store D: airport E: safe<n><n>### Response<n>D<n><n>### Input <n>How many dollars was the woman’s car loan?<n><n>### Response <n>$1000 1000 000<n><n>## <n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where do you put your grapes just before checking out? Choices:  A: mouth B: grocery cart C: super market D: fruit basket E: fruit market<n><n>### Response:		If you put them in your grocer’s basket for her then they will be on the fruit market<n><n>## Rationale:<n>A: mouth -> mouth is not the right response<n>B: grocery cart -> super market<n>C: super market -> fruit market<n>D: fruit basket -> fruit market<n>E: fruit market -> fruit market<n><n>## Demonstration<n><n>A: mouth is not the right answer; a mouth is a type of body part<n>B: groc­ery cart would take the grapes to the supermarket, where they are out of the fruit market, so we choose C - supermarket.<n>C; supermarket would take the grap­es to the fruit market, so it's incorrect.  So we would choose E - fruit market.<n>This can be summarized mathematically this way.  E is the best choice from the remaining choices.<n><n>### Input<n>How much does 25% of ____ cost?<n><n>If we chose A, then B = 100% of X.<n>If we chose C, then D = 150% of X.  (100% * 150% = 150%)<n>If we chose E, then F = 250% of X<n><n>We would eliminate A, and then choose <n><n>### Rationales

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: freeway B: radio C: wires D: computer network E: electrical circuit<n><n>### Response:		<n>A)Freeway - It's a road (it's just easier for some reason)<n><n>### Input (What kind of device would this involve?):A computer scientist at Hewlett-Packard has designed a new high-speed radio chip which is able to transmit data at a rate of 1,000,000 words per second, or 1 Gbps.  He intends to sell the chip to other companies that build computers.  What is the largest possible computer that could be created using the chip, provided the computer had a single 1 GB hard drive for data storage?<n><n>### Demrastion:<n>You can not use a single 1 GB drive alone or even if you used 1 million 1 gigabyte drives. So you can't say "You can not use..." or "So don't say..." or similar, it's always true and not false.<n><n>### Rationales:Given 10^7 Words/s, 1 Gbps, a single 1 GB disk, 100 seconds, and 60 sec/min.<n>Taking the time portion lets you use the single disk to a full extent:<n><n>0 (s) -> 536870912000 (Ws) - the 1GB drive is used every minute.<n>10 (s) ->  26843545600000 (W) for the 6 hours.<n>11-10 (s)   2684305760000 (w) for the extra 60s.<n>12-11 (s)   13421772800000 for the extra hour.<n>13-12 (s)     67108864000000 of words for the extra whole day. The limit will not be reached.<n>Total 61214087040000 (words) for the single hour.  This is not the maximum value.<n><n>If this is the maximum value, then this device is useless. 1342140300000 cannot be reached in a 1 day period if we use 1 GB disk once

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: write an essay B: organize thoughts C: speak information D: summarize main points E: have information<n><n>### Response:		<n>I have something in my mind that I need to share, some ways to do that are by<n><n>D:Summarizing main points<n><n><n>### Input<n><n>```<n>Both of these machines have the same number of steps required to solve, but you don’t have the same number of workers. To reach the goal of 100 steps, you’ll need to divide the number of steps taken by 5.<n><n>You have fewer workers and less time to reach the goal of 200 steps, what is the total time to complete these steps?<n><n>```<n>This is an example of a complex solution. You may not understand the steps, but as you read, you notice a logical progression of information. You know that if you need to do one to three things, the order is A, B, and C. If you have to do one to five things, the order is D, E, F, G, and H. So, which one is it here?<n><n>### Response<n><n>The order is B,E, F<n><n>```<n>Which of us has fewer workers to complete the steps?<n><n>```

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The president is the leader of what institution? Choices:  A: walmart B: white house C: country D: corporation E: government<n><n>### Response:		The most important choice to make in this question is to select either A or B. Next, you’ll need to consider the options. You could answer A, and in the rationales you can explain that the president is a leader of country. Alternatively, you could answer B. Given that only options A and B are realistic, the answer that will most likely be selected is A: White House and the rationales can explain that this is most likely an answer because the White House is a landmark in the US Capitol.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What kind of driving leads to accidents? Choices:  A: stressful B: dangerous C: fun D: illegal E: deadly<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>**The most likely kind of driving would be A: stressful**<n><n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: joining B: put together C: stitch D: heal E: paste<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Input:(N) {13}(L) {64}(K) {256}<n><n>### Response:(N) {64}(L) {67}(K) {26}<n><n>## 2017/3/16<n>#### 256 = 4^2<n>#### 67 = 12^1<n>#### 26 = 3^2<n><n>#### 259 = 6^1<n>#### 72 = 4^2*2<n>#### 27 = 5^2<n>#### 29 = 9^1<n><n>#### 308 = 6^2<n>#### 92 = 6^1*2<n>#### 30 = 10^1<n>#### 31 = 10^2<n><n>## 25/6<n><n>### 56=11^2<n><n>### 16=2^2*1<n><n>### A=3^2+3^2B=20^2<n><n>#### C=2*2^4<n><n>### 2*2=4<n><n>### D=11<n><n>#### 11^2=E=121<n><n>#### 20*3=F=60<n><n>#### 4*3=G=12<n><n>#### 14*2=H=28<n><n>#### 6*4*2=I=48<n><n>### 6*4*8=192*192=J=36*64<n><n>### K=2*2=4*2^2<n><n>## #python<n><n>#12*4*5=12*50<n><n>#12^2*4*2=64*16<n><n>#2^3*4*2*6=2*3*12*64<n><n>#4*6=40<n>#### 30=9^1<n>#### 14<n>#### 60<n>#### 70<n>#### 48<n>#### 32<n>#### 6<n>#### 24<n>### 251=2+3+3+3+1+1+1<n>#### 251=1

Choices:  A: owner B: foot C: subordinate D: base E: point<n><n>### Response:		Answer the following question.<n>  - What are all the solutions (choices) of the system of linear equations below?<n>  - 2x + 3y = -16<n>  - x - 2y = 11<n>-3,-1<n><n>### Solution:<n>There is a negative 1 solution. When you plug -1 back into it, it cancels out the -3, so that makes the two equal equations equal to zero.<n>For the first one, you have -4x+2y=-16 and  x -2y = 10. When you plug -4/2= <<4:-1=3>>-3 into -16, it equals 16-16=0 and 10-2y=10 and when you put 2/3=-1/3 =-1/3 into y, it equals one. So they both equal zero.<n><n>### Response1:What is the sum of the first 4 even numbers?<n><n>### Response2:The first three terms of the geometric progression (AP) are 4, 8, 16, Find the tenth term.<n><n>### Solution1:<n>4,8,15,25<n><n>### Solution2:<n>If we look at the geometric sequence, it’s 4,8,16, which equals 4X3=16 and then the next one is, 8*3=24, and then 16*3=48 and then 24*3=72 and then 48*3=144 and then 72*3=216 and then 144*3=432 and then 216*3=648 and then 432*3=1296 and then 648*3=2044 and then 1296*3=3892 and then 2044*3=6168 and 4128*3=12376<n>You subtract the first term from the 3rd, and then you subtract the first term from 4th. So you get 6168-4= 6164, then you subtract the first again, and then the fifth one, then

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What is required to be good at playing tennis? Choices:  A: tennis racket B: skill C: competition D: tennis court E: legs<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input :How many calories does it take to run a marathon? Choices: 400, 500, 600, 700, 1100<n><n>## Response : 600 or 1100 depending on whether you are starting with no weight or with your regular weight<n><n>## Input:What is the minimum amount of work it takes to lift an object? Choices: A- 250 watts B-25 watts C- 2500 watts D- 50 watts E- 5000 watts<n><n>## Response:A<n><n>## Input:How far is it from Chicago, IL to New Port Richey, FL?<n><n>## Response: From Chicago, IL to New York, NY<n>## Input:Tom has 400 apples everyday. How many apples does he have after 6 days?<n>## Response: 399 or 496 apples<n>## Input:If the distance traveled by a jet is 4,000 miles and the rate of fuel used is 5 miles per gallon, how much fuel is<n>consumed? Choices: A – 200 gallons B- 160 gallons C- 320 gallons D- 400 gallons E- 480 gallons<n><n>## Response:D<n>## Input:A train leaves San Diego, CA traveling 75 mph at 11:00am. At what time will it be 5 hours away from San Francisco?<n><n>## Response :500pm <n><n>## Input:If a man is on a farm and his wife is at home how far away from his farm are his wife? Choices: A - 1 mile B - 5 miles C - 100 miles D - 200 miles<n><n>## Response B = 100 miles<n>## Input:In what year was Christopher Columbus born? Choices: A: 1465 B: 1485 C:1453<n>## Response 1485<n>## Input:What kind of vegetable is this? Choices: A) carrot B) potato C) onion D) tomato

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. He was paid $25 per hour.  What was Jack’s pay, in dollars, for the work that he did last week?<n>Rationales Jack's pay for the week was his pay multiplied by the number of hours (25*10=250)<n>#### 250<n>Answer: 250<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>#### Input:<n>You work for Fashion Express.  Each quarter of 3 months you are paid a 25% bonus if you work extra hours.  All payroll taxes are withheld from your earnings.  How much, in dollars and cents, are you paid on the first day of January of the year after you finish your first year of employment, if you have completed 2000 and 3000 hours in your two years of employment?<n><n>#### Response:<n><n>#### 987.50<n>Answer: First month, 50$ bonus (25% of 2000*1.25)<n>Second month, 375$ bonus (112.50*3) <n>Third month, 266.25 bonus (108*$2.50)<n>Fourth month, 300$ bonus (125*$2.5)<n>Totaling up the bonuses you get a total of 987.85$<n>**Notice how we were able to add our numbers together and then round? The last one was a bit tricky I know. Next we'll get into addition, subtraction and multiplication with decimals!**<n><n>### Instructio:<n><n>#### Input<n>The bicycle, with a mass of $55.46, is resting on a tabletop. Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where would you find a bee gathering pollen? Choices:  A: united states B: sky C: court D: field of flowers E: orchard<n><n>### Response:		<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:John was punching and punching at the wall but succeeded only in bloodying his knuckles. This was bad.  He would be unable to hold his tools if he injured what? Choices:  A: hostility B: anger C: nose D: fists E: hands<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answers: B  Anonymous <n><n>Answer Comments: Punctuation marks can be placed after or before a sentence term or title, but the words are not capitalized (except for proper nouns). Here, 'Bonjour', the opening words of many French-language TV programs, is the title of the program. Other examples from the text include 'The End'. Except for proper nouns, sentence terms, or titles, there are no capital words. <n><n>The article, 'The' is capitalized in titles. For example, The Adventures of Tom Sawyer, The Hobbit, The Lion, The Witch, and The Wardrobe, The Da Vinci Code, The Great Gatsby, The God of Small Things, The Color Purple, and The Great Gatsby to name a few are all books with stories, characters and names that are all "The" titles. <n><n>### Input:(The)Bonjour!<n>### Demon: <n>It's best to put the apostrophe before 'The', but I don't. (Grammatical rules are not my forte.)<n>Therefore, the question mark and semicolon belong before 'The'. Otherwise, if you reverse the order of 'The' and 'Bonjour!' the question mark would go after 'bonjour' and the semicolon would go after the first '!'.<n>However, some editors write like this. <n><n>## How It Works<n><n>![](../images/logo.png)<n><n>![](../media/icon.png)<n><n><n><n><n><n>### Get in Touch<n><n>####  Instructors<n><n>| Name   | Email |<n>| ------ | ----- |<n>| Anony  | Anony@gmail.com   |<n><n>##### Contact Details:<n><n>| Name            | Email                                   | Mobile No.             |<n>| --------------- | -------------------------------------- | -------------------- |<n>| Dr. Ketan        | ketankumarpatel634@gmail.com          |   9413424571           |<n>| Dr. Rushikesh    | rushikeshpatel101@gmail.com            |      9461360721        |<n>| Mr

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where do you buy tickets at a ticket booth for games/ Choices:  A: train station B: cathedral C: metro station D: fairgrounds E: amusement park<n><n>### Response:		The amusement park<n><n>Response: The cathedral<n><n>Response: The fair ground<n><n>Response: The train station<n><n>Response: The ticket booth<n><n>The amusement park is a good choice but is not correct.<n>The cathedral might be a good choice if you are attending a musical performance.<n>The metro station is a good choice if you have just arrived and are looking for a means to travel to the event.<n>The train station is a good choice for international travel.<n>If you are looking to get to the game then the fairground is probably the best option.<n><n>Answer: The cathedral is not correct because it is a place of worship not a place to buy tickets for an event.<n>The metro is not correct because you probably don't want to travel there first.<n>The ticket booth is not correct because it might be a smaller box office compared to the one at the fairground<n>The train station is not correct because you don't want to go there first.<n>The amusement park might get you there first but the cathedral is probably the fastest route.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:If somebody likes temperatures cool, they might have more than one electric fan where? Choices:  A: home B: hardware store C: home D: hot room E: office<n><n>### Response:		<n>Option B<n><n>### Instructions:What does the car manufacturer Toyota make that's also found in the kitchen?  Choices:<n>A: an ironing machine    B: an automobile     C: a toaster    D: a hot dog steamer<n><n>### Input : It doesn’t matter what type of machine you turn a bolt on; as long as it fits, it’s the right screwdriver, right? True or False<n><n>### Rationales:   False<n><n>### Response : Incorrect<n><n>Input : Which direction does the screw head in the screwdriver? Choices:<n>A : it doesn’t matter    B: left C: right     D: Both A and B<n><n>### Rationale : A: it doesn’t matter<n><n>### Input  : A screwdriver has a handle, and then the screwdriver has the screws right?<n><n>### Rate:  True<n><n>### Response  : Incorrect<n><n>### Input   : Let a= 12 cm and b = 18 cm.  a + b = 20 cm.  What is the value of a and b?<n>b     = 2 cm<n><n>### Input     : It seems that the number 8 has many different values, right? Let a = 8.  a + a = 16.  What is the sum of a and a?<n>It’s impossible to add up 8 since the value is already 8.<n><n>### Input    : I heard a story.  A person who is walking on a beach found a bottle washed up on shore.  You know what the person thought?  The person thought, “What a beautiful bottle!  I must open it to see what is inside.” The person opened the bottle but saw nothing.  There were only a few grains of sand.  The person closed the bottle and threw it in the ocean.  A fairy was inside the bottle and wished the person was gone. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. I got it then because it was usually what? Choices:  A: buying B: purchase C: overpriced D: way to much E: expensive<n><n>### Response:		Choices:  A,B,E (C was not a choice)<n><n>The correct answer for this question is A.  The given question was:  The game was on sale. I got it then because __it was usually__ what?<n>The only option that fills in the blank correctly is “______________”. The word in parentheses is not correct. The word “because” is an auxiliary word that is required for a complete sentence. So it can’t be a word in itself that’s why only option A can be correct. <n><n>### Input :  Choices:  A  B,C,E (D was not one of the choices). Your friend is always telling jokes to you. Is this annoying?<n><n>Response: Choices:  C (B,D,E is not one of the choices in the given question.<n><n>Answer: The correct answer for this question, is the letter “C.” In the sentence “Your friend is always telling jokse to you,” and the option for “Is this annoying” is a yes or no question. Answer choices B, D and E all include wording that the friend is not always telling jokes and the response of “I don’t think so” or something similar is inappropriate to the given question and is not listed as an answer choice.<n><n><n><n>

Choices:  A: front of door B: bedroom C: desk D: table E: living room<n><n>### Response:		This question had a choice that was incorrect.<n><n>#### ##<n>Answer:<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>### Input<n><n>Sarah wanted to buy a new rug. Ink spilled onto<n><n>her old one. Really, she didn’t know what<n><n>that thing had an ink well in the first<n><n>place. What piece of furniture<n><n>might have been on her run. Choices: A<n><n>front of door B bedroom C desk D table<n><n>E living room<n><n>Rationales:<n><n>A and E: This is the right<n><n>answer. Sarah wanted to buy a rug to replace<n><n>the one that was ruined.<n><n>Choices A and E refer to front<n><n>door and living room. Both A and E have some<n><n>things in common.<n><n>Front door is always part of a<n><n>house. And living room is part of the house.<n><n>###### Answer Option A:<n><n>Answer: A<n><n>---<n><n>### Instruct:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Input<n><n>House rentals with 10 beds cost $50 per day. At what price per day, in cents, would<n><n>it cost more to rent 6 beds than to rent 7 beds? Choice A: $.80 B: $0<.80 $1.60><n><n>Choice: C: $2.00 D: $3.20<n><n>Rationales<n><n>10 cents/person/day for 6 ppl means that the cost/day is 6x$d=d6<n><n>for 7 ppl you get<n><n>225-22.2-222=225-20 means the cost is $22.50 per day/22.5=p/d<n><n>therefore 225/6 <80.08 <250/7 >1.6<n><n>## Answer<n><n>a<n><n>######<n><n>### Instuct: Answer the following multiple-choice questtion<n><n>### Input A:<n><n>A sales associate at a clothing store is paid $9 per hour and receives a 25-cent bonus for each article of clothing that a customer purch
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where are people likely to stand at an intersection? Choices:  A: cars B: city street C: street corner D: fork in road E: at a red light<n><n>### Response:		<n>Fork in the Road

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. He was a bit upset that he had to do it, but he needed the job.  Still, he would have preferred it if the job were what? Choices:  A: present B: stay here C: closer D: available E: come here<n><n>### Response:		 "A"<n>####  A<n>answer: A<n><n># Input:Betty and Bob moved to a smaller house. They are just being poor planners.  They should have hired  a good architect.  D: No.  It’s really just a garage.  E: No.  I’ve never lived anywhere that only had a one car garage.<n><n>### Response "E"<n># Rationale:I have lived in a small town.<n>#### E<n>Answer: E<n><n># Input:Anita is driving to her office at a speed of 60 mi/hr. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. What should NOT be true about their eye color?<n>- Each has one eye<n>- No one’s eye color is light<n>- At least two people are light eyed<n><n>#### C/B<n>Answer:<n>Marion's/fred's/Harry's eye color is light.<n>Because they are siblings.<n>So at least one member has light eyes.<n>So there must be one dark eyed and one light eyed member.<n><n>## Other resources<n><n>* Official homepage with links to training and demo videos<n>* A free open source training book<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What can go on a football field? Choices:  A: names B: words C: naval D: bladders E: feelings<n><n>### Response:		<n>C)  naval<n><n>### Input Choices:  A) yes B) no<n><n>### Rationales: A) No<n><n>### Input<n>The number that was given is x and 5x < 20.  It is going to go in order from bigger number to a smaller number and the answer will go the other direction.  We start with 5x to see what that number is.  We put 5x in for the next step.  Next we subtract 5 from x in order to get (20-5x) or (20-5) and we multiply that by -1.  We end up with x < 20.<n>#### 5x<20<n>Answer: 5x < 0<n><n><n>### Input choices:  A) 0 < 2 < 6 B) 0 < 4 < 10 C) 0 < 1 < 5 D) 3 < 2 < 7  E) 0 < 5 < 11 <n><n>### Response<n>C) 0 < 0 < 5 which means all the choices have numbers that are greater than zero.<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n>Determine whether the statement is true or false. Write your response in the box below.<n><n>### Statement:  The set of all real numbers under 5 is the empty set. <n><n>### Rationale:  The set of real numbers contains numbers both greater than 5 and less than 5 so the set doesn't contain any numbers that are equal to 5.<n><n>### Input : Is A a square? input 1) a 3x3 square answer: yes 2) A 2x2 square answer: no <n><n>### Input choice: A) yes B) false C)  Maybe<n><n>### Input Options: If it is a square 3x3 then put in: square<n><n>### Rationale: If it is more than a 2x2 square it isn't a perfect square so it is false. <n><n>## 10-20<n>Input:The hippy wanted all peace with all humans but he believed that they were all criminals. <n>Answer: A<n><n>Input: The hippy wanted all peace and order with all humans but the wanted them

He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What will telling many people about an embarrassing situation lead to? Choices:  A: notoriety B: emotional distress C: riot D: bad dreams E: annoyance<n><n>### Response:		Choice A - [Notoriety](https://www.google.com/search?q=notoriety&rlz=1C5CHFA_enUS847US847&oq=notoriety)<n><n>### Instructions: In the following problem, write a response that appropriately and accurately completes the request<n><n>#### A teacher plans to write 1 essay per week. If she writes a total of 32 essays each school year, how many should she write in each of 4 weeks?<n>Rational: 4 weeks x (2 weeks = 2 weeks) = 4 x 2=<<4 x 2=8>>8 total essays to be written per week<n><n>### Input and Output Examples<n><n>Input:  What will telling many people about  an embarrassing situation  lead to?  Choices:  A : notoriety  B : emotional distress.  C : riot.  D : bad dreams.  E : annoyance.<n><n>Output:  [Choic A - Notoriety](https://answers.scholia.org/10094101/notoriety), [Choic B - Emotional distress](https://answers2all.com/topic/whats-the-most-annoying-thing-you-have-heard-or-done-in-your-school-a58061952f65be55fd9ce5aad4c6bbfc)<n><n>Explanation: Choice A refers to [Notoriety](http://www.thefreedictionary.com/notoriety) and Choice B refers to [Emotional distress](http://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-stress-idUSKBN0I22ZT20151005).<n><n>Output: A total of 32 written essays per school year [Write](https://www.scribd.com/doc/229484814/Learn-How-To-Write-A-Essay#scribd) per week in each of 4 [weeks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Week).<n><n>#### Write for
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:James needed a garage because he spent a lot of money on what? Choices:  A: bike B: downtown C: building D: tool storage E: car<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>Input:James needs a garage because he spends a lot of money on his bikes!<n><n>Output:C<n><n>### Input : <n>I need a garage. So many bikes.<n><n>Output: <n>C<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Complete the sentence.<n><n>### Input<n>Complete the sentence: I need a garage.<n><n>### Output<n>Garages are for cars<n><n>### Demostration<n>- The answer to the sentence is C<n>- We start the sentence with : I....<n>- We use the word "and" to connect all the ideas of the sentence<n>- We have to make a complete sentence.<n>- "Garage is for my car"<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What emotion do people expressing themselves show when they trip in front of a crowd and break their leg? Choices:  A: communication B: suffering C: pain D: laughter E: embarrassment<n><n>### Response:		<n>Because they hurt their leg when they fell, they are going to be in pain when they get up and their emotions will express a state of suffering. It is similar to what happens when they receive bad news. I would respond with D: Laughter. <n><n>### Difficulty:<n>Easy<n><n>### Explanation:<n>I would say this because if you fell on a hard enough surface, then 3 things could happen;<n><n>A: You are not hurt and you will laugh.<n><n>B: You are hurt but it is not much and you will also laugh.<n><n>C: You are hurt really bad and you will cry.<n><n>D is the most fitting response here, in order to show the emotions are more of a state of depression and less of a state of physical pain.<n><n>### Rationale:<n>Because if you trip and fall, depending on how hard you fell, one of these 3 things could happen.<n><n>1) Fall onto hard surface: You will laugh because you are not hurt, you are laughing because you probably fell funny and not hurt.<n><n>2) Fall onto soft surface - Your hurt but not that badly so you will also laugh. You are laughing because you are in pain, but only a slight amount.<n><n>3) Fall on something hard - You will cry because you are hurting and you cry because your hurt and you probably hurt really badly. <n><n>## Challenge:<n>Choose which is the best response above.<n> <n>A. The car-rental company says, “We’re sorry. This car was supposed to be rented to a woman, not a man.” But the man says, “I am one who appreciates beauty. This car is beautiful, and I wanted it.”  <n> <n>B. The man says, “I do not want to rent this car. I don’t like it.” The car-rental agent says, “How can a man appreciate beauty if he doesn’t like this car?”

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What could a balalaika be needed for? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What is the worst outcome of an injury? Choices:  A: cause death B: cause bleeding C: falling down D: become infected E: claim insurance<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### D<n><n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: interesting B: fun C: joyful or painful D: very important E: free<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Input<n>How much would you change if someone does not like to learn<n><n>### Response<n><n>if someone does not like learning. they can enjoy learning.<n><n>### Challenge<n><n>Challenge: Can you write a script that checks if the input is "Answer the following multiple choice questions. or Challenge" and also write a response that completes the request with "This is a demo. This is not a challenge. This is not a demo. This may not be for you."<n><n>### Challenge Response<n><n>this is a demo. this is not a challenge. this is not a demo. this may not be for you<n><n>### Explanation<n>This is a demo. You can see below that I have done exactly what I asked to do by adding the comments and responses below. It is important to learn how to do this and get familiar with it.<n><n>Input: What do you do when someone does not want to learn something new?<n><n>Answer: I do not ask them if they want to learn. It is not something that can be forced on someone and when they don’t want something it is not going to create success. I may ask them if they are okay with learning and if they are having difficulty. Sometimes people have trouble just accepting that they do not know certain things. That learning can be exciting and not painful or free. They can also change my perception of the learning process if I change it on them. They could get distracted or get dejected and just say they are not learning. If I change my perspective on them, not change them on me then I can help people focus and not lose interest by changing my attitude. If you don’t like how the learning process is going then it can feel like it is painful as well. In the end it is the responsibility of the person to learn to change their perception and see the learning process to be what it can be instead of what they think it is.<n><n>### Input Challenge<n><n>Challenge<n><n>This is not a challenge.<n><n>This is not an exercise in trying to force information upon a person that will make them want to learn any less. It is simply an exercise to practice how to ask for information. Practice makes perfect and getting feedback will help the process.<n><n>This is a demo<n><n>This is a simple way to exercise your skills as a learner. You can learn to do things simply

He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The person was looking up airline and hotel prices, what was he looking to do? Choices:  A: control computer B: separate things C: go on vacation D: cross street E: go out<n><n>### Response:		<n>A:control computer<n><n>### Rationale:<n>Airline and hotel prices are things that are associated with each other<n><n>### Input 2:The person went to the library, what was he doing? Choices: A: find a book B: pay a fine Rationales: A: He was looking for a book<n><n>### Rationales:<n>The person needed help finding a book and the librarian is used for this<n><n>### Input The person needed to get a loan, what was he doing at the bank? Rationales: A. get a loan B. find an employee Rationales:<n>A. He was looking to get a loan B. He was looking to find an employee at the bank<n><n>### R. The person needs an ATM so they go to a bank, where is the ATM located? Rationales:<n>Answer: ATM is at the front bank. Rationales: The person is at a bank because they need an ATM located in a bank<n><n>### Input the people are buying an air filter, What are they doing? choices: A: buying the item B: using the item C: returning the item Rationales: <n>A. They are buying an item Rationales: Purchasing an item and using an item are both in the category of buying. Air filter is an item.<n><n>### R: A person needs to buy an item, where will they look Rationales: Answer: Stores. Rationales: Stores are a place to go to buy items.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The woman picked from an apple tree while surrounded by other trees, where was she? Choices:  A: illinois B: woods C: new york D: indiana E: farmer's market<n><n>### Response:		<n>1.<n>E- A farmer's market is a place where the produce is sold<n><n>### Answer:<n>E<n><n>### Input The apple pie has a sugar to crust ratio of 2:1. The recipe calls for 10 pounds of apples and 3 pounds of sugar, and makes 2 apple pies. How many apples are there per pie?  <n>1.<n>21/2= 10 apples to 1 pie<n><n>### Input A 600-foot ladder is not long enough to reach the roof of a 40 foot-tall building, but will it reach a rooftop that is 34 feet tall? Explain.<n><n>In this case the answer is no because its 34 feet taller than the 600 foot long ladder which makes the equation 600+34 =600 plus 34<n><n>### Input On February 14, 2016, three children (A, B, and C) go to a grocery store together. The store is open from 9:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. However, the store has to close early because the street is undergoing repairs (the street is being repaired from 4:00 P.m. to 6: 00 P.M.. What is the greatest number of minutes in an open interval between the opening of the store until 4:00 p.m. when the store must close?<n><n>Input: The store is open for: 9:00 am (Start) to 6:0<n>The street is being repaire fro 4-6 pm<n>1. The children spent 2 hours in the store<n>4pm-6pm = 2(hours) - (hours) = 4:00pm-8:00pm <n>The store closed at 4<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions, which require you to solve the equations in the parentheses<n><n>1. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What would children do if they are bored?
