Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where is a good place to get a ball? Choices:  A: kitchen B: child's hand C: street D: toy store E: soccer game<n><n>### Response:		D<n>#### #1:<n>### Response:C<n>#### #2:<n>### Response C<n>### Rationales:<n>#### #2: (continued)<n>### Response:E<n>#### #3:<n>### Response A<n>### Input:In a certain country, there is only one letter that will appear twice in every name written. Two letters appear three times each (but in different names), three letters appear only once...<n><n>### Task:  Which letter will the country chose as their nation letter?<n><n>### Response : A<n>#### #1: (continued from before)<n>### Response A:B<n><n>### Rationals:<n>#### #1: D and E: "and I will"<n>#### #1:  (continued from above)<n>#### #1: E: "on my death"<n>#### #1 (continued from top)<n>#### #1 C: "I will die"<n>#### #1 D: "I will not be"<n>#### #1 E: "I shall die"<n>#### #2 A: The 1st and 2nd letter appear in the same name and that can't be it because then it will never appear twice in any name.<n>#### #2 B: The 1 letter appears in no name.<n>#### #3 A: The answer must be the letter that appears twice in every name in this country and therefore, C must be it.<n>#### #4 D: What "two-and-a-half letter word" can be said with a different syllable placed in one of the letters? The answer must be a word made with some letters in it.<n>#### #5 B: The letter with 'y' in it only appears once.<n>#### #6(a)D: If we take the alphabet letters with 'y' and eliminate A, 'y' can only have a 'y' when there is a 'k' in the name.<n>#### #6 (b)C: The name that contains a 'k' and 'u' must be the answer.<n>#### #8 D: We only use names of people or places to test this out so if it's any other animal, it can't be it and 'K' gets eliminated.<n>#### #9 B: There is 4 of the name used in this riddle so at least

Give an example that illustrates your answer.<n><n><n>##Instructions:<n>A “abecedarian pattern” is a pattern that uses the <n>letters'a'-'z'in increasing order from left to right.  <n>Example of a “abecedarian Pattern” : " a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o

What is the perimeter?<n>#### Answer<n>The width of a square is equal to the perimeter.<n><n>### Question  <n>If two line segments are perpendicular, then one segment is greater in length than the other segment.<n>#### Answer: True<n><n>## Example:<n>When you walk 1 mile down Main Street, you only have to walk 1/2 mile back across Main Street to go a mile back. So walking 5 miles in any direction would walk you a total of 10 miles.<n><n><n>### Instuction <n>In the picture, the point T1 lies on the line ST. What is the length of the segment TS?<n><n>### Demostration <n>The length of ST and TS are the same<n><n>### Constructive Response  <n><n>There is length of 1 on the segment ST.  And then another length of 1 on segment TS. That would mean each segment is 1 unit long. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The whole family was playing cards, they were full of joy and what? Choices:  A: sadness B: happiness C: amusement D: losing money E: anger<n><n>### Response:		B: happiness<n><n>Input: The car insurance cost is $120.00.<n>The car repairs cost $200.00. Then, what is the total cost for her two-month car insurance and repairs?<n><n>Rationales: She had $25.00 left over for the repair.<n>25/120=<<25/12=20>>25 divided by $120 equals 2 and 20 left over for the repairs.<n><n>#### 20<n>Answer: 20<n><n>Input: One pound of cheese costs 10 dollars. How much will eight pounds of cheese cost?<n>Rationales:$10.00 is the base for the calculations and then the question is what if the whole amount is 8lbs multiply by $10.00 the solution will come as $80.00.  That is it.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The king was to meet an ambassador, where would the meet? Choices:  A: court B: dinning room C: throne room D: monarchy E: castle<n><n>### Response:		D<n>#### Answer<n><n>### Input<n><n>The farmer sells his carrots to the vegetable retailer for $3 per pound.  The vegetable retailer sells these carrots to the grocer for $5 per pound.  How much, in dollars would the farmer make on a 300 pound shipment?<n><n>### Output<n><n>The farmer will make $300.<n><n>### Explanation<n><n>#### Answer<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where does a person need to get when they have more kids? Choices:  A: compliments B: understand themselves C: life partner D: second chances E: larger house<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Instructions:  Answer the following multiple-choice questions.<n><n>### Input;What is the best way to learn? Choices:  a: By hearing b: By seeing c: By reading d: By discussing e: By writing<n><n>### Answer: b<n><n>### Instuctions:Answer the following true-false question.<n><n>## Answer: t<n><n>## Instrucciones:Contestar la siguiente pregunta verdadero o falso.<n><n>## Instruction:What is the best way of learning? Choices:  A: swim B: jog C: excercise D: work out E: rock climb<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Rationale:<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Question:<n><n>### Demos:<n><n>Input: A swimming pool is 6 feet long.  The width is one-third of its length, and the depth is 4 feet.  If the water level is 2 feet below the top of the pool, what is the surface area in square feet?<n><n>Answer: Square feet<n><n>Rationales:<n><n># 6<n># 1 foot #2 feet  #2. 6=<<2.6=1.4>>1.4# is the surface area.<n><n>There are 24 square feet in a square yard;<n>Therefore, 6 feet multiplied by 144 square inches/one foot 2 = <<6*144=921.6>>921.6 square yards.<n><n>Given: 921.6 sq. yards of surface area<n><n># 1/3  #4.6 feet #11.7 #11.7/4.6 ft=<<11.7/ 4.6 ft=2.5>>2.5 # is the required dimension in feet<n>#<n># We have<n>4.6+4.6+4  # 4.6 is 1 yard<n><n># 3.36 *4.6 #14.9 #14.9/4.6=<<14.9/ 4.6=3.0>>3 feet #is the required dimensions in inches<n><n><n>Input: If the cost of a package of paper clips is $1.25 and the amount of paper clips in a bundle is 375, what is the cost, in dollars, per pound?<n><n>Answer: cost in dollars per pound<n><n>Input: The cost of a package of drywall screws is $3.50. The amount of the package is 1000. What is the cost, in cents, of one drywall screw?<n><n>### solution:<n><n># 1000 pcs=10<n><n># 1.25<n><n>answer: $1.25<n>

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What are ai machines known for doing? Choices:  A: fly B: milk cows C: eat D: answering questions E: fail to work<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>ai machines are known for making food for us.They eat foods.We have to supply them with foods.<n><n>### Input:(15/25 of 30)÷5=<n><n>### Response:(15/20 of 30) divided by 5=<n>### Answer: (75/40) ÷ 5 = 0.05<n><n>### Input (5/25 of $3445.00)/5= 3 days<n><n>### Response (5/25*3445.62)/5= 17 days<n><n>### Solution: Answer: 5/25*1500/5=?<n><n>### Answer: 5/14*5<n><n>### Answer:(20/25)*100=$20.00/5=$4.00<n><n>## Input: A group of parents at a PTA meeting were discussing whether to add more staff members to their school.  In this scenario, there are five positions open for teachers in a grade school and they were considering hiring two teachers.  The average salary of a teacher in that school is $50,000.00.  They want to determine if they should fill two positions.  If they hire two new teachers, they will have hired 33% of the available teachers in that grade school.  What percentage of available teachers will they have hired if they only fill 1 position?<n><n>## Solution:<n><n>They hired 33.33% of the teachers.In math they are saying if we have 5 available spots and we hire 2 teachers that equates to 33.3 % and the extra 2 positions will make it 3/5 or 0.6.So if there are 5 teachers in that grade school they want to know if they will have hired any of the teachers if they only hire 2 of them.The % is 2/5 so they have hired the extra 2 positions.<n><n>### answer: 2/5
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:People are purposefully harming others, what trait are they exhibiting? Choices:  A: deceptive B: altruistic C: stupid D: cruel E: agressive<n><n>### Response:		 None of the other answers.  It is intentional and purposeful.  They must exhibit a trait that is harmful to others.

How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where would a ficus plant brighten up a room? Choices:  A: middle east B: palace C: dictionary D: pots E: apartment<n><n>### Response:		D The ficus plant needs indirect sunlight and is considered a house plant<n><n>### Input-D<n>### Response-D<n>The ficus plant is a house plant<n><n># The Instance<n><n>### Instructor:<n><n>Write the function `def is_even(n) { if (n % 2) return false; else return true; }` that returns `true` for an even divisor and `false` for a divisor that is not an even divisor.<n><n>### Student<n><n>### Student:<n><n>```python<n>def is_even(x):<n>    if x!= 0:<n>        return bool('x mod 2 == 0')<n>    else:<n>        return True<n>```<n>### Student: How did you do? [See the instruction](https://github.com/SethMerrill/exercise_instructions/blob/master/instructions_text.md#the-task)<n><n>### Markdown test instructions<n>### Instruct-D:<n><n>Write the following expression or formula for the area of the pentagon using area = (1/2)* perimeter.<n>#### The task<n><n>### Instru-D:<n><n>Define the function `def f(x, y) { if (x === y) return y; else return x; }`.<n><n>### Student-D:<n><n>If I wanted to take out the variable I would use two brackets to do this.<n><n>```python<n><n>def f_func(x=0, y=0):<n>    if (x == y)<n>        return y;<n>    return x<n>```<n><n>What does `return y;`do?<n><n>#### The task<n>### Instruct:D<n><n>Which expression has the largest value? `(10*b) − (50/a)` or `(10/a) − (50*b)`<n><n>### Inst-D:<n><n>The expression `10*b−50 ⁄ a` has the largest value since `(10*b−(50⁄a)) − −50⁄a == 10*b−100⁄a`<n><n>### Student:-D<n>### Student:How did you do? [see the instruction](https://inst.grammarly.com/
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The other passengers on the bus were quite loud, so he put on his headphones to relax and what? Choices:  A: go to bed B: sleep C: listen to music D: stretch out E: stop worrying<n><n>### Response:		I believe it is E, because it is pretty much implied if you are sleeping you wont be listening to music. Also, stretching out is kind of out of the context here. He doesn't have space to stretch out.<n><n>#### Example:<n><n>```python<n>import random<n>import math<n><n>def generate_answer():<n>    ans = "e"<n>    return(ans)<n>generate_answer()<n>## Output: "e"<n><n>```<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. The first 5 days cost $97.50, the sixth day cost $172.50, and the feventh day cost $100". Explain how to solve this.<n>### Response:First you would solve the sixth day in the order of:  $97.5(one-fifth of $97.5), $172.6(one-fifth), you would get: $175(rounded)<n>Then you multiply the $195(given answer) times $175= $347.5(given answer).<n>Therefore you would answer $347.<n><n>### Input:'Two people are being punished for their crimes' Explain the structure below on how to complete this prompt(make sure to explain not copy/paste answer, please do the work yourself.<n>### Response:'Two men are charged with the same crime' or 'Birds have been spotted by two different people'<n>### Input:What is the value of the expression 8+[3*(4*9)]? What is the expression value after changing 3* into 3 times?<n>### Response:Answer: 8+[3*(4*9)] would be 8+[3(4*9)] after you changed over the * to a times you would subtract the brackets and parentheses 8+[(3*9)4] would be 8+284.<n><n>### Discussion<n><n>### Homework

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Her tenant, John, tells her, “I have 3 suitcases to move.”  His tenant, Betty, answers, “You can move that for $28.”  The woman replies, “No, I only charge $18.”  The woman asks John, “How much would it cost to move 5 suitcases?”  John replies, “You can move 5 suitcases for $48.” The woman says, “I’ve also got a flat-bed truck.”  How much will it be to move the 5 suitcases with the flat-bed truck?<n>Rationales 28+18=<<28+18>>46<n>The woman wants to rent to her tenant for $46 and has a flatbed truck it would be 5*28=<<5*28>=140>>140<n>5*28+140=<<5*46+140>>286<n>The total would be 5*140+140=28*286>>286<n>Total of 780<n>#### 780<n>Answer: 780<n>### Instructional Materials<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:A common saying, Sam thought, was to go forth, also this. Choices:  A: reverse B: backwards C: back and D: back and E: tally back<n><n>### Response:		<n>C<n><n>### Input<n>Sam is weighing 2 large hogs and the scale will only allow up to 1200 lbs. and 1350 lbs. one has 1150 lbs. and one 1110 lbs. but if they're on the left and one weighs 475 lbs. 1105+475=<<1105+242>>242. What's the best way to weigh both of them?<n><n>### Response<n>A<n><n>### InputA train departs a station traveling at 50 mph towards the train yard. The length of this train is 520  ft. with 100 trains in a string of trains in order to park all of them correctly in the train yard. The train yard needs to be 1 mile long  to hold all of the trains and the trains should be parked every 110 ft. apart.  When will the train be able to get onto the train yard?<n><n>### Demos : the train will take it's distance = 520/50 = <<520/55=10>>10 miles. The entire train is 10 miles. So in each 520 ft it travelled 520/10 = <<525>>525 ft. And so in 520ft it covered 520/2= <<520/2)=260>>260 ft.<n><n>### Rationales<n>This is a little odd, but the train is just traveling the distance between stations, and getting closer to the train yard, each time it makes a stop.<n><n>So it will arrive once it goes the long distance back and forth.<n><n>So since 130/55=<<130/50=2>>2 trips it will take, it will arrive at the train yard = 520*(50+2)=<<520*(55+2)=110>>110<n><n>So just the one station it will take 110/50 =<<110/55=4>>4 trips.<n><n>Or 260/50=<<26

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:A shower is an expected amenity when you reserve a what? The  Gold  card   will pay  15%    off    if I spend over $300 per month, but I only get 0.6% off other purchases when I have no purchases during a month. The Silver is in the middle between the Platinum and  Gold  card. It would pay me 5%    off    my  purchase    if I purchase more than $175 per month. Otherwise, I get 0.6%. Each month, there are two months where I have $500 in purchases or more. The next twelve months, I have ten months with more than   $300 in purchases and four months where I spend less than $175. During the other two months, I purchase $175 or less, and I have $0 for these last two months. If I want to save $365 per year, which credit card should I get so that I get the smallest bill each month?]<n><n>### Response<n><n><n>Input:<n>> The store wants me to buy  a bookstore credit card<n>> There are three types of   cards    <n>> - Platinum, Gold, Silver<n>> Platinum card    <n>>   10%    off    if spend more than $550    <n>>   0.6%    off    other purchases    <n>> <n>> Gold card    <n>>   4%    off    if spent more than $300    <n>>   1.6%            other purchases    <n><n><n>### Demostration:<n><n><n>## Answer<n>In order to solve this, we would need to add the percentage and use the PEM notation.<n><n><n><n><n><n>###Input:What is the area of the circle in square miles? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:They wanted to eat at home but the cupboards were barren, so they had to go what? Choices:  A: cook dinner B: eat C: go back to work D: make food E: get food<n><n>### Response:		<n>> **Choice:** Choice [E] Get food is the correct answer here.<n><n><n>```
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What would you do if you have curiosity about something but cannot leave your house? Choices:  A: hear testimony B: go somewhere C: see exhibits D: outdoor concert E: surf net<n><n>### Response:		E: the surf net<n><n>We go to places we can’t or don’t want to go through surf net. It provides lots of information on many different things with no restrictions.<n><n>### Inputs:The amount of water needed to produce one gallon of milk is 10-11.5 lb. Find the units.<n><n>### Rationales:First, convert 31,00 gallons 500,20 gallons of water to 500,66/12 tons: ((500,22/12)*(13lbs/ton)/10lbs/ gal= >>500,82 tons<<500,8 tons<n><n>### Question:  By how much is the amount of water needed to create/1 gallon/of 500,500/31000 gal water greater than the amount required to create/1 ton/of the water 5,000/10,000?<n><n>### Answer:It is 1110<n>#### 1110

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: drop out of school B: ask questions C: enter school D: wash dishes E: read book<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>[1,5]<n>```<n><n>### Input(optional):<n>What could have been a chore for a child to do after breakfast before getting on the bus in the story 'There Once Was a Dog Named Trixie'? Choices:  Ask questions  Enter school  Was able to attend school  Did well in school  Wrote about her school  Washed dishes  Didn't get on the bus<n><n>### Response (optional):<n>```<n>Enter School<n>```<n><n>## What Is the Word for 10 + 10 + 7 + 2, and 5?<n>You’re given four different numbers: 10 10 7 and 2 5<n><n>1.   Add one 10 (10 to the left) and one 10 (ten to the right)<n>2.   Add one 7 to the two 10s<n>3.   Add one 2 to the 10 and 7<n>4.   Add one 5 to the 2<n><n>Ask children to put the numbers in order from smallest to largest.<n><n>[10, 10, 7, 2, 5]<n><n>*The sum of the digits is 10275.*<n>*10 = 2* *5 = 1*<n>*7 = 3+2*<n>*<n><n>## How to Read a Pattern<n>A common type of word problem in the CCSS is one that uses patterns.<n><n>Let's look at some examples:<n><n>*Three people go door-to-door to sell fruit. How much fruit they each sell will depend on how many people visit each house and whether or not they sell more than one type of fruit.*<n>*Amy has money in her wallet. She gives a dollar to her younger sister and $2.37 to her friend. How much money is in her wallet?*<n><n>## Word Problems and Sequences<n>[![Sequences](img/sequences_word_problems.jpg)](img/sequences_patterns.jpg)<n>

A. Radius 5 is midway between the center (located at the origin) and the edge. B. Distance from the center is half the radius (the same as distance across the circle). C. The area of the circle is pi(radius)^2. D. The perimeter of the circle is pi.<n><n>### Response C<n><n>### Reference:https://www.algebra-class.com/examples/algebra-example-2000/solve-equation-2x-6-3-x-12.html<n><n>### Instructions: Choose a number between 1 and 6 that is NOT contained in the set {1,2,3,4,5}.<n><n>### Instuctions: Answer the question.<n><n>## What should be the next letter in the series: E, M, C, F, D, T,?<n><n>### Answer: W<n><n>### Reference-https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZB8uL0WlKqM&ab_channel=CrackTheQuestion<n><n>### Instracution: Choose a number from the answer group below that does not equal 49.<n><n>### Answer Choice: 872<n><n>### Instractions: Solve the problem.<n><n>### Reference https://www.algebra-factoring.com/algebra-examples/solve-equation/9-26x-100-solve-equation-x.html#:~:text=Solution%3A%20x%2026%C2%AC100%3D9%26%C3%B7x%20%C2%8F23<n><n>###Instructions: Choose the letter of the alphabet that comes next in this sequence: R S O P A T.<n><n>###References https://byjus.com/maths/the-the-algebraic-sequence-r-s-o-p-a-t-is/<n><n>###Instracutions:Solve the expression: 100 - 
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The farmer chose plants he could make bird feed from and use of again the next year, he only planted what? Choices:  A: raise corn B: seed plants C: grow plants D: seed crops E: farm land<n><n>### Response:		I would have to go with seed plants<n>### Rationales: Well that is the first choice that makes sense to me<n><n>### Input<n>### Output:<n>### Rational:<n>Which one<n><n>### Rational<n><n>In the beginning of the chapter the book gave a scenario about a guy that decided to buy a bike so he rode his bike to a bike shop and rented one. Later on in the chapter it was stated that the bike shop was offering a discount on the price of renting the bike at the end of the rental, the guy didn't want to wait until the end and ride his bike home. He instead decided to buy the bike but since he didn't have his own bike he didn't know anything about prices of bikes so he decided to ask the owner.<n>#### 135<n><n>Answer: 135<n>### Rationals<n><n>In this scenario we have to find out how much the bike rental was for how many days and the answer would be $135. 50 was the price for one day and 5 is the amount of days so to multiply these we would get 50x5 = 250 then add fifty so the answer would be 300 and since we are asked for dollar we subtract $100 to get $200 and since half of 200 is 100 this is how we got to the answer of 135.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:If you're betting with a shark, where are you likely playing? Choices:  A: aquarium B: mediterranean sea C: south pacific D: pool hall E: pacific ocean<n><n>### Response:		B)<n><n>### Input:[Click here to reveal the correct answer.]In 1897, the government of India announced the Indian Head cent. That year, 5,348,681 pennies were made at the Philadelphia mint. Thereafter, production continued at this rate until 1909, reaching a total of 1,033,600,000 pennies over those 12 years. If we assume the pennies were made in equal years, what year was the 1,000,006,333,345th cent made?<n>Ans:(Answer in years)<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:He was looking for the holiday decorations and found an old box of clothes up where? Choices:  A: attic B: trash C: loft D: closet E: box<n><n>### Response:		<n>1) A<n><n>### Input Choices<n>2) D<n><n>### Rationales<n>3) I would say a or C<n><n>### Input<n>What is an object? Choices:  D: none of these F: man-made G: an object that you can see H: all of these I: natural<n><n>### Response<n>1) G<n>2) I<n>3) A<n><n>Input: 173,169,295,213,119,241,117<n>The largest number is:<n><n>### Response <n>241<n><n>### Rationale:<n>213 is smaller than 119 and 295, so 241 might be the largest.<n><n>#### Input: There were 284 men and 89 women at the company picnic last year. How many men were there for every woman?<n><n>#### Response <n>3: A man to every 1 female<n><n>#### Rationale<n>Women = 89<n>Men = 284<n>Female to male ratio is 89 to 284<n>1 female is equivalent to how many males?<n><n>3:1 3 women to 1 male<n><n>### Input <n>Two children, A, B, started at two points in a park to return home from park in the same route they came in but A had to catch 3 buses to home while B took 6 buses. They arrived home the same time. After how many minutes?<n><n>#### Response<n>10<n>B caught 20 buses<n>A caught 3 buses<n><n>#### Rationale: A took 2 buses and B took 10 buses<n><n><n>Input: The shirts are on sale for 25% off: $35.00 and the jacket was $72.00: _____________ equals more?<n>#### Response <n>$35.00 is more because the shirt is on sale,  the total purchase is $107.00<n><n>#### Rationale The shirt is on sale for 223.00% of its original price. If the original price of the shirt was 30 and it was on sale for 27% then it would cost 3

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:HOw do you carry potatos home? How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where in a town would you put your shed? Choices:  A: next to the house B: keeping things in C: backyard D: farm yard E: ranch<n><n>### Response:		In choice B

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where in your entrance hall can you keep you head wear? Output the result <n>> cur_avg <- ave(curdate[,1],<n>>  curdate[,2],<n>>  function(x) <n>>   { median(x) })<n>> # 3.  Function:<n><n>> # 3a.  Calculate a percentile <n>> cur_percent <- quantile(y_df[,5],<n>> 0.30)<n>> # 3b.  Output the result<n><n>> cur_percent_df <- mutate(x_df,<n>>       cur_percent_df=<n>>  cur_percent_df+<n>>  cur_date_num*cur_percent_df)<n>

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Danny was having fun singing in front of his class.   He has a lot of what? Choices:  A: laughter B: being happy C: glee D: opera E: injuries<n><n>### Response:		A  3 marks<n><n>### Rationales:A 2 marks<n><n>Danny was happy and laughing while singing in front of the class. <n><n>### Input:'When would we need to divide and how would I know that I need to divide?'<n><n>### Demostration:"Divide if you have a group of numbers (such as a list of numbers) that you want to split into two more 'groups'.<n><n>"Example:-How many boys and girls are in the class"<n>####Answer: "Divide if you have<n>'When would we need to multiply and how would I know to multiply'<n>"Multiply if you have a number you are multiplying another number by.<n><n>"Example:-What is 5,004 times 2?<n><n>####Answer: "Multiply if you are multiplying two numbers together for example-<n><n>"Example:-7,888 x 17<n><n>### Instructions:Write a response that appropriately complete the request, below<n><n>### Demaration:"To multiply, look at the problem and see what the product needs to end up."<n><n>### Instuctions:A question asks, 'What do you think happened?' You may respond with a complete sentence.<n><n>### If you think what you had read was true, write A.<n>If you think what you had rea<n>### If you want to be cautious about making a decision, write C.<n>If you think you aren't sure, write C.<n>You will only lose marks if you disagree with the answer I gave you last time.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Changing society using a violent conflict is know as a what? Choices:  A: action B: demonstration C: understanding D: vote E: revolution<n><n>### Response:		<n>For demonstrations to be effective in changing society, people need to be better informed about an issue or problem.<n><n>#### E<n><n>### Response Type:Paraphrase<n>

What is the sum of the first six terms of this series? A) 1,262 B) 1,000<n>C) 1,128 D) 999 E) 624<n><n>### Rationals:The first term is 100The second term is 62<n>The progression is increasing by 22 every term<n>The sixth part would be 568<n>Adding the first five together we get: 100+ 62+62+62 +62 = 374 and adding the sixth it comes to 646<n>We know the third term is always 22 more than the first term<n>So we will continue on the third term:646-22-22 = 606The second term was 62 which means the third would be: 374-22-2<n>Now add all the steps together and we get 1000<n>#### **1,000**<n>Answer: 1,00<n><n>##### **Input: An egg carton has two circles in it. If you have 6 eggs and place them into the carton how many egg-shaped spaces will they fill?**<n>#### **Answers:** 1) 6 2)4 3) 7 4

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:John is getting something important.  What does this make him feel? Choices:  A: then have B: headaches C: stoic D: being happy E: wanting more<n><n>### Response:		John is A: then B: headaches C will feel D:  being happy E: will want more<n><n>### Instructions:A dog is chasing a cat, in a straight line, when the cat is 12 ft. in front of the dog.  How far, in feet, will a person who began to walk toward the cat at a rate of 5 feet per second have to go before she will reach the cat?<n><n>### Instructors:  Show that you are willing to learn and apply your knowledge on the problem. For your own benefit, try to understand the steps you are taking to solve the problem.<n><n>### Answer:There are two basic principles: 1) Distance = Rate*Time(D=Rt) 2) Change = Rate*Time*Change(C=Rt*t)<n><n>### Given:<n>1. The dog and cat in a straight line.<n>2. The dog will catch the cat sooner if the change of the walking speed is  greater <n>3. The dog will be 12 feet behind or ahead of the cat<n><n>### Let p=Distance between the dog and cat<n><n>### <n>####Distance = rate x time<n>p=Rate x time<n>Rt=rate<n>Time=t<n><n>####Rate = D = 5/t<n>Since the Rate was given to be 5/t<n>substituting the rate into Distance formula  Distance = 5/t x t, which becomes Distance = 5x t<n><n>####Change = Rate x Time* Change<n>Ans=Rt*t*Change    C=Rt*t*(B)<n>Ans= (5x t) x t * B   C=(5x t)(t) * B<n>Ans=(5x t) (1) * B   C= (5)(1) * B = 5*B<n><n>### Here is how the steps are applied<n><n>1) Given a dog and cat<n>2) Initial the two are traveling in a straight line, thus, at the same distance<n>3) When the dog is 12 feet ahead of the dog, there is the 12 feet difference between the two<n>4) To calculate the distance, you simply multiply the rate with time to get the distance.<n><n>5) To calculate change, you

What is the probability of rain falling on any day during March? A. 64% B. 44%<n><n>### Answer<n><n>#### 64%<n><n><n><n>## #2: Multiple Choice Questions<n><n>```markdown<n>### Multiple Choice Questions <n><n>### Demos<n><n>#### <n>```<n><n>### Instuctons<n><b>Answer:D</b><br/><br /><n>The probability of rain is dependent on month. August has a 60% probability of rain compared to March's 40% probability of rain. There is a 40% probability that it will rain during March.<br /><br /><n><n>####<n><n>```markdown <n> ### Instructions<n> ### Input: Input the answer. Answer in one sentence. <n><n>### InputAnswer: <n><n>### Answers:<n><n>#### <n>*
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:He had an index card he had to return, so where did he put it after finding the book he needed? Choices:  A: inside the book B: oral report C: library D: fileing cabnet E: card catalogue<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Input#1:The hurricane is reaching 300 miles per hour.<n>### Response#1:<n>### Input#2:The car-rental ageny charges $30/dollar for a car or 190 for the week.<n>### Response #2:<n>-If it was 190 for 1 week for more than 7 days, that doesn't make sence.<n>-There was 11 days total it took for rental<n>-190, that's for 7 days.<n>### Input # 3:<n>### Response # 3:

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:John is a human who is in a wheelchair due to an accident. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. I didn't want to look at a grocery store, so I chose D.<n><n>Since you are looking for buildings that will have an office, a skyscraper is likely to be there.<n>#### A:<n>Answer: C<n><n>#### B:<n>Answer: A<n><n>#### C:<n>Answer: B<n><n>#### D:<n>Answer: E<n><n>#### E:<n>Answer: D<n><n>## Rubric<n>#### Score: 0/4<n><n>0 pts: Response is wrong or incomprehensible.<n><n>1.5 pts: Response identifies the first correct data point.<n><n>3 pts: Response identifying 2-3 correct data points.<n><n>4.5 pts:Response correctly identifies all appropriate data points, but does not provide complete explanations for each data point.<n><n>6 pts: Response correctly identifies all appropriate  data points, and provides correct reasoning explaining each data point.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:He would finally see idea become reality, never in a million years did he what that this would happen? Choices:  A: think B: patent C: determined D: work hard E: relax<n><n>### Response:		B<n>Rationales:A= not patent<n>B= patent<n>C= work<n>D=determined<n>E= relax<n>#### B<n> Answer: 02<n><n>### Input<n>Dale decided to go on a vacation cruise.  He found a cruise package being offered by a travel agency for $70 per person per day, and he signed up for 12 days.  The cruise line charged $25 per person per day. After the trip Dale was charged by the travel agency for four additional days on a per-person basis.  How much did Dale pay for the original trip and for the additional four days?<n>#### $70 x 12=:$$70 x 11=840$$<n>#### #840<n>Answer: $840
