Thus resulting in an emotionally unstable child because one or both parents can’t take care of the child.<n><n>### Input<n>The next two questions refer to the same scenario.<n>The 20 head of sheep have to be moved over 355 miles, at a rate of 20 miles per hour (using the same trucks to transport everyone, in other words, each round trip requires the same trip time.) The wolf pack begins pursuing them after 4 days into this move. The plan you develop has 100% of the sheep moved before the wolf pack is expected to arrive. What is the minimum number of separate trips needed to meet this plan?<n>In both of these questions, assume that any wolf sightings during the move are due to luck, not due to any knowledge by those involved of the wolfpack’s movements during this time.<n>Rationales: One of the trucks can bring 20 sheep at a time so the minimum number of trips is going to be the floor of ceiling of sheep times 1/20 or 10.<n>Therefore 20 trips from 0 to 100.<n>Since the first truck could take 10/20 = <<10/20=½>>½ from 0 to 5 the second truck would take another 5 and the third truck would take another<n>5 trips.<n>Therefore 100 / <<100/<<100/½>>½>><<100/====><<100/4>>4<n><n>Answer: 10 trips<n><n>### Input The next two questions refer to this scenario. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:James is very interested in other planets.  He loved the idea of going to mars, and reads books about it all the time.   He dreams of being on what? Choices:  A: love B: zoo C: school D: space shuttle E: library<n><n>### Response:		He wants to go to the library because there are books about every planet and they can take him to places in space.<n><n>### Input:(Fill in the blank)______ is an example of a monogram. I saw one on our classroom wall. The letters are made up in this special way. First is the first initial, then is the first & last initial, then is last initial. Choices:   A: the word dog B: M.C. D: John C E: Jack S D: The word classroom<n><n>### Response:(Fill in the blank).  Is an example of a monogam.  I saw on ours wall.  The lettres are mad up in this special way (blank).  Firs is the first initial, thend is the first and last initial, then is (blank).  (Choices:  the word dog   the word jackson M.C.  John C.  E.J)<n><n>#### M.C.<n>Answer: Monogram

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:James was looking for a place to buy bitcoins. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: rural area B: big city C: suburbs D: ohio E: countryside<n><n>### Response:		<n>For any village to be able to exist, there must be a certain level of support for the people and trade. Larger villages tend to be more self sufficient because they can provide for the necessities of trade (Food, Warmth, Water, etc.) and for their people. Larger villages would thus be more likely to be located in the countryside.<n><n>### Input<n>You decide that you want to invest $200 to $210 in the stock market.<n><n>### Response<n>I would invest $200 in the stock market because that money would allow me to make a profit of $50-$60, depending if the stock goes down by around 7% or goes down by at least -18%. If the stock went down by 7%, the money value would be less since the stock went down, resulting in the profit being less as well. Since 200-50=$150 and 200-60=$140.<n><n>### Multiple Choice Question:<n>What will be the total value after a week on the market, assuming the stock always goes up a percentage of the purchase price, but never go down more than a percentage as well?<n><n>A) $788.84 B) $914.16 C) $803.48 D) $810.20<n><n>### Answer:<n>The value on the market of the stock is going to be somewhere between $788.4 and $810.8 after one week.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>This scenario can be viewed as a way to increase your financial portfolio, or increase your purchasing power in the market.<n><n>## Input:<n>The first week on the market, the stock will rise between a 6% - 7%<n>The following week on the market, it will rise another 6% - 9% (15% - 18%)<n><n>Increasing the percentage rate on the market every time the stock is on the market for a week might increase the value of the investment.<n><n>For example, after the second week (Week 2), it should be worth:<n><n>$200 + 15% of $200 = _________ = ________________   = $230<n><n>and a week
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Shane was supposed to speak at his fathers funeral.  He was a clown, and acted very ridiculous.  This cheerfulness turned off people who expected the funeral to be what? Choices:  A: solemn B: compete C: serious D: somber E: straightforward<n><n>### Response:		3<n><n>**Input: What is the next digit of this sequence? 1, 7, 4, _, 64, 61, 50, ___ **<n>Rationales:<n><n>**Sequence: 1, 7, 4, 23, 12, 64 **<n><n>**Next Value: 57.45 -> 61**<n><n>**Input: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, _, 12, _ 13 **<n>Rationales : <n><n>**Sequence: ** _, _, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, _, 12, _ **<n><n>**Next Values: _, _, 5**<n><n>### Input/ Output:<n>Input: If you make a 35 hour trip at 60 miles an hour, how long it will take?<n>Rationales : Make 1800/35= <<1800/477=4>>4 trips (1 day = 24 hours = 1 day 50 minutes) for a total of 1000 minutes each trip to equal 4000 minutes<n>In 1 day/60 = << 1 day/6 = 1/3 hours/60 = <<1/2=1/2>>1/2<n>So it will take 1000/<<1000/3>>3 = <<1000/4>>4 days<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>Input-Output: <n>Input: The next digit of this sequence is what? 1, 8, 6, _, 9, 16, _ 5.<n>-Rationales:<n>-Sequence: 6, _, 8, 9, 12, 16, 22<n>Next Value - 5<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: There are 564 steps from the lobby of a high-rise to the fire-escape landing. It takes the firemen 31 minutes to reach the top from the landing. How long from the lobby does it take for the firemen to reach the top after they started down the steps?<n>Rationales :-
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:When a monkey is taken away from their home they are often brought to this place where people wear white coats. Choices:  A: rain forest B: research laboratory C: cage D: treetops E: south africa<n><n>### Response:		You can either choose A, B, or C.<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: suface of moon B: building C: bridge D: ground E: bright light<n><n>### Response:		FACEBOOK<n><n>### Input 2:<n>Input:  How much money will you pay for the items listed, if you are buying 3 items only? What is the total cost<n><n>Input 1: Item 1: $25.00 Item 2: $12.50 Item 3: $5.00<n><n>Input 2: Item 1: 3 Item 2: 3 Item 3: 3<n><n>### Response 2:<n><n>\$\begin{aligned}<n>$25\$\,\dot{+}\,3\times \$\begin{aligned} $$12.50\$\,\dot{+=}\,\$37.50 \\ $$\text{$5\$}\,\dot{=}\,\$15 \end{aligned}<n>$$\text{$5 \approx 15 \leq \text\$.<n>$$<n><n>### Input-3:<n>Input: <n><n>Car rental agency A charges $30/ day for the first day of a rental, and then $8/day per additional day.<n>Car rental agancy B charges $8/day for the first day, $6/day for each additional day, up to a maximum of $50.<n>How much will it cost to rent a car for 6 days?<n><n>### Response-3:<n><n>Let A= $30$<n><n>Let B= $8$<n><n>Let C= $6$<n><n>Let D=$50$<n><n>$$P[C]=\frac{1}{3}$$<n><n>$$P[A]=\frac{2}{3}$$<n>$$P[B]=\frac{3}{4}$$<n> $$P[A\mid B]=\frac{2P[A]P[B]}{P[A]+P[B]}=\frac{\frac{2}{3} \frac{\frac{5}{2}}{1}}{\frac{2}{3}+\frac{5}{2}}=\frac{25}{ 22}=\frac{42/4}{22}=\frac{21}{11}=\frac{5/6}\frac{22}{6}=\frac{5/13}$$<n><n><n><n>$$\text 5/13*=\frac{5}{13}\$ \leq \$ \frac{5}{

How did he do so? Choices:  A: hiding B: accidentally C: expectation D: knowingly E: planned<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input: George ruined the surprise.<n><n>Explanation: "ruined the surprise" can mean either intentionally or not. If intended, "expectation" is correct, but if not, "deliberately" is correct. However, if expected intentionally or not, both "deliberately and "intentionally" are correct.<n><n>#### "deliberately":<n><n>#### "intentionally":<n><n>#### "unexpectedly":<n><n>#### "indirectly":<n><n>#### Rationale:<n><n>### Input-Exercise:George ruined it. The surprise.<n><n>### Response-Exercise:<n>Which answer will fill in for "The" in the sentence "The "surprise"" to satisfy the grammaticality rules described in above.<n>15% of the people chose "unexpectedly",  60% chose "indirectly".<n><n>#### "surprise":<n><n>Answer: "unexpectedly".<n><n>Input: We ate a lot more vegetables that night. I think I felt that I was supposed to. What will give the answer true?<n><n>Choice A:I think I felt that I wasn’t supposed to.<n>Choice B:I think I felt I was supposed to.<n><n>Choice C:I think I felt.<n><n>Choice D:I never thought that I wasn’t.<n><n>Answer: Option D (I never thought that I ____).<n><n>The other option only fill the blank with an infinitive, which doesn't explain all possible choices. It only gives 2 options.<n>

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where do fish spend the majority of their time? Choices:  A: body of water B: lake superior C: underwater D: toilet E: aquarium<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Rationales:Option B: 36.68% <n>Option C: 0.69%<n>Option D: 0.01%<n>Rounding: 2 decimals to the nearest hundredth<n>0.6937 >.68 >.67 >.61 >.01 >.00<n>50 *.005 =.0025 for fish spend the majority of there time in lake superior <n>$0.0025 * 12 = $0.03 for fish spend the majority in lake superior<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input :<n>The average human body temperature is 98.6˚ F. If a temperature of 100.0˚ F<n>is considered a fever, what is the ratio of the average human body temperature<n>to a temperature of a fever?<n>Answer: 0.0357142857142%<n>Answer method; Convert 3.714% to percent;<n>Divide the temperature of a fever and the average normal temperature;<n>$100.0$/154.0 = $0.065870$<n>$100$ % of $154.0$ = $0.006587$<n>$1.00$\% of $154$ = $1.54$<n>\$\frac{\$3.714\%}{\$0.006}$<n>$0.03714$ \% of $65.8$ <n>\$0.0356$ % of 150.0<n><n>\$\frac{\textit{0.0354\%}\mathrm{(\textit{0.00})}}{\textit{66.5\%\mathrm{(\textit{1.})}}\textit{50}}$<n>$0.0178$ % of 100<n><n>\$0.177$ % of 1\$<n><n>### Reponse : 0.177
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:She a deep love for all her friends, every Friday she had an open invitation for them as she loved to host and what? Choices:  A: learn about subject B: learn new C: find truth D: is bliss E: judge<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Instructor:<n>The correct response is C.<n><n>### Discussion:<n>What does ignorance mean in the context? Is knowledge necessary? What role does curiosity play? If they are ignorant what does that mean? <n><n>### Rationale:<n>Ignorance is the state of being uneducated, unaware, or unknowledgeable.<n>Knowledge is defined as facts, information, and skills acquired through experiences and education.<n><n>Ignorance is not an excuse because ignorance does not mean naive or stupid. It means the inability to answer a question, explain something, or resolve a problem.<n>People can make a conscious decision not to know something. They could choose that they do not need to know, so they don’t act on their desire to know.<n><n>Curiosity is key to the progress of the human species, but ignorance is not bliss. As a society we are faced with ever more complex, interconnected problems to solve. We live in communities and rely on public-serving institutions like schools and healthcare. Ignorance creates a barrier for us to reach solutions for these challenges.<n><n>### Assumption:<n>While I can understand that people do feel bliss, ignorance does not mean happiness, and I will take some time to discuss the difference between ignorance and bliss.<n>Ignorance is knowledge of a problem with a choice to let the problem go and live in bliss. Bliss is an emotional state that is produced within the human body. <n><n>### Output:<n>Ignorance: Ignorance would be someone who did not know the answer to the question and was not even educated with the knowledge to find the answer. They do not know how to fix the problem and therefore the problem exists and could continue to exist.<n><n>Bliss: Bliss would be the state of not knowing that their is a problem and having no reason to know that there is a problem. Their body chemistry is producing happiness, which is a great state to be in.<n><n>While ignorance is a problem, bliss is not and does not mean it is not a problem. <n><n><n><n><n><!-- # Rationale: <n><n>There were 17 questions on the exam. Choices:  A: disengenious B: human C: weird D: kind E: stupid<n><n>### Response:		The correct choices might be B,C.<n><n>### Input<n>A number is chosen and then, starting from this chosen number, a sequence of positive integers is found, in which each number is 1 less than the immediately preceding number. What is the least positive number (between 1 and 100) that satisfies this property?<n><n>### Rationales<n>The number is 1 and the sequence of positive integers is 2,3,4,...,<n><n>Because each number is 1 more than the immediately preceding number, the sequence is a factorial series!<n><n>Factorials in simple terms are any integer product of integers (in this case only between 1 and 1), starting from the integer chosen and counting up by 1 until the chosen integer is reached.<n><n>The largest factorial, meaning the number of all choices or products, of a number is the number itself.<n><n>So there are only 1 choices which is 1 which is between 1 and 999999.<n><n>#### 1<n>Answer: 1<n><n>### InputYou and your parents wish to purchase flowers once every 3 weeks for a total of 7 weeks for the summer.  If you were to purchase each week 5 more of one kind of flowers than the previous week, which kinds of flowers would cost the least per week? Choices:  a: rose b: tulip c: hydrangea d: hyacinth e: daisy<n><n>### Rationale<n><n>The first week would have 1 of the kind of flower because the first week is the week of flowers.  2, 3, 3, 2, 1, 2.<n><n>The second week would have 3 of the kind of flower again because the second week is again another week after the first week<n>2, 3,,, 3, 1.<n><n>The third week would have 3 more of the kind of flower as well, since it is another week after all of the flowers of the week before<n>2, 3+3,,, 1+3<n><n>The fourth week would have 1 more of the kind of flowers then the third week since it is another week to the 4th week.<n>2, 3(+3),,, 1(+3)<n><n>The fifth week would have 2 more of the kind of
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The teachers needed to get their classrooms ready for the school year.  What is one thing they might do? Choices:  A: talk too much B: teach children C: open boxes D: answering questions E: giving homework<n><n>### Response:		<n>If you look at the choices you can understand that there is something wrong with this question so you will have to rewrite it.<n><n>##### You have to ask your teacher to give you the question once again or you can ask someone else close to you who knows english.<n><n>### Input;<n>The first five terms of an arithmetic sequence are 3, 7, 10, 13, 16. Which term is<n>the sixteenth?<n><n>###### Rationales:(You have to solve it again)<n><n>##### You can solve for an arithmetic sequence. (An arithmetic sequence is simply a sequence where each term is a value plus the preceding term.)<n>A 12 and 24 are the first two terms. Then you add 24 to get 36. Then you subtract 24 from that until you get to the term of the sequence.<n><n>###### Answer:<n><n>### Input<n>The first five terms in the arithmetic sequence in are 3, 9, 15, 21, 27.  Which term is the seventeenth?<n><n>### Response<n><n>###### Ratiuane<n><n>##### You will have to do:<n><n>(First 5 terms)<n><n>(15+9)-2(3) = (11)-6 = <<(11)-6=5>>5<n><n>(11-5)+3(9) = (>>(11-5)=8>>8)+3*9 = 8+27 = <<8+27=35>>35<n><n>(35+15) - 6*3 = (>> ((35 + 15)) - 6*3 == 50 - 18 = 32)<n><n>### Input The price of a new computer is $499.00.  On sale it sells for $300.15. How much of a discount did the buyer receive?<n><n>###Response <n><n>###Input:<n>An eighth grade student studied 1,000 pages for his science fair project. Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. If you need help on Python you can refer to the links below.<n><n>#Links:<n>https://www.python.org/<n>https://pythontips.com/python-loop-statement-python-examples-loop-while-print-if-break-continue-for-loop/<n>https://pypy.org/<n><n>#Task#<n><n>"""Write a class named "Guitar" which contains the attributes and methods below."""<n><n>### Class : Guitar<n><n>Definitions<n>:   -------------<n><n>### InstagramAccount<n><n><code><n><n>        def __init__(self, **kwargs):<n>            """Class Guitar Initialization<n>            Required Parameters: guitar_name, guitar_brand<n>            """<n>            self.guitar_name = kwargs.get("guitar_name")<n>            self.guitars_name_list = []<n>            self.guits_name = []<n>        def guitar_name(self):<n>            return self.guitar_Name<n>        def guitar_brand(self):<n>            self.guiter_brand = []<n>        def guiter_brand_list(self,**kwargs):<n>            self.get_guitar_brand(**kwargs)<n>        def get_guitar_brand_by_name(self,guitar_name):<n>            for i in range(len(self.guitar_name)):<n>                if self.guitar_brand[i] == guitar_name:<n>                    return self.guitar<n>            return "No guitar of that name in my guitar. Please submit a new one"<n>        def get_giter_brand_by_id(self,guitarid):<n>            return self." guitar_name".find(guitarid)<n><n>#Task2:<n><n><n>### Instuction:<n>    Below are a few tasks with some hint/help. Answer the questions by writing a response that reflects this information.<n><n>### The bride and bridesmaids each took the bus, leaving the church at 6:30 p.m.<n><n>Rationales:<n>Each bridesmaid took the bus, and there were 6 bridesmaids.<n>How many bridesmaids took the bus?<n>There were 6 bridesmai; thus, 6 took the bus.<n>### The groom and the best man each took the train home.<n>Rationales: <n>The groom and best man each took the bus, and the bride and brides maids each took the bus.<n>There were two cars in the wedding party,<n>how many others took the bus?<n>So,<n>There were two cars and there were 6 people.<n>There were two more people.<n>Thus, the bride and two other people took the bus. <n>Thus, 6 brides maid and the bride took the bus.<n><n>### Answers:<n><n>1) Six brides maids and the bride took 2 cars.<n><n>2.  So we are left with 4 bridesmaids. <n><n>3. So 4 bridesmaid took 2 cars. <n><n>4.  So 2 bridesmaids are left. <n><n>5.  So 2 more bridesmaids took 2 cars. So we are left with the Bride and best man. The rest took buses leaving 6-2=<<6-2=4>>4 bridesmaids and the bride, leaving 2 cars. But the best man and the groom took only one car, leaving 1 car.<n><n>6) 2 bridesmaid and best man both took 1 car.  <n><n>7) 1 bridesmaid and groom both took 1 car<n><n>8) Groom and 1 bridesmaiden both took the train <n>  <n>9) Bride and 2 bridesmaide and groom take the bus.<n><n>10

A: a<n>2. B: a<n>3. C: a<n>4, D: a<n>5. A: a<n>6. B: b<n>7. C: c<n>8. D: d<n>9, E: e<n>10. A: b<n>11. B: c<n>12. C: d<n>13. D: e<n>14. A: a<n>15, B: a<n><n>___<n><n>©2018 UTA
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The shark was migrating between continents, where did biologists find it? Choices:  A: fresh water B: gulf of mexico C: open ocean D: television program E: coral reef<n><n>### Response:		 A<n><n>Input: The shark migrates. How many days per year?<n>Rationales The shark migrates yearly, but the season depends on where you live.<n>The shark migrates in the Caribbean during the summer.<n>The shark migrators in the pacific in the Winter.<n>The shark comes in April.<n>The shark is active for all 12 months of the year.<n>#### 12<n>Answer: 12<n><n>###Input:<n>A bird flies between two different nesting locations. During migration each nesting location is an equal distance from the other, so it takes the same amount of time to get between each. The bird flies at a constant speed.  If the bird migrates from Point A to Point B during the migration season, what is the percentage of time it spends flying?<n><n>###Response:<n>There are 365 days in the year.  If a bird migrates there are 365*3=<<365*3>900days for 50% of the days.There are 900days/365=118days for 50%.<n>####58%<n>Answer: 58%<n><n>###Input:(The shark)<n>How far did the shark travel, in kilometers, over a 75-mile period?<n><n>###Input:=<n>The shark traveled for 75 km. That was $5.75 an hour. It was $114 for 9 miles<n>####$41.75<n>Answer: 41.75
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What does one chop us a grape for? Choices:  A: fresh fruit B: wine press C: fruit basket D: fruit cocktail E: picnic basket<n><n>### Response:		Choice “C”<n><n><n>### Input<n>What did one chop us a goat for? Choices: A: fresh goat B: wine press C : fruit basket D: fruitcocktail E: stew<n><n>### Rationale: C <n><n>### Response<n>### Input:How many feet are there in a mile? Choices:  Choice A: 5,280 feet Choice B: 5,279 feet Choice C: 5,250 feet Choice D: 5,230 feet Choice E: 5,200 feet<n><n>### Rationales:<n>D. 5200-5230=10 feet-5200=<<-100-5200;100-5>>5 feet<n><n>### Response B<n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days. Where might he spend most of his time today? Choices:  A: university B: college class C: class room D: classroom E: library<n><n>### Response:		D<n>### Instruction<n><n>The correct answer is letter D<n><n>> **Explanation:**<n>The choices listed are all locations in a school or academic environment. However, it is likely that a student working on a report during class would not be sitting in a classroom when he is focusing on the project. Hence, the answer letter is D.<n><n>### Explanation<n><n>The correct answer of "D" is chosen.<n><n>**Explanation:** James was a student who had to get a report done for his English class. The location where he would be working on his paper all day is a guess and is not stated.<n><n>However, it could be assumed that when a student is working on a report in class they are doing so in the classroom (and not in a classroom location), so we choose D as an answer choice.<n><n>**Correct answer:** D<n><n>**Not a correct answer:** A, B, C, E<n><n>#### 80<n>Answer: D<n><n>### Input A group of 1200 students are staying at a hotel for the next 20 days during a conference.  They have booked the entire lower floor.  In addition, they will use 7 restaraunts, the lobby, & the auditorium 5 hours/day.How many hours will the hotel use for the next 21 days?<n><n>### Solution:<n>This is a trick question that uses restaraunt incorrectly used twice and also auditorium which is incorrect spelled & not the correct term but auditorium means the same<n><n>####6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>### Answer to Instructions:<n>The correct answer is choice ____.<n><n>A. 50<n>B. 55<n>C. 100<n>D. 53<n>E. 300<n><n>## Explanation:<n><n>The right answer is B.<n><n>If the student has an overall GPA of 50, then with a point increase of 50%, the student's GPA moves up to 80% and that will be what is on his/her transcript.<n><n>**Correction:** The answer should be B<n><n>**Not a Correct Answer:** A, C, E<n>\<n>#### 150<n>Answer:

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Utensils are used during what evening activity? Choices:  A: backpack B: closet C: drawer D: dinner E: cupboard<n><n>### Response:		<n>E<n><n>### Input<n>A man wants to buy a suit.  He wants to select the one that he likes best.  He goes to three different tailors and tries on each of three suit.  The first tailor shows a suit that has a collar that stands up six inches.  The second tailor shows a suit which has a collar that will rise six and one-half inches.  The third tailor shows a collar that will push up six and one-quarter inches.  The first man says that he likes the second (or the third) suit the best.  Which collar is taller?<n><n>Rationales:<n>First, the man wanted the top collar to have six inches then the man went to the next collar with six and one half inches so the height went up<n>Next, the man went to the third tailor and asked if the suit had a higher collar and this one had six and one quarter inches.  Since the previous collar in the previous tailor shop was six and one half inches we can deduce that the top collar from the previous tailor shop went up six and one half inches.  Since the second tailor had the biggest collar of all three tailors and the man said he liked it the best we know that he saw the top collar from this one the best so we can deduce that this collar went up six and one quarter inches to make the highest collar of all three.  In this situation 6.25 is greater than 6.5 so therefore the top collar from tailor three is the tallest collar.<n><n>#### 39<n>Answer: 6.25<n><n><n><n>RATIONAL 2<n><n>### Input/Output<n>Input: The total number of ounces in 2 pounds of flour is?<n>Rationales: There is 16 ounces per pound<n>2 times 16=<<2*16=32>>32 ounces of flour in 2 pounds<n><n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: How many weeks will be in six months?<n>Rationales<n>We know that there are 52 weeks in one year so we get 6/52=<<6/52=1/9>>1/9 of one year so there will be six months

Choices:  A: friendship B: aggression C: defeat D: winning or losing E: sweat<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### E<n><n>### Input 2:A 175-pound man and a 150-pound woman are each carrying 5-pound cargo, and each wants to go hiking for 5 hours along a trail.  In addition to his own 175 pounds, the man is carrying his wifes 100-pound cargo; on the other hand, he is carrying his wifefor 50 pounds.  The woman is also carrying her 50-pound cargo and her 100-0un son.  When the couple meets up after their hike, the man weighs 190 pounds while the woman weighs 225 pounds, for a net gain total of 80 pounds. If there are 10 pounds for every person carrying luggage, how many pounds of cargo were on the hike?<n><n>### Response 2:<n>#### 2410<n><n>#### Choices: A) 9; B) 10; C) 14; D) 24; E) 25<n><n>### Input3:  At a large sports stadium, five 5-row sections are each 10 rows deep, for a total of 15 sections per level.  On an average day, the stadium charges $9.00 for each seat in the front row, $7.50 for each seat in a middle row, and $6.00 for each back-to-back seat.  Assume that each row of seats holds the same number of seats.  What is the cost, in dollars, to sit down to watch the game in the $9.00 first row of section 1?<n><n>### Rationales: The first, or front row, is level 1.  Of seats in the first row of section 3.<n>Of seats in the first row, the front row of section 1.<n>Each row is equal to so that the 5 rows, or the front row, is 5*6.00=<<5*6.0=[[$30]]>>30.<n><n>#### $30<n><n>### Answer:  $30<n><n><n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What type of water transportation is human powered? Choices:  A: turn away B: let down C: have to sleep D: run E: row boat<n><n>### Response:		<n>Turn away<n><n>### Rational:<n>We have to turn the boat away from land for it to be water transportation that is human powered.<n><n>### Input:(a) A tire dealer charges $12 per tire for mounting and balancing tires and a flat fee of $5 for mounting and balanced four or fewer tires. How much, in total, does she charge if she mounts and balances 4 tires? (b) How well does the formula in answer (a) predict the amount charged in part (b)?<n><n>### Rationale:<n>Here’s an example of how you solve a problem by writing out an equation, using that to generate an estimate, and then comparing your actual and predicted value.<n><n>The dealer charges $13 per tire:<n>($12 + $5) * 4 = $13 * 4 = $52.<n>So the sum is $52; the formula is off by $1.

How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What do customers do in a store? Choices:  A: hunt B: pay merchants with money C: mail orders D: spend money E: demand satisfaction<n><n>### Response:		(Response is provided when needed). <n><n>### Multiple-Choice Question: Which of the following strategies are better for students to use to solve a word problem that requires the addition and subtraction of fractions? Choices:  I: first find the least common multiple of the denominators in order to solve I-2.2: by cross-multiplying, I-2.3: by finding a common denominator between all of the denominators In order to solve I-3.2: by using the GCF, I-3.3: by converting the improper fractions into mixed fractions  I-4.1: by multiplying the denominators together, and I-4.2: by changing the problem into an addition problem<n><n>### Rationales: Answer choices A, C, E, and G are incorrect in this scenario.<n><n>(1) The students should not use C because converting to a mixed number, and regrouping the numbers and operations would not affect the end result when you are multiplying and dividing fractions.<n><n>(2) The students should not the answer choice A because multiplying a fraction by a number is not the same as multiplying fractions.<n><n>1) Cross-multiplying:  (pq)(rs) = prqs<n><n>2) Adding:  (pq + rq + st)s =<n><n>3-6 Fraction Conversions:<n><n>(1) Convert to a mixed number: 5 7/12 = 5 5/12<n><n>(2) Change the problem into an addition operation: 5+7/12 + 5+7/8 =<n><n>(3) Make the product into a mixed number: 3+1/3 + 9/9 =<n><n>(a) A rationales:  Change the problem into an multiplication problem by adding the fractions:  12x(1/2)+65x(1/4)=<n><n>(4) Change the problem into addition: (3x(6/5)+6x(1/5))+=(3x(2+5))+(6x(0+5))=<n><n>### Multiple Choice Rationales:<n><n>Answer Choices D and F are incorrect in this scenario because when a student is asked to calculate the area of an irregular shape he/she should use the
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What is a fast but expensive way to send small cargo? Choices:  A: airplane B: ship's hold C: boat D: truck E: train<n><n>### Response:		 C – Boat<n><n>### Demopstration: <n><n>### Input How expensive is it to take a bus to the state capitol? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:If I need deodorant, where do I go to but some? Choices:  A: medicine cabinet B: medicine chest C: armpits D: grocery store E: kitchen<n><n>### Response:		Choice B<n>### Input: The answer is C.<n><n>### Response<n>Input:What is 650 divided by 75? Choice: A: 8.64 B: 864 C: 86,400 D: 864,000 E: 8,640<n><n>### Response B is the answer.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Who sits at the center table at a receeption? Choices:  A: restorand B: wedding party C: church basement D: corridor E: restaurant<n><n>### Response:		D and E are incorrect because you would be at a receptin you would be in the restaurant.<n><n>### Response Example 1:<n>A, since the question is about a reception<n><n>### Response 2:<n>A, so it would have to be a wedding party<n><n>### Question:Which city is farther from Seattle: Boston or Philadelphia?<n><n>### Response a: Boston<n><n>### Question 2: The second half is harder, which was the hardest half?<n><n>### Responses:<n>A: 41<n><n>### Conclusion:<n>A: it was the 62-69 since that was the hardest half<n><n><n>### Demostration Answer<n><n>Input: Which city is farther from Seattle?: Bostin or Philadelphia?<n>Options: A: Boston Boston to Seattle is 323 miles.<n> Philadelphia to Seattle is 2355 miles. So  Philadelphia is the farther.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What is KFC who serves chicken? Choices:  A: fast food restaurant B: plate C: bowl D: freezer E: oven<n><n>### Response:		KFC is fast food restaurant.<n><n>### Input<n><n>Which of the following is a mathematical property that cannot change?<n><n>A. A + 3 = A<n><n>B. -2 -1 = -2<n><n>C. 7.6 = 7.6<n><n>D. 9*3 = 9<n><n>### A: Answers that are true to mathematical laws and principles.<n><n>### B: Answers that are false to mathematical laws and principles, violating axioms, or making false extrapolations and assumptions.<n><n>### C: Answers that require explanations that go beyond the mathematical principles used in the question.

Being sad or down means a person might not feel well enough to sleep.  But being content is more likely to result in a good night's sleep.<n><n><n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days. Choices:  A: waterfalls B: underwater C: beach D: surface of earth E: river<n><n>### Response:		<n>Rationale:<n>1/4 of Earth’s surface is covered by ocean – which is D.<n><n>### Input<n>I went to the ATM the other day and was surprised to see that the machine doesn’t take my debit card. They only take credit cards or checks.  I asked the attendant at the teller station and she explained to me that it’s because not everyone has an account at the bank and it is too expensive to buy and maintain equipment to allow all non-account holders to access their accounts using a debit card at the bank’s ATM machine.  Which of the following is the best way to represent the bank’s reasoning?<n>Choices:<n>A: Not everyone at bank has debit card B: ATM is expensive to maintain for non-account holders C: The bank does not want to lose money D: The bank only wants to loan money<n><n>### Response<n><n>I went to the bank the other day and noticed that they only want to loan money.<n>It was the only answer option that said the bank only wants to loan (C) money.<n><n>###Input: <n>It costs $3,956 to produce 120 units of product P.  It costs $2,914 to produce 125 units of Product Q.  The two products have the same demand and selling prices, but the profit margin on Product P is greater than that of Product Q. What is the profit margin in dollars per unit on Product P?<n><n>###Choice: <n>A: $-756 B: $256 C: $-100 D: $216 E: $-343<n><n>###Response:<n>It costs $3956 to make 120 P and is $2944 to make Q at 125.<n>So the profit margin is  $(2,914-3956)/2914 > 125 < $(2944-3957)/3955 > 120  < $(2946-3954)/3953 > (3523/2954) < 125<n>$216 is a profit margin<n>Answer option B is correct<n><n>###Input<n><n>I went to my local gas station

Choices:  A: conference B: theater C: building D: floor E: church<n><n>### Response:		Answer C<n><n>### Rationales:<n>You go to the location that have more than one floor. If it is multiple floors, the correct answer will be conference.   If it only has one floor, then it will be theatre or church. If it only is one room, then choice D is the right answer. You want to buy the conference because you are expecting a crowd to attend the event. You also want a lot of chairs to sit in, which is why a theater is ideal and there is only so many chairs you can have in one floor.<n><n>### Input:(A) At the office of the state governor, the assistant secretary of state would have $500,000 in annual salary plus annual expense of $25,000. What is the minimum amount the secretary of state’s annual salary could be without going over the $500, 000 cap?<n><n>### Response:(C) $175,000<n><n>## Input:(B) 1)The state-maximum salary is $750,000. 2) If the state-maximum salaries were increased from the 1998 maximum of $350,00 to the present maximum of $750, 00, then the annual expenses for each office would increase from $350, 0 to $500,, then the annual expenses would be 1-500,, to 6-00, 0 and the annual expenses would increase from $2,500 to $4,000.<n><n>## Response: (A) 350,0<n><n>## Input:Gamboling mice have a 50% probability of being killed by cats during a 90- minute period, regardless of what the mice do. The overall survival probability of a gamboling mouse is 64%.  A female mouse will have on average 5.25 kittens.  What is the probability that the kittens all die during the 90- minute interval?<n><n>## Response:B<n><n>## Input:(A) a. The probability that the kitties only one kitten is 1-1/5.25 = 1/5.2.<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The keys were black and white, what were they attached to? Choices:  A: front pocket B: cabinet C: purse D: chain E: piano<n><n>### Response:		I would need more information or details to answer this question.<n><n>##|<n><n>

A<n><n>### Rationales:A:  It will tire you out.<n><n>### Input:(Choose the correct answer)A nurse is preparing a drug for patient. She is about to mix 72 milliliters of this drug. This drug is to be given to three patients. How much drug will each patient receive?<n><n>### Answer:<n>1.72/3 =72/3 =24<n><n>### Ratiates:<n>A:<n>72/3 = (72/3) * 1/3 = 72/3 * 1/3<n>72/3 *1/3 = 24/1 = 24<n><n>B:<n>38.4/3 = 38.4/1 = 38.3<n><n>C:<n>24/3 = 45/1 = 2 = 24/3<n><n>D:<n>72/9 =72/3<n><n>E:<n>33.3/3 = 33.3/1<n><n>Input:(Choose one answer)After the basketball game, there are four basketballs left. At least, how many balls can be used at once?<n><n>### Ranges:<n>A: 4*4 = 16<n><n>B: 3*4 = 12<n><n>Fixation:<n><n>### Input :A doctor has to give a drug once every second day to 4 patients. How many such drugs must be given?<n><n>### Aptitude:<n>A:  3 * 2 * 4 = 24<n>### Ranges <n><n>A:<n><n>4*2 = 2*4<n><n>3*4 = 3*2<n><n>(4)*2 = 4*2<n><n>3*4= 3*2<n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.
