Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:The police man was waving flares, what did he do with the impatient car? Choices:  A: book robber B: he had a word with the driver. C: believe guilty D: direct traffic E: wave on<n><n>### Response:		The police man was directing traffic. In this scenario, he would have been waving the flares from behind the cars. He would not have had a word with anyone. He would not have believed anyone of them guilty. He would not have booked anyone.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What does a judge do when someone is convicted of a crime? Choices:  A: conduct trial B: arrest C: bring in verdict D: pass sentence E: serve justice<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Input : What is the difference between a lawyer and a judgeship?.Choices: A: judges do not hold a qualification to represent someone in court B: judges are barristers and can argue someone’s case in court C: judges are not qualified to represent someone who has a case in court and must appoint someone to represent them D: judges can represent anyone that wishes to represent a person who is on trial in court <n><n>### Response : B<n><n>### Input What is the relationship between a witness and the court?.Choices: A. a witness is part of the judicial system B: witnesses are not part of the judicial syste, they are an essential, C: witnesses are not apart of the judial syster D: witnesses are part of the judical system<n><n>### Response A<n><n>![](https://jacobs21.github.io/T21B-700.assets/T21B_700/T21B25_700-5.png)<n><n>![](https:/jacobs21githubio/T21-B700.assetsT21B24_700.png)<n><n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What would humans do when their legs are tired? Choices:  A: sit down B: make mistakes C: have sex D: reproduce E: excrete<n><n>### Response:		If they were using their legs to get somewhere else, we'd expect them to sit down, or if they don't have somewhere else to go they would make a mistake. Also, because humans can't excrete at will, they can't eliminate wastes. If their legs were tired from running they would either sit down, or would be forced to make mistakes. The question seems a bit vague, so we don't know whether or not the leg fatigue was caused from running or not. <n><n>### Input-How many times would you walk one day? <n><n>### Response-Human average walking speed is around 3 to 4.5 mph, according to experts (http://www.webmd.com/fitness-exercise/walking/features/walking-speed), which means a person with a short walk takes 2 to 2.5 hours to walk one-mile. A person who is not using a walker averages 1.2 miles/hour, and they take about one hour to walk one-mile, according to a US Census Bureau (http://www2.census.gov/programs-surveys/acs/datasets/2006-2010/summary_file/2010/2010_US/2010-05-04-2010-DRG-ZS832_001.xls). This means that if you walk 5,000 feet, you would walk for 4 to 5 hours in a day. I think that five hours of walking would be a normal amount but could be difficult if your legs are especially tired, because in general people tend to walk more if their legs are not tired.<n>

Choices:  A: picnic basket B: wine press C: juice D: fruit cocktail E: kitchen<n><n>### Response:		Choice: B, wine press.<n><n>### Why is your answer not the correct answer?<n>#### D: Wine press, Wine presses can be used to produce rack wine. The process is known as "mashing out" and typically takes no more than a day, but can continue for a few days. Grapes are crushed in this method and the juice is poured into a clean, sterilized container. After this step, grapes, especially Zinfandel grapes, can be put back on the trellis for picking at a later time. With this method, the grapes remain grapes and are kept fresh, unlike in rack wine production, where the process turns all the grapes into juice.<n><n>### Input:(2.4)(24)2.424 What is the product?<n><n>### Response:(16)(42)416<n><n>### Question: Do you understand the correct answer?

The first safe is painted bright yellow and is valued at $50,000. The second safe is painted orange and is worth $30,000, and the third safe is painted red and is worth $15,000. A group of criminals has broken into the jewelry store and has identified the location of each safe.  It knows the first safe is the one painted bright yellow and is worth $50,0<n>The second safe is orange and is worth $<n>And the third safe is red and is worth $<n>What is the minimum amount of time in seconds that the criminals could spend inside the safe?<n>Rationales;<n>They would take all the safes because they have already identified the red safe is the one worth $15,<n>And now the group has no reason to leave, since they have already identified where all the safes are and can go in and out of as many times as they want.<n>#### 120325744<n>Answer: 32574320<n><n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where would you read a passage but not write it? Choices:  A: diary B: city C: bible D: graffiti E: labyrinth<n><n>### Response:		The Bible and the Graffiti<n><n>### Input :If you have 10 marbles and you get 4 more marbles how many marbles do you have in all?<n><n>### Response :14<n><n>### Input<n>If you buy three 6 packs of soda, two are $7.00 each, and the third is $9.00 each, how much does a 6 pack cost?<n>### Response<n>The price of a large drink is (100/4) $25<n>### Answer: (100/3) $33<n><n>### Input <n><n>### Response<n><n>- the first three addup to $7<n>- the final three addup to $9<n>- so together they add up to $16<n>- the price for a large drink is $7.50<n>- <n>- the final two packs together would be ((16/2)= 8) <n>- the price for two 6 packs is 8*7.50 = $60<n>- the price per 6 pack is $25 dollars<n>

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Input: What is the first digit, in decimal form, of the second part of 15516?<n><n>### Output<n>1<n><n>### Instuctions:<n>#### How much would 70.9% of 828.5 cost at $2.50 per pound?<n><n>### Input<n>1. *70.9 %<n>2. *828.5<n>3. $2.50<n>4. Per Pound<n><n><n>### Output :<n>84.05<n><n>### Steples:<n>70.9 = 84/100<n>84 = 84/0.10 = 840<n>828.5 = 828.0 0.05<n>828.0 + 0.05 = 84<n>151.85-0.05 = (151.80+0.05)/2 = 84<n>840+0.015 = 8.425<n><n>### Input 1 :  What will be the next digit in the series : 3,29,6,41,4? <n><n>### Output Answer<n>7<n><n>### Input Answer<n>41<n><n>### Rationale :<n>7th digit of each series :<n>```<n>3 29 629 641 4<n>9 2 64 41 7 <n>12 6 48 41 5  <n>15 6 49 41

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where is a horse likely to live? Choices: A: Stable B: Race track C: Farm yard D: Arizona E: Michigan<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: Where might a horse enjoy the best weather? Choices: A) California B) Texas C) Kentucky D) Florida E) Missouri<n>Rationales: If the weather is too cold or too hot, the horse is likely to live indoors.<n>Kentucky:  Home of the Kentucky Derby. Kentucky also has cooler weather which is more suitable for outdoor horses.<n>Florida: Where it typically has 4-5 days of heat a week. The average daily temperature is about 78 degrees. It gets cold in the winter (40s and 50s).<n>Michigan:  Home of the Michigan International Speedway, a 1-mile horse racing track that has summer racing. The weather is variable.<n>California:  California gets very hot. California doesn’t get cold in the winter.<n>Texas:  Texas is warm year-round, although the temperatures are lower in the winter (45-55 degrees)<n>Arizona:  It is sunny all year long. It is considered to be a great place to move your horse (and get great weather)<n>E)  MO<n><n>### Demotestation:<n>Input:  What kind of horse would you find at a polo match?  Choices:  A)  Thoroughbred B)  Quarter horse<n>Rationales: Polo matches are held on snow, but most horses live where the temperature is around 70 degrees during the day.<n>Quarter horses tend to be about 14 hands high and weigh between 900 and 1000 pounds. Quarter horses are known for energy and speed.<n>Thoroughbreds are usually taller and faster than quarter horses:  heights of 15 and 16 hands, weighing between 1000 and 1200 pounds.<n><n>### Input : Which kind of horse wins the Kentucky Derby?<n><n>### Demoscene:<n>The Kentucky Derby is limited to 3-year-old thoroughbred horses, who race 1 1/4 miles at Churchill Downs (in Louisville, Kentucky). His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Rate = ______________________________________________________________.<n><n>Ratio = <n><n>#### <n><n>Answer: Rate and ratio are different terms.<n><n>Rate is a comparison or relation, and can be expressed as a ratio or percentage.  A rate is a fraction divided by a reciprocal of the same denominator (same number), and is often confused as a quantity that is proportional in a mathematical sense.<n><n>A rate is the relationship between two different numerical values that can be multiplied or divided into inverses.  (A 2:5 rate means one of those is shared, 2x5, 5x2, not multiplying a number of times two different numbers).<n><n>Ratio is used for many things, and is the relation between a set of numbers of the same units.<n><n>RATIO (mathematically speaking): is a formal relationship between three or more number (us

Choices:  A: cold hands B: wet floor C: health D: become wet E: dry skin<n><n>### Response:		<n>* A and E.<n>* A: cold hands because in the handwriting the word is made with straight lines that were done by a pencil. In the drawing it also looks like a cold hands has some red spots on hands, indicating that the hands might have some cold.<n>* E: dry skin because it looks like the handwriting, it's straight and clean, which implies that the hand was clean. Also the drawing shows that the skin was brown so its probably dry.<n><n>### Input:[2*m + 5](https://mathsisfun.com/fractions/add-fractions.html)<n><n>### Task:Write the fraction in simplest form.<n><n>### Answer:<n>It simplifies to 3:3 because we can cross multiply to get 2 *3 * m + 5 * 3 and in order to get it a whole number we have to cancel. 3:3 because both values add up to 8.<n>3/3 = 1 and 8/8 = 1<n><n>### Input<n>```html<n><!DOCTYPE html><n><n><html><n>  <head><n>    <meta charset="utf-8"><n>    <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=edge"><n>    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1"><n><n>    <!-- CSS --><n>    <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://code.getmdl.io/1.3.1/material.indigo-pink.min.css"><n>    <link rel='stylesheet' href='assets/stylesheets/style.styl' media='screen'><n>  </head><n><n>  <body><n><n>      \section{Snippet}<n><n>      \section{'Hello, World!' using Node}<n><n>      \begin{code}<n>      var bodyparser = require('body-parser');<n>      var express = require('express');<n>      var https = require('https');<n><n>      const expressServer = express();<n><n>      expressServer.use(express.static(__dirname))<n><n>      // bodyparser middleware<n>      expressServer.all('/*', bodyparsser({extended: true}));<n><n>      // index controller<n>      expressServer.get('/', (req,
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What is a student about to do if they are sitting in front of a number of black and white keys? Choices:  A: talk B: read book C: play piano D: study book E: study engineering<n><n>### Response:		What is a student about to<n>do if they are sitting in ______ in front of a number ______ black and white keys?<n><n>Rationales: A) When a student is sitting in front of a piano, they are about to<n>play music.<n><n>B) There does not any keys in front of student.<n><n>C) This does not make sense. A piano is not a book you read.<n><n>D) The students will study engineering, as it says in the answer choices.<n>"The correct answer is..." is an appropriate response.<n><n>### Input;  A tune will be written in music.<n>#### Fill in the blank with a word that completes the sentence as if it were a question.<n>The correct answer is: A tune is going to be written in ____________.._.<n><n>### Response;  The correct answer is: A ________________ is going to be written.<n>Rationales: There is no in front of a tune, so there is not enough information. A tune is not an individual piece of music, so it does not make sense. There is no going to in front of a tape, so there is not a time component. The correct answer is always ____________.<n><n>### Instructions: What is a person about to do if they have the key to a locked door? Choices:  a) Talk B) Look for key C) Read a book D) Call the police. E) Study engineering.<n>Rationales;  What is a person about  To do if they have the _______ of a ________.<n><n><n>### Response:"The Key" is the right answer.<n><n>### Correct Choices: Fill in the blank to complete the sentence: What is a person doing if they have the key of a car.<n><n>###  Rationale: Choice B is a key of a lock<n><n><n>### Choices: A: The  of a car.<n>B: The  of a <n><n>C: The  of the <n><n>D: The  of the piano.<n><n>E: The  of the door.<n><n>####  The of a car.<n>The correct answer to this question is:"The" of a car.<n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where would you find isopropol alcohol and safety glasses? It looked like there was only one way to cool the house.  The man ran as fast as he could and got as much water as he could and ran into the house. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What are adult people usually expected to do? Choices:  A: shake hands B: own property C: pay bills D: smoke E: talk to each other<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>### Input<n>How many days is each group for?<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>### Explanation:<n>Answer B<n><n>### Input The city of San Diego is known as the birthplace of California, or as the birthplace of Cac. Which one is it?  Choices: 1: a fruit b,2: a kind of bird. C: Ca, D; A<n><n>### rationale:<n><n>### Answer<n><n>### Ex:<n><n>### Instructions Use number sentences to evaluate each expression.<n><n>### Exercise 1 Find the greatest value of the rational expression.<n><n>## Exercise 2 Find the product of the rational expressions.<n><n>### Rationale:<n><n>## Exerc:<n><n>### Write each real number as a rational with denominator 9.<n><n>### ratioles<n><n>### Input : Write the following as inequations.<n><n>### Answer :<n><n>###<n><n>### Input 4.03 > 2.65<n>Answer: false True<n>###<n>####5.4114< 2.83<n>Answer: False True<n><n>### Input Write each integer as a repeating decimal.<n><n>###Answer :<n><n>###Rationale:<n><n>##Input :What did the farmer feed his pigs? Choices: 1) bread b,2) candy c, 3) cheese c, d) apples d<n><n>###Answer:<n><n>###Rationales:<n><n><n>##Input : What kind of animal is a moose? Choices: 2. elephant or E, 3. lion, 4. dog<n><n>###Answer<n><n>###Ratioles<n><n>##Input : How many boys and how many girls are in the soccer team? Choices: A: six and six B: three and seven C: seven and five D: five and six E=0<n><n>### Answer::<n><n>###Input : Write an equation that shows why you can’t put the puzzle together unless you put the pieces in groups of four.<n><n><n>###Ratio:<n>#### 1/4 + 1/4 = 2/4 <n><n>####1/4

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Dan said that getting in line was the best choice because it would lead to what? How many ewes does she have? ___<n><n>### Rationales:Given the information that she can have 11 lamb/cow,<n>which mean that 11 is the limit to have cow in one day<n><n>1. The owner bought 20 sheep (not lamb)<n>2. There are 174 sheep<n>3. Therefor the owner should have 174/11 = <<174/1= 15.9>> 15.9 sheeps/day<n>4.  The owner has 200 sheep, she kept for 11 days, after 11th day she should have 122 sheeps of 200 sheeps<n><n>### Answer: 122<n>

How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Why is grooming often recommended to greasy teens? Choices:  A: neatness B: selfishness C: mistakes D: cleanliness E: satisfaction<n><n>### Response:		The greasy teen will not get a job and would fail at an interview<n><n>### Input<n>Rent $120 / week for 15 weeks = rent of \$120 x 15 = \$1800 total rent.<n><n>#### \$1800<n>Answer:$1800<n>### Instruction<n>You should now be able to solve the problem if you were given the information in the following table.<n><n>### Table:<n>| Car renter | Number weeks | Total rent |<n>|-------------|--------------|------------|<n>|Jennie |11 |<<11=11>>11*30=<<11*30>=3100>>3100 |<n>|Bill |7 |<<7=7>>7*30=<<7*30>=210>>210 |<n>|Barb |8 |<<8=8>>8*30=<<8*30>=240>>240 |<n>|Mike |4 |<<4=4>>4*30=240|<n><n>### Instructions<n>Complete the following expression to evaluate the amount of interest due on the outstanding balance for a loan.<n><n>### Expression:<n><n>| | |<n>|------------- | ------------- |<n>| 4 | x |<n>| -12 | x |<n>| 27.5 | x |<n>| x | y |<n><n>### Answer:<n>4  x  -12  + 27.5 + x  x  = <<4  x -12  +27.5 +x  x=109.5 >><n>### Instrucciones<n>Complete each of the following equations.<n><n>### Equation:<n><n>| | x |<n>|-------------  | -------------  |<n>| 3 | x |<n>| = | / 2 |<n><n>### Equations:<n>|| x |<n>|| 3 |<n>|| = | / 2<n>|| x |<n>| x / 3 |<n><n>```<n>$2 + 7x = - 8x<n>32x = 124<n>x = 4<n>```<n>#### x = 4<n>#### x = 1/3<n><n>### Instream
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:When having food at a formal place, what do you usually do? Choices:  A: sit B: being sociable C: talk D: drinking E: medium<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### A: sit<n><n>#### A: sit
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Always wash your hands before eating, you don't want to get germs onto food and inside your what? Choices:  A: water B: doctor C: spread disease D: mouth E: ear<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>__A and D__<n><n>### The correct answer is:<n><n>###<n><n># Hints<n>```<n>There are multiple ways to complete this task. <n>It is your task to determine what the correct answer is.<n>```<n><n>#### 2<n>````<n>```bash<n># A B C D E<n>2>&1 | tee >(sed's/%//g' | column -s : -t)<n>```<n>```<n># A<n>```<n><n>#### E<n>```bash<n>$ tee /etc/profile | sed's/%/%e%/g'<n>```<n><n>#### L<n>```C++<n>string& str1(“&”), str2(“@”);<n>string str, str1;<n>getline (cin, str1);<n>getline (str, str1);<n>```<n><n>#### W<n>```C++<n>#include <iostream><n>#include <cmath> // trigonometer functions<n>int answer;<n>using namespace std;<n>int a, b, c;<n>cin >> a >> b >> c;<n>double ang;<n>ang = tan(a) * tan(b);<n>cin >> ang;<n>if (ang > c)<n>	answer = b + (180/pi - c);<n>else {<n>	answer = b - (pi/2 - c) + pi/4;<n>}<n>```<n><n>#### H<n>```bash<n>#!/bin/bash <n># The syntax "$1" and "$#" are both to refer to the first argument received<n>x="${1}" # The x is saved in a variable (x)<n>y="${#1}" # The numbeer of times of argument received was saved in a variable (y)<n>echo "$x" >temp.txt<n>for i in $(seq 1 $y) # The number of arguments received was used in a loop to get all the arguments stored in temp.txt as its first command<n>do <n>echo "$x" >>temp.txt <n>done<n>```<n><n>#### M<n>```bash<n>#/bin/bash<n>#!/bin<n>#!bin/bash<n>#!!!!!!!!!!!!<n>#!!!!!!!!!!!!!!<n>#!!!!!<n>cd /src/hackathon-2/CSE-355<n>mkdir Hackathon<n>###!

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:What is someone likely to feel after receiving a gift that is not common? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. He wants to drive to the store, then to a meeting, and then to the gym. If the drive to the store is 30 minutes long, and the drive from the mall to the gym is 50 minutes long, then what is the total driving distance he will be traveling?<n><n>### Response, in the following problem: The rancher will travel a total of 80 minutes.<n><n>### Question:The rancher has to drive for 40 minutes to go to the store. He has to drive for 20 minutes to go to a meeting. Then he has to drive for 10 minutes to go to gym. How much will it cost to fill up his tank?<n><n>### Answer: It will cost him $49.02 to fill up his tank.<n><n>### Rationale: If the drive to the mall is 30 minutes and it takes him 20 minutes to drive from the mall, then that leaves 10 minutes to drive from mall to gym. If he only drives for 10 minutes, then he needs to fill up his tank 2 times.<n><n>### Response to the rationale: That’s all wrong. The drive to the gym is equal to the drive to a store.<n><n>### Solution: He needs to drive for 41 minutes and fill up 3 times.<n><n>## Expected Results:<n>#### Answer to problem #1 and #4: The answer to these problems will be 310<n>#### Answer to problem#2 and #8: The answer to these will be 400.<n>#### Answer to problem 5: The answer will be 300<n>#### Answer to #3, #6, and #7: The answer will be $800<n>#### Answer #10: The answer to problem #10 will be $49.04<n><n>## What Did You Do?:<n>I went through all the problems and worked through all the problem to make sure I answered them correctly.<n>

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:A person who wants to make more at their job but can't will often need to find a what? Choices:  A: own house B: better job C: win lottery D: save money E: feel safe<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Input:"A" for a house. "B" for a better job. "C" for win lottery. "D" for save money. "E" for feel safe.<n><n>### Response:"C" for win the lottery.<n><n>### Rationale: A person who wants to make  more at their job  but  cannot  will often need to find  a what? Choices are what I think is the correct answer.<n><n>### If you need to ask a question about your response make sure you start it with I don't know I am confused how I am suppose to answer.<n><n>## Etiquette and Conversation:<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Task: Write an original conversation using the words that were provided in the list.  Use a variety of sentences to express different information using the words in parentheses.<n><n>### Example:<n>Loretta: (hi there) (I am glad to see you) (good to see you) (please sit down) (what did you come home from school for) (not much) (I forgot my book) (not bad) (what happened) (I just spilled spaghetti on my math homework) (Oh no) (please don’t cry) (I understand) (yes I do) (I will clean it up) <n>Loretta:  (it is a mess) (I don’t think this will work) (Oh no)  (not again) (thank you) (I will help) (not a problem) (I am sorry I could not clean spaghetti off my math homework and I promise I will try) (my homework is now finished I just needed to add a little more water) (that would be good).<n>Loretta: Do you want to wash your math homework as well? A: (I think it would be good) B: (I can do that) C: (It is clean) D: (I cannot do that I promised myself I would not wash my math homework again) E: (thank you).<n>Loretta A: (good bye) B: (have fun).<n><n>### Task<n>Write a response like the following conversation about  finding and keeping the correct words  from a list.<n><n>I am glad to see how much you
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where would you find fungus growing on something made from milk? Choices:  A: eyes B: biology laboratory C: shower stall D: old cheese E: decaying matter<n><n>### Response:		<n>If there is decaying matter (ex: dried out cheese) then the fungus would grow on that as you would typically expect to see it somewhere.<n><n>#### <n>Answer: (E)<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>### Input:Where would you find a metal rod in most people's preferred method of transportation? Choices:  A: airplane B: construction site C: shops D: engine E: broken bone<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>>**B**<n><n>### Why?:<n>A, B,C, and D are not metal, so they aren't rods for the transportation.<n><n>### Why isn't E selected?:<n>As the rod is more likely to break, it wouldn't be there.<n><n>---<n><n>### Input :<n><n>### How did 2900-900 = 2000?<n><n>### How is 13/7 > 2/7?<n><n>---<n><n>125+75+25+5= <<125+775+225+55=415>>415<n><n>125-75-25-5= <<1205+75-225+52=221>>221<n><n>1175-227= <<1305-351=954>>954<n><n>---<n><n>5x13 + 2x5 + 1=10<n><n>+1-1= <<+1-1=0>>0<n><n>11-1= <<11-1=10>>10<n><n>11+1= <<10 1=11>>11<n><n>11= <<11=1>>1<n><n>---<n><n>---<n><n>[Click here for practice quiz](https://www.wolframalpha.com/q/what-is-the-answer-to-20x17)<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.
